loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to expand her food kiosk business

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to start a milk shop business

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to start a business of selling used clothes.

loan.name: Comfort

texts.en: Madam Comfort O. of Coro Fashion de Paradise is a fashion designer. She is the lady in a white scarf wearing a beautiful smile with her apprentices at work. She sews really nice clothes but on a small scale. It has been her desire for quite a long time to produce on a large scale but does not have the means. She is very much happy and grateful for this help kiva is offering and is therefore seeking a loan of $775.00 to buy more machines, materials, sewing threads, needles etc. Madam Comfort O. will not rest on her oars when given this loan and will work very hard because her dream has come true.

loan.use: working capital

loan.name: Salomey

texts.en: Madam Salomey O. sells kitchen supplies including wooden pestles. Pestles work hand-in-hand with wooden mortars:these are used in pounding \\\"fufu\\\" in the Ghanaian society. She wants to include other items such as woven baskets, mortars, canes, fans(\\\"papa\\\" as called in the local dialect). She needs a loan of $700.00 from Kiva to help include these items in her trade. She has skills in loan management and simple record keeping from KSF TEACH product and can therefore manage this loan very well.

loan.use: re-stocking capital

loan.name: Esther

texts.en: Madam Esther Martety\\\'s hot porridge is enjoyed by lots of people in her community. She commences business early in the morning and move from home to home. She always has her customers waiting hungrily for her. Due to the small sizes of her cooking pots and pans, she is not able to prepare in large quantities. If she were to do that her porridge will not go bad, everything will be bought before she returns home. She is therefore appealing to Kiva to grant her a loan of $700.00 to help her cook larger quantities.

loan.use: working capital

loan.name: Rasim

texts.en: This young man is a well known joiner in Sumgait city. Rasim has been working in the joiner\'s shop since 2005. He married, has 2 children. This 30-year-old Rasim is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli. He is hard worker. He would like to borrow a loan amount of $1200 from Normicro because he wants to buy 1 planer and additional board materials.

loan.use: To buy 1 planer and board materials

loan.name: Salomey

texts.en: Madam Salomey T. lives in Dodowa, a community in the Dangme West district of the Greater Accra region of Ghana. She sells mainly woven baskets on retail basis. Selling baskets alone is not enough for Madam Salomey T., she wants to include more items in her trade. Her challenge is how to access capital to expand her trade. She is therefore seeking a loan of $700.00 from Kiva to help take her business to a higher level and also to improve her standard of living.

loan.use: working capital

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to expand his tomato farming business.

loan.name: Gifty

texts.en: Glorious Fashion Home is owned by Miss Gifty A.. She is a fashion designer who also sells items such as earrings, ribbons, slippers, polyester materials etc. She lacks sewing machines and other equipment like scissors, threads, needles in her shop. She also has lots of customers. The lack of these machines cause delay in meeting the demand of her customers. She is therefore seeking a loan of $775.00 from Kiva. Miss Gifty A. is a very hardworking lady and can pay back this loan.

loan.use: working capital

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to acquire masonary tools

loan.name: Elbrus

texts.en: Elbrus has been engaged in food distribution for the past three years. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli region, relocated to Sumgait city. He has his own Mini market. This 28-year-old single man is a hard worker. Having borrowed a loan for $400 from Normicro to build a small shop, he borrowed his second loan of $800 to buy foodstuffs like sugar, tea, rice, etc. His third loan of $1000 was used to expand and build a food market. Now he wants a loan of $1200 to buy textile goods.

loan.use: To buy textile goods

loan.name: Balaoglan

texts.en: 53-year-old Balaoglan with his 3 children settled in Sumgait city. His familys living condition is not good enough. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Lachin region. Since 2001 Balaoglan has been engaged in butchery to improve his familys living condition. As he did not have enough funds, he could not develop his business well enough in the beginning. Having borrowed 3 loans ($350; $450; $800) from Normicro Balaoglan significantly expanded his business, bought 11 calves, achieved progress in his business and increased his family income. The loans were paid back timely. He applies for a loan amount of $1200 to buy 18 calves.

loan.use: To buy 18 calves

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to expand her hair salon business

loan.name: Tavakkul

texts.en: Tavakkul was born in 1961 in Gazax region of Azerbaijan. Tavakkul has been engaged in this business for 8 years. After wedding he settled with his family in Sumgait. He is married, has 2 children. rent a medicine-chest and to start selling medicinal preparations. The family income is rather limited. Now he had difficulties with cash, he needs a loan amount of $1200 has been provided with the medicinal preparations by firm.

loan.use: To buy the medicinal preparations

loan.name: Ernestina

texts.en: Madam Ernestina S. lives in Kojokrom. She is a very hardworking woman and a wholesaler of fresh tomatoes from Techiman, Bolgatanga, or Burkina Faso. She is in dire need of capital to support business. She is seeking a loan of $800.00 from kiva to enable her accomplish this aim.

loan.use: working capital

loan.name: Theresa

texts.en: Great Provider Enterprise is managed by Madam Theresa A., a very hardworking lady. She purchases food items mainly maize and yam from Techiman for resale in Takoradi. She is seeking a loan of $800.00 from Kiva to grow her business. She is willing to work harder than she is doing now and very capable of paying back the loan.

loan.use: working capital

loan.name: Efe

texts.en: Amo Farms located at Effiakuma North, close to Coco Villa is run by Madam Efe A.. It used to be a farm with a maximum of 600 birds at a time. It is no longer so due to financial difficulties and needs capital to bring in new birds. She is therefore seeking a loan of $800.00 from kiva to re-stock her farm with birds and for effective management.

loan.use: re-stocking capital

loan.name: Veronica

texts.en: Madam Veronica D. is an inhabitant of Effiakuma (1st Bus Stop). She deals in general provisions and food items. She has lots of customers and a high demand for her goods. She however, needs capital to stock up more items. She has no source of finance and is therefore seeking a loan of $700.00 from Kiva. She is a very hardworking woman and looking forward to receiving a positive response.

loan.use: re-stocking capital

loan.name: Comfort

texts.en: Enso Nyame Ye Ventures is a very vibrant enterprise which is doing well. Madam Comfort B. lives at Nite Market in Effiakuma. She buys maize from Techiman and Kumasi for resale in Takoradi. She needs working capital of $800.00 from Kiva to expand her business. She is hopeful that business will do even better than it is now when given the financial backing.

loan.use: working capital

loan.name: Vincentia

texts.en: Madam Vincentia H. is a wholesaler of fresh tomatoes. She buys tomatoes from Techiman, Bolgatanga, or Burkina Faso. She needs money to increase her stock. She is therefore seeking a loan of $800.00 from Kiva and promises to pay back in due time. Her commitment to hardwork cannot be doubted.

loan.use: working capital

loan.name: Comfort

texts.en: Madam Comfort M. trades in sewing accessories. A lot of fashion designers buy from her. She wish she could increase stock in her shop but lacks financial assistance. Madam Connie is seeking a loan of $500.00 from kiva to help expand her shop.

loan.use: working capital

loan.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Mister Miguel has had his business in fruit sales for 15 years, he is married and has one child that is currently studying his university career. He decided to work on this business because the salary he earned while he worked for a company was not enough to cover his son\'s studies. On the other hand he had always liked sales, and he usually visited the local markets to sell. He requies a loan in the amount of $925 which will be used for the purchase of merchandise and to be able to expand his small business.

He has struggled a great deal to be able to provide his son a better education with the hopes of giving him a better future and patrimony. You can help Miguel in the realization of his goals. Make your decision and support him.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Miguel tiene con su negocio de venta de frutas una antigedad de 15 aos, es casado y tiene un hijo que se encuentra estudiando una carrera universitaria. El decidi dedicarse a esta actividad porque son el sueldo que ganaba como empleado de la empresa para la que trabajaba no le alcanza para poder costear los estudios de su hijo. Por otra parte a el siempre le han gustado las ventas, actualmente realiza su actividad en mercados rodantes. El requiere de un prstamo por la cantidad de $ 925 DLLS , mismo que utilizar para la compra de mercanca y poder hace crecer como microempresario. El ha luchado mucho para poder brindarle a su hijo la mejor educacin con el objetivo que el tenga un mejor futuro y patrimonio que el que hoy por hoy puede brindarle. T puedes ayudar a Miguel para el logro de sus objetivos, decdete y apyalo.

loan.use: purchase merchandise

loan.name: Vugar

texts.en: Vugar sells bags in centre of trade. He was born in 1973. This man is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Kalbajar region, settled in Khirdalan settlement, married, has 2 children. He borrowed a loan of $400 and bought bags. For the first time he borrowed a loan $800 to buy a lot of handbags. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to expand the area of a shop, which is rented by Vugar

loan.use: To expand the area of a shop

loan.name: Taryel

texts.en: This young man has his own grocery store. He is 29, married, has a child, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Kalbajar region Djomerd village. He temporary lives with his family in Khirdalan settlement. He applied for a loan amount of $800 to expand his business. Taryel needs a loan of $1000 to be engaged in pub business and to open his own billiard-hall and to open his own billiard-hall.

loan.use: To be busy with pub business

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy spraying machine

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Business expansion

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Buy tools and accessories

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Buy tools and Car accessories.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Buy Car wash machine

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Re stock the shop

loan.name: Esther

texts.en:
Miss Esther moved to her current home 36 years ago, in the city of Santa Catarina in the state of Neuvo Leon. Back then she was recently married and she and her husband had just taken possesion of their house, bought on credit. They soon realized that Raul\'s salary was not enough to cover the costs of the house and the monthly payments due, so they decided to invest in a small business and that is how their grocery store, one they still have today, came to be. Their project has helped them through difficult times and above all they were able to provide a better quality of life and a good education to their children.

Their journey has not been an easy one and they have had to overcome many significant obstacles, but with the mutual support in their family has made all this possible. Now Miss Esther needs a credit of $475 to purchase merchandise to increase the selection of items to offer her clients. You can help them continue to and grow. Do not doubt any longer. Your generosity can be their great support. She and her family will be thankful.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Doa Esther lleg al ogar en el que hoy vive hace 36 aos, en la localidad de Santa Catarina, en el Estado de Nuevo Len. En ese entonces estaba recin casada y apenas ella y su esposo haban adquirido la casa a crdito. Al ver que el salario de Ral no alcanzaba a cubrir los gastos de la casa y el pago mensual de sta, decidieron invertir en un pequeo negocio y fue as como naci la tienda de Abarrotes que hasta la fecha tienen. Este proyecto le ha ayudado en momentos difciles y sobre todo a brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y una buena educacin.

El camino no ha sido fcil y han tenido que vencer obstculos importantes, pero con el apoyo mutuo de toda la familia los han podido vencer. Ahora Doa Esther necesita de un crdito de $475 DLLS para poder comprar mercanca y tener ms variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes. Tu puedes ayudarlos a continuar y acrecer, no lo dudes ms, tu generosidad puede ser de mucho apoyo, ella y su familia te lo van agradecer.

loan.use: Purchase merchandise

loan.name: Blanca Nelly

texts.en:
In the city of Santa Catarina in the state of Nuevo Leon lives Blanca. She sells shoes by catalogue and has been doing so for the past 8 years. She is married and has one son that is currently studying. She started with the business because she liked sales and she wanted to help her husband, as she has always been a very active and very devoted mother of her family. The project she started was of great help, and it is thanks to this that her son has been able to continue his studies.

Today Blanca requires a loan in the amount of $475 that will be used to purchase merchandise to increase her inventory and therefore increase her sales. Her clients will have a greater selection to choose from. You can help Blanca continue to grow. You only need to decide now, do not doubt any longer. Your generosity will grant this family a better wellbeing.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

En la localidad de Santa Catarina, en el estado de Nuevo Len vive Blanca, ella se dedica a la venta de calzado por catlogo y tiene con esta actividad una antigedad de 8 aos, es casada y tiene un hijo, el cual se encuentra estudiando. Ella inici con el negocio por que le gustan las ventas y para poder ayudar a su esposo, ya que siempre ha sido una persona muy activa y comprometida con su familia. Este proyecto que ella inici ha sido de mucha ayuda, pues gracias a esto su hijo a podido seguir estudiando.

En este momento Blanca requiere un prstamo por la cantidad de $475 DLLS , que utilizar para la compra de mercanca, incrementar sus existencia, y de esta manera poder percibir un incremento en las ventas, pues los clientes podrn tener ms variedad. Tu puedes apoyar a Blanca a continuar creciendo, solo hace falta que te decidas, no lo dudes ms, tu generosidad puede hacer que esta familia tenga un mejor bienestar.

loan.use: purchase merchandise

loan.name: Mara Cecilia

texts.en:
Maria Cecilia is mother of two daughters, both of which are currently studying. She is married and lives in the city of Santa Catarina. It has been 5 years since she started her own business renting gowns for school events - she has always been interested in business. This generates an extra income for herself and it is enough to cover the expenses that her husband\\\'s salary cannot afford. For this reason she, day by day, struggles to keep and expand her business.

The love of her family and the support she gets from them has permitted Maria Cecilia to keep going with her project. She now needs a loan in the amount of $925 that she will repay in a term of 8-16 months. You can help her grow and this way, you can contribute towards a better quality of life for her daughters and permit the completion of their education. Do not doubt any longer, support her.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Mara Cecilia es madre de dos hijas, ambas estn estudiando, esta casada vive en la localidad de Santa Catarina. Ella desde hace 5 aos que inici con su propio negocio de renta de vestuarios para eventos escolares, pues siempre ha tenido inters por lo negocios. Por su parte esto le generar ingresos extras que sern suficientes para cubrir ciertos gastos que con el sueldo de su esposo no pueden cubrir. Es por esto que ella si da a da lucha para mantener y hacer crecer su actividad.

El amor a su familia y el apoyo que recibe de ellos es lo que ha permitido que Mara Cecilia siga adelante con su proyecto. Ella ahora necesita e un crdito por la cantidad de $925 DLLS, mismos que cubrir en un plazo de 8-16 meses. T puedes ayudarla a crecer y de esta manera contribuir a una mejor calidad de vida para sus hijas y la culminacin de sus estudios. No lo dudes ms y apyala.

loan.use: purchase merchandise

loan.name: Izafa

texts.en: Izafa is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin. She settled with his family in Sumgait city. She is 41. She married and has 3 children. Izafa is the only breadwinner in family. Having borrowed the loan amount of $500 from Normicro she built the grocery store. The second time she borrowed $800 to rent a shop. The loans were paid back timely. She applies for the loan $1000 to expand the area of shop and to increase the food assortments.

loan.use: To expand the area of shop and to increase the food assortments

loan.name: Carmen Amalia

texts.en:
Carmen is a very hard working and engaging woman. It has been 9 years since she started her small store, running it from her own home. She is married and she has three children, all of whom help her with the business. Her primary goal has always been to financially support her husband and to put their children first. Their children are currently completing their education. With this business Carmen and her family have been able to overcome difficult times, and now she needs a loan in the amount of $925 for the purchase of merchandise to increase her selection and generate greater sales.

You can become part of Carmen and her family\'s efforts. Help them continue on and help them grow. The choice is yours. Your generosity is of great help to them. They are grateful to you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Carmen es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, desde hace 9 aos que inici con una pequea tienda de abarrotes en su propio domicilio. Es casada y tiene 3 hijos, quienes le ayudan con el negocio. Su principal objetivo siempre ha sido poder apoyar a su esposo econmicamente y salir adelante con sus hijos, quienes estn estudiando. Con este negocio Carmen y su familia han podido superar tiempos difciles, ahora ella necesita un crdito por la cantidad de $925 dlares para poder comprar mercanca y surtir mejor su tienda de abarrotes para que le genere ms ingresos.

T puedes ser parte de los logros de Carmen y su familia, aydalos a continuar y seguir creciendo, la decisin sta en tus manos, tu generosidad es de mucho apoyo para ellos. No lo sudes ms y decdete, ellos te lo agradecen.

loan.use: Purchase merchandise

loan.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia lives in the city of Santa Catarina. She sells shoes by catalogue, a business she has had for 6 years now. She is married, her husband works for a company, and they have two daughters that are currently completing their studies. Cynthia started hr business because she likes sales, but at the same time, through her business, she has been able to actively support her family economy. She requires a loan of $925 to purchase more merchandise and therefore increase her sales.

Responsibility, proactiveness, and hard work are the charactistics that define Cynthia, and they are what have permitted her to keep up her business for now six years. It has not been easy but she has succeeded. It is now the time that you can help her to keep her business and keep it growing. She and her family sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Cynthia vive en la localidad de Santa Catarina, ella se dedica a la venta de calzado por catlogo, tiene con este negocio una antigedad de 6 aos. Ella esta casada, su esposo trabaja de empleado en una empresa y tiene dos hijas, quienes se encuentran actualmente estudiando. Cynthia inici su negocio por que le gustan las ventas y al mismo tiempo, con esta actividad, puede ayudar de forma activa en la economa familiar. Ella requiere de un prstamo de $925 DLLS para poder comprar ms mercanca y as incrementar sus ventas.

Responsabilidad, proactividad y trabajo, son caractersticas que definen a Cynthia, mismas que la han llevado a permanecer con su negocio ya seis aos, no ha sido fcil pero lo ha logrado. Ahora es momento de que puedas apoyarla, aydala acrecer y a continuar, ella y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loan.use: purcahse merchandise

loan.name: Mohtaram

texts.en: Mohtaram is 41 years old. He was born in Gazax region of Azerbaijan. After wedding he settled with his family in Sumgait city. Now he has 3 children and he is the only breadwinner in family. In the beginning his business he rented a small tea-house. Now he has rented cafe. On a dinner break workers have dinner here and clients are very happy with the given dishes. He applies for the loan $600 to built his own cafe.

loan.use: To built his own cafe

loan.name: Israfil

texts.en: Israfil is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli region. With 2 children he settled in Sumgait city. He has been engaged in this business for 8 years. Having borrowed the loan amount of $400 from Normicro he built his own shop. The second time he borrowed $800 and bought foodstuffs: sugar, tea, rice and etc. For the third time he borrowed a loan of $1000 to built the food market. Now he has own food market. Israfil needs loan amount of $1200 to buy the new refrigerator.

loan.use: To buy the new refrigerator

loan.use: Buy spare parts

loan.use: Re stock the business

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Restock her shop

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Business expansion

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Business expansion

loan.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a mother of 4 and is 39 years old. She has been engaged in the clothing trade for past 5 years. She works in and around the surburbs of Sekondi. Some of the merchandise includes ready-to-wear clothes for children and adults as well as suiting materials. She has undergone the TEACH program of KRABAN SUPPORT FOUNDATION. In addition she is being assisted to develop a business plan as a means of formalizing her operations. She is therefore requesting KIVA to support her with a loan of $1,000 to serve as working caital.

loan.use: Working Capital

loan.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantal D., born in 1972 in Gbodjom in the Prefecture des Lacs in southwest Togo, is single with two (02) children and one sister in her care. She comes from a very poor family and did not have the chance to pursue thorough studies. She became involved then, by her own means, in the trade of basic need food products. To strengthen her business, she benefitted from a loan of $350, which she managed well and repaid without incident. Today, this business continues to grow and necessitates increased loan capital which is unavailable.

To achieve this, Mrs. Chantal D. is asking for a loan of $1000 which will serve to build up sufficient stocks of food products regularly asked for by her customers; this will avoid stock shortages. She is a woman who has perfectly mastered her business and has the capacity to manage this loan, which will surely have a very positive impact on the profitability of her business and considerably improve her and her familys living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame D. Chantal, ne en 1972 Gbodjom dans la Prfecture des Lacs au Sud-est du Togo, est clibataire avec deux (02) enfants et une sur charge. Elle est issue dune famille trs pauvre et na pas eu la chance de faire des tudes pousses. Elle se lana alors dans le commerce des produits alimentaires de premires ncessits avec ses propres moyens. Pour renforcer ses activits, elle avait bnfici dun crdit de $350 quelle avait su bien grer et rembourser sans incident. Aujourdhui, cette activit prend de plus en plus de lampleur et ncessite un fonds de crdit plus important dont elle ne dispose pas.

Pour se faire, Madame D. Chantal, sollicite un crdit de $1000 qui servira constituer suffisamment des stocks de produits alimentaires rgulirement demands par sa clientle afin dviter les ruptures de stock. Cest une femme qui matrise parfaitement son commerce, a la capacit de bien grer ce prt qui aura coup sr un impact trs positif sur la rentabilit de son activit et amliorera considrablement les conditions de vie de sa familiale.

loan.use: To buy food products

payment.comment:
Chantal thanks sincerely KIVA and all those who have contributed to her project funding which allows her today to increase her activities and automatically her incomes to her proper living conditions improvement and those of her family. May Almighty and Merciful God bless you, and rendered it to you everlastingly!!!
The credit is repaying normally and without any incident at this moment

loan.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Mrs. Jeanne A. was born on January 27, 1976 in Lom, where she pursued her primary studies. Her education was abruptly ended in secondary school because of lack of support. She then left to stay with an aunt, whose business she helped out with. This aunt sent her to a sewing apprenticeship. Currently married and the mother of one (01) child, she runs her dressmaking business wth great difficulty because she does not have the necessary material, and her unemployed husband is also unable to help her. The only sewing machine she uses was lent to her by a friend. Based on the quality of her work, she is increasingly asked for by an insistent clientele whom she is unable to satisfy in time. This situation risks creating a crisis of confidence among her customers unless she can quickly equip herself better.

Thus, she is asking for a loan of $950 which will allow her to open a shop and to acquire 3 sewing machines in order to serve her clientele more quickly and facilitate the training of her two (02) apprentices. Such finances would considerably enlarge her business and improve her living conditions on the economic and domestic fronts.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Jeanne est ne le 27 Janvier 1976 Lom o elle ft ses tudes primaires. Sa scolarit fut brusquement arrte au collge faute de moyens. Elle partit alors rester chez une tante quelle aida dans ses activits commerciales. Cette dernire lenvoya en apprentissage de couture. Aujourdhui marie et mre dun (01) enfant, elle exerce son mtier de couturire avec beaucoup de difficult parce que ne disposant du matriel ncessaire et son mari sans emploi ne peut non plus laider. La seule machine coudre quelle utilise lui a t prte par une amie. De par la qualit de ses prestations, elle est de plus en plus sollicite par une clientle aussi exigeante quelle narrive pas satisfaire temps. Cette situation risque de crer une crise de confiance avec ses clients si elle narrive pas vite mieux squiper.

Aussi, sollicite-t-elle un crdit de $950 qui lui permettra douvrir un atelier et dacqurir 3 machines coudre afin de servir sa clientle plus rapidement et faciliter la formation ses deux (02) apprenties. Un tel financement va accrotre considrablement ses activits et amliorer ses conditions de vie sur le plan conomique et familial.

loan.use: To open a shop and to acquire 3 sewing machines

loan.name: Sergey And Natasha

texts.en:
Sergey, 35, and his wife Natasha have a teenage daughter age 13. They are both Technical school graduates and have been in the shoe retail business for more than 5 years. Sergey and Natasha started in retail as hired market vendors. They are both industrious hard-workers. Through integrity and persevarance they were able to save some money and start their own shoe sales business. Loans recieved from Nadiya Ukraine have promoted the growth of their business. They purchased two kiosks at one of the local markets and now manage them successfully and efficiently. The loans have also helped Sergey and Natasha purchase a new apartment and increase the well-being of their family. Sergey and Natasha are requesting a loan to expand the assortment of shoes and boots they have available to sell. Winter season in Ukraine means low temperatures which guarantee growing demand for the footwear Sergey and Natasha offer. This loan will give them a chance to purchase more high quality, stylish, leather shoes and warm, comfortable boots. Having a variety of available footwear in their kiosks will definitely attract more potential clients. This loan will help Sergey and Natasha increase their inventory to cater to an ever increasing number of customers and promote stable expansion for their business.

(35) - (13). - . 5 . . . . , , . , . . , . , , . , , . . , , .

loan.use: To expand the assortment of shoes and boots

loan.name: Igor And Marina

texts.en:
Igor and Marina Kovhal are married with three kids ages 10, 12 and 15. It has always been hard to meet the needs of a big family in Ukraine. To provide for their family, Igor and Marina decided to start their own small business selling jean clothing for children. Loans from Nadiya Ukraine have helped Igor and Marina purchase a kiosk in the market and expand their clothing sales business. Through persistence, hard work, and further loans the couple have had the opportunity to start another business selling sinks, faucets, pipes, and heaters. Igors natural talent as a technician make him a good entrepreneur in the area of heating system sales, installation, and warranty service. Igor and Marina would like a loan to purchase heaters, boilers, and related plumbing equipment. Most smaller towns in Ukraine have heat and hot running water only in the winter season about a three month period. Good quality boilers, heating systems, and plastic pipes will always be in high demand. This loan will not only help Igor and Marinas business grow, but it will also help meet the needs of their community, bringing warmth and comfort to many homes.

, - 10, 12 15 . . , , . . , , , . . , , . . , . , .

loan.use: To purchase heaters, boilers and plumbing equipment

loan.name: Agatha

texts.en: Agatha is 40 years old with one child. She prepares hot snacks like Milo,Cocoa,Coffee and Oats for port workers in front of the family house. She has had a 40% increase in sales over the past 6 months after undergoing the TEACH learning sessions from KRABAN SUPPORT FOUNDATION. There are good prospects for the business as demand is very high. She therefore seeks KIVA to support her with a loan to serve as working capital.

loan.use: Working Capital

loan.name: Forzia

texts.en: Forzia is 38 years old and a mother of 5. She operates a chop bar in the Central Business District of the city. Recently, she acqiured a larger store where she currently operates her business. Having benefited from the TEACH sessions of KRABAN SUPPORT FOUNDATION she is putting together a business plan to help grow the business. She is therefore seeking assistance from KIVA to procure bigger cooking utensils to meet the higher demand.

loan.use: Working Capital

loan.name: Korkor

texts.en: Korkor is 56 years and a mother of 7 children. She deals in bulk sales of spices mostly hot pepper in the Central Business District. She also engages in retailing her merchandise in other major markets outside her location. She intends to stock up for the current season which runs through June,2007. Presently, she is undergoing the TEACH sessions of KRABAN SUPPORT FOUNDATION. She is seeking the loan from KIVA to procure her supplies.

loan.use: Working Capital

loan.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 42 years old. She lives with her husband their 5 children who are all in school. She operates an electronic retail store in the centre of the city. Her merchandise include hi-fi systems, used refridgerators,deep freezers, television sets and other home appliances. She has a large clientele from the out-lying towns and villages. She is willing to re-stock some of the items mentioned above as well as mobile phones. She is seeking KIVA\'s assistance to undertake this vision.

loan.use: Working Capital

loan.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy is 45 years and a mother of 2. She sells her merchandise in the main market. She has done this business over the last 8 years. The merchandise includes suiting materials for both men and women as well as children. She also deals in ready-to-wear dresses for children. The recent Christmas season gave her very encouraging sales. Therefore she would like to add other items like mensware and shoes. She therefore seeks KIVA\'S assistance to diversify the product line. She completed the TEACH sessions last November from KRABAN SUPPORT FOUNDATION.

loan.use: Working Capital

loan.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a mother of 2 at the age of 30. She sells alcoholic drinks and locally-brewed gin. She is located in a predominantly lower middle class community, as such, patronage for her products is very high. A lot of social activities take place over the weekends which invariably create a market for her business. She has undergone the TEACH sessions organised by KRABAN SUPPORT FOUN-DATION. She therefore seeks KIVA\'S assistance to stock up products. With this she will be able to enjoy regular deliveries from her suppliers.

loan.use: Working Capital

loan.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 47 years and has 1 child. She sells food products in an area that has a lot of salaried workers. She sells local food items like gari,corn dough,cassava dough and canned foods. She also deals in fresh produce like plantains,cocoyams,yams,and cassava. Due to the high demand for these items, Rose is sometimes unable to satisfy all her clients adequately. She decided to partake in the TEACH sessions of KRABAN SUPPORT FOUDATION to equip her properly for the running of her store. With this background, she seeks the KIVA loan to procure more food items from her supplers to meet customers\' demand.

loan.use: Working Capital

loan.name: Lyudmila

texts.en:
Lyudmila is married. She has two sons and one grandson. Her elder boy is happily married, younger one will graduate from school this year. Lyudmila has a kiosk selling clothing at the Central city market. Lyudmila is an optimist. She thanks God for making her business sustainable and successful. Her cheerful personality and unique ability to guess customer preferences make loyal clients come back to her again and again. Lyudmila has been a Nadiya Ukraine client for about a year. She has always been very prompt with loan repayment and has not had a single late payment. Lyudmila would like to get the above mentioned amount to expand the assortment of goods for the winter season. She wants to purchase warm clothing of different sizes to meet her customer demands. Rich experience in retail, good location of her business at the busy Central Market and variety of clothes for men, women and children will guarantee stable income for Lyudmila. The loan will not only help Lyudmila get good profit and promote growth of her business, but also give her an opportunity to save some money and pay her younger sons college fees after he enters university this summer.

. . , . , . . , . . . . , . , . , , . , , .

loan.use: To increase stock for winter season

loan.name: Aml

texts.en:
Mrs. Aml A., born in 1964 in Azov in Benin, is married and has three (03) children and (02) people in her charge. Her husband, a bicycle mechanic with irregular income, is unable to satisfy the basic needs of the family. So, the majority of household expenses rest on Mrs. Aml A.s shoulders, who cannot truly improve her life with her small business selling food and other products if she does not benefit from a more stable capital source. Still, it is necessary to recognize her seriousness and rigour in management. This was confirmed by her first loan of $300, obtained and repaid on time without incident, despite her precarious financial and family situation. She exudes confidence and deserves to be supported economically.

To enlarge her business, Mrs. A. is currently asking for a loan of $850, which will allow her to stock up on general food products and to open a telephone booth next to her shop display. This will strengthen and increase her sales and her income, which will serve to improve her living conditions and those of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Aml, ne en 1964 Azov au Bnin, est marie et mre de trois (03) enfants et deux (02) personnes en charge. Son mari, un mcanicien 2 roues aux revenus irrguliers narrive pas satisfaire les besoins vitaux de sa famille. Ainsi, la plupart des charges du mnage reposent-elles sur Madame A. Aml qui ne peut pas rellement sen sortir avec son petit commerce dalimentation gnrale et de produits divers si elle ne bnficie pas dun fonds de commerce plus consistant. Toutefois, il faut reconnatre son srieux et sa rigueur en matire de gestion. Ceci sest confirm travers son premier crdit de $ 300 obtenu et rgulirement rembours sans incident malgr sa situation financire et familiale trs prcaires. Elle nourrit confiance et mrite dtre soutenue dans ses activits conomiques. Pour accrotre ses activits, Madame A. sollicite aujourdhui un crdit de $850 qui lui permettra de sapprovisionner en produits dalimentation gnrale et douvrir une cabine tlphonique ct de son talage. Ceci renforcera et augmentera son chiffre daffaires et de facto ses revenus qui serviront amliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loan.use: To stock up on general food products and to open a telephone booth.

loan.name: Adjimawok

texts.en:
Born in 1954 in Lom, Mrs. Adjimawok S. is married and has six (06) children and two (02) of her aunts children in her care. She runs a business selling works of pottery in the market at B. Her husband, who is retired and has a pathetic and irregular pension, can barely contribute anymore to the household expenses. With a loan of $200 which she managed well and repaid without incident, she has proven her command of her business. She deserves to be financially supported.

To develop and enlarge her business, Mrs. Adjimawok S. is asking for a loan of $700, which will allow her to obtain pottery products herself from villages where they are made and then resell them in bulk to retailers. With this new strategy, she can increase her income and improve her familys standard of living.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Ne en 1954 Lom, Madame S. Adjimawok est marie et mre de six (06) enfants et a sa charge deux (02) autres enfants de sa tante. Elle exerce comme activit la vente des fabriques de poterie au march de B. Son mari, un retrait aux pensions drisoires et encore irrgulires, ne contribue presque plus aux charges du mnage. Avec un crdit de $200 quelle a pu bien grer et rembourser sans incident, elle est arrive prouver sa matrise de lactivit quelle exerce. Elle mrite dtre financirement appuye.

Pour dvelopper et accrotre ses activits, Madame S. Adjimawok sollicite un crdit de $700 qui lui permettra de pouvoir aller elle-mme sapprovisionner des produits de poterie dans les villages de fabrication pour de les revendre en gros aux dtaillants. Avec cette nouvelle stratgie, elle pourra augmenter son revenu et amliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille.

loan.use: To buy and sell pottery products

loan.name: Kanl

texts.en:
Mrs. Kanl K., a lively woman with an unemployed husband, was born in 1946 in Anho in Les Lacs in southern Togo. She is a poor and illiterate woman with three (03) small boys in her care. Since her youth, she has been involved in the sale of various products at the market in B. This business has allowed her to finance the education of all of her children and to handle the needs of her family. Her husband, who does not have a full-time job anymore, is no longer able to help her at home. All the household expenses rest therefore on Mrs. Kanl K. who, with all of her experience and the rigor which she has demonstrated in the management of her two previous loans, has been able to pull through, but not without difficulty.

The previous loans, which were obtained and repaid without incident, have helped her significantly and have above all contributed to increasing her business and her profitability. Currently, she is asking for a new loan of $750 which will serve to buy more of a wide range of articles which are missing in her stock. This will augment her income for her needs and those of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame K. Kanl, femme vivant avec un mari sans emploi, est ne en 1946 Anho dans les Lacs au Sud du Togo. Cest une femme pauvre et analphabte avec trois (03) petits fils charge. Depuis sa jeunesse, elle sest donne la vente des produits divers au march de B jusqu ce jour. Cette activit lui a permis dassurer la scolarit de tous ses enfants et de faire face aux besoins familiaux. Son mari qui na plus de travail en plein temps narrive plus laider au foyer. Toute la charge revenait donc Madame K. Kanl qui, avec toute son exprience et la rigueur dont elle fait preuve dans la gestion de son commerce et surtout dans la gestion des deux prcdents crdits, arrive sen sortir non pas sans difficult.

Les crdits antrieurs obtenus et bien rembourss lont beaucoup aid et ont surtout contribu accrotre son activit et sa rentabilit. Aujourdhui, elle sollicite un nouveau crdit de $ 750 qui servira acheter dautres articles divers qui manquent dans son stock. Ceci augmentera ses revenus pour les besoins de sa famille.

loan.use: To buy a variety of products

loan.name: Komi

texts.en:
Mr. Komi K., born on May 2, 1970 in Lom, is a mechanic by training. He is still single. He abandoned his studies during high school and became an auto mechanic. He had trouble working because he did not have the financial means to open a garage. To earn his daily wages, he was forced to help a friend who has opened a small computer training centre. He quickly took interest in computing and initiated himself rapidly. This passion for computing led him to open his own multi service centre in Lom in the Super Taco area. With his three previous loans obtained and repaid without incident, he has succeeded in opening his own computing and word processing centre with some secondhand equipment. However, in order to work with an increasing and insistent clientele, he needs to upgrade his computer equipment.

To achieve this, Mr. Komi K. is asking for a loan of $1200, which will serve to acquire a personal computer and to re-outfit his centre. Given the dedication he has shown and his ability to rigorously manage his business, this financial support will give him a second wind and will above all improve his performance and yield.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur K. Komi, n le 2 Mai 1970 Lom est mcanicien de formation. Il est encore clibataire. Il abandonna les tudes au troisime degr et sest form en mcanique auto. Il eut du mal exercer ce mtier car il manque de moyens financiers pour ouvrir un garage. Pour gagner son pain quotidien, il est oblig daider un ami qui a ouvert un petit centre de formation en informatique. Il prit got rapidement linformatique et sinitia trs vite. Cette passion pour linformatique le pousse ouvrir son propre centre de multi service Lom dans le quartier Super Taco. Avec ses trois crdits obtenus et rgulirement rembourss, il est arriv ouvrir son propre centre informatique et de traitement de texte avec quelques matriels doccasion. Mais, pour la qualit de ses prestations une clientle de plus exigeante, il y a donc ncessit de renouveler le matriel informatique. Pour ce faire, Monsieur K. Komi sollicite un crdit de $1200 qui servira lacquisition dun micro-ordinateur et au ramnagement de son centre. Vu le dvouement dont il fait preuve et son aptitude grer son affaire avec rigueur, ce soutien financier lui donnera un second souffle et amliorera surtout ses prestations et son rendement.

loan.use: To buy a personal computer and to outfit an office

loan.name: Ahofa Clestine

texts.en:
Mrs. Ahofa Clestine S. is married and has three (03) children. She was born on May 15, 1942 in Lom (in Golfe) and sells bouillie (a hot African breakfast cereal). Her husband, who is retired with a pathetic and irregular pension, finds it difficult to contribute to the needs of the household, and most of the household expenses rest on her shoulders. With things becoming more and more difficult, she has decided to add the business of selling of cereals and sugar to the sale of bouillie.

To do this, she is asking for a loan of $900 to buy and sell cereals. She can thus create a profit margin high enough to meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame S. Ahofa Clestine est marie et mre de trois (03) enfants. Elle est ne le 15 Mai 1942 Lom (P.Golfe) et revendeuse de bouillie. Son mari, un retrait aux pensions drisoires et irrgulires arrive trs difficilement contribuer aux besoins du foyer et la plupart des charges du mnage reposent sur elle. Les choses devenant de plus en plus difficile, elle dcide dajouter le commerce crales et de sucre la vente de la bouille.

Pour ce faire, elle sollicite un crdit de $900 pour faire lachat et la vente de crales. Elle pourra ainsi dgager une marge bnficiaire aussi leve afin de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loan.use: To buy and sell cereals

loan.name: Yawa

texts.en:
Mrs. Yawa A. was born in 1939 in Lagos, Nigeria, a place she left at a young age with her parents to move to Lom. Throughout her youth, she spent her time helping her father, who was a very famous traditional therapist. Following his death, she took over his work. Her job as a herbalist, which she has practiced for more than 50 years, has beomce the sole source of income for her family. Today, it is difficult to find the roots and plants necessary for her job. She needs to search in the northern regions, sometimes even beyond the border; this requires considerable financial means.

Faced with this situation, Mrs. Yawa A. is asking for $750 in financial support to allow her to stockpile enough roots and pharmacopeial products. Given her experience in this field, this loan will greatly improve her economic living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Yawa est ne en 1939 Lagos au Nigeria o elle avait quitte trs jeune avec ses parents pour venir sinstaller Lom. Durant sa jeunesse, elle passait son temps aider son pre un tradithrapeute trs clbre. A la suite du dcs de celui-ci, elle prit la relve jusqu ce jour. Ce mtier dherboriste quelle exerce depuis plus de 50 ans est devenu sa seule source de revenu pour les besoins de sa famille. Aujourdhui, il est difficile de trouver les racines et les plantes indispensables lexercice de son mtier. Il faut obligatoirement aller en chercher dans les rgions septentrionales voire au-del des frontires ; ce qui ncessite dimportants moyens financiers.

Face cette situation, Madame A. Yawa sollicite un appui financier de $750 pour lui permettre de sapprovisionner suffisamment en racines et produits de la pharmacope. Au vu de son exprience dans le domaine, ce crdit amliorera davantage ses conditions de vie sur le plan conomique.

loan.use: To buy roots and pharmacopeial products

loan.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Born June 6, 1967 in Lom (Golfe prefecture), Ms. Fatima R. is a married mother of two children and also takes care of another child. She has a shop where she sells cosmetic products. Her husband has been unemployed for five years and barely contributes to the household income. Most of the familys expenses are thus her responsibility, which is very difficult for her. With her business she manages to meet the basic needs of her family, but she does not have enough capital to develop her business and increase her income. She is a very serious businesswoman and has easily been able to manage and repay her first two loans.

Today Ms. Fatima R. is requesting a new loan of $1000 to create a larger stock of cosmetic products and to meet the needs of her customers. This loan will increase her income and allow her to improve her familys living conditions.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Ne le 06 Juin 1967 Lom (P/Golfe), Madame R. Fatima est marie et mre de deux (02) enfants et sa charge 1 enfant. Elle exerce comme activit la vente des produits de beaut dont elle a une boutique. Son mari en chmage depuis 5 ans, ne contribue presque plus aux besoins du mnage et la grande partie des charges de la famille repose sur elle, ce qui lui donne beaucoup de peine. Avec son commerce, elle se dbrouille pour subvenir aux besoins essentiels de son foyer. Or, son capital est insuffisant pour accrotre son commerce et augmenter ses revenus. Trs srieuse dans ses affaires, elle pu grer et rembourser ses deux premiers crdits sans difficult.

Aujourdhui, Madame R. Fatima sollicite un nouveau crdit de $1000 pour augmenter son stock de produits de beaut et rpondre aux besoins de sa clientle. Ce crdit augmentera ses revenus pour amliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loan.use: Cosmetic product sales

loan.name: Akoul

texts.en:
Ms. Akoul M., born October 7, 1953 in Lom, is a married mother of four children and takes care of two of her brothers. Having been born to a poor family, she left school to help her mother with the household duties. After having spent several years at home, her parents sent her on an apprenticeship to learn to sew. She then specialized in making baby clothing. At the end of her apprenticeship, she was unable to open a workshop and thus had to resort to sales. Then with the little savings she had, along with a small loan, she opened a workshop and a store that she still operates today.

The baby clothing that she sells in her store is made by Ms. M. and her apprentices. Faced with the ever-growing demand of her customers and insufficient financial means, she is requesting a loan of $1100. This loan will allow her to order cloth wholesale to make baby clothing, which will increase her production capacity, and to buy other baby articles requested by her customers, such as sheets, diapers, and other items. The success of this project will increase her income considerably, something her family needs very much.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame M. Akoul, ne le 7 Octobre 1953 Lom est marie et mre de quatre (04) enfants avec deux (02) frres charge. Ne dune famille pauvre, elle abandonna les tudes pour aider sa maman dans les activits mnagres. Aprs quelques annes passes la maison, ses parents lenvoient en apprentissage pour se former en couture. Elle sest alors spcialise dans le trousseau bb. A la fin de son apprentissage, elle net pas la chance douvrir un atelier et dt recourir au commerce. Par la suite, avec ses petites conomies et un petit crdit, elle ouvrit un atelier et une boutique quelle tient jusqu ce jour.

Les trousseaux vendus dans sa boutique sont confectionns par elle-mme avec ses apprenties. Face la demande sans cesse croissante de sa clientle et linsuffisance de ses moyens financiers, elle sollicite un appui financier de $1100. Ce crdit va lui permettre de commander les tissus en gros pour la confection des trousseaux afin daccrotre sa capacit de production, dacheter dautres articles pour bb demands par ses clients tels que les draps, couches bb et autres. La ralisation de ce projet augmentera considrablement ses revenus aux besoins de sa famille.

loan.use: To buy cloth and make baby clothing

loan.name: Akol

texts.en:
Born January 14, 1949 in Lom (Golfe prefecture) Ms. Akol L. is a married mother of four children. Her husband, a motorcycle taxi driver, became alcoholic after facing hardship and does not contribute to the familys income. Ms. L. is thus responsible for all of the household income, which she has difficulty in earning with her business of selling chickens at the market in B. She has been in this business for 10 years, doing quite well despite the fact that she is illiterate. She has received two loans which were regularly repaid without incident.

Today she is requesting a new loan of $800 which will allow her to buy chickens and to go herself to villages to buy them. This loan will increase the size of her business and will help her lift her family out of extreme poverty.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Ne le 14 Janvier 1949 Lom (P/Golfe), Madame L. Akol est marie et mre de quatre (04) enfants. Son mari, un chauffeur de taxi moto, devenu ivrogne la suite des difficults de la vie, ne participe aucunement aux charges familiales. Tout se repose alors sur Madame L. qui sen sort trs difficilement avec son commerce de vente de poulets au march de B. Elle exerce ce commerce depuis 10 ans avec une certaine rigueur malgr quelle soit analphabte. Elle a son actif deux crdits qui ont t rgulirement rembourss et sans incident.

Aujourdhui, elle sollicite un nouveau crdit de $800 qui va lui servir dacheter des volailles et aller elle-mme dans le villages sapprovisionner. Ce crdit augmentera la taille de son commerce et laidera sortir sa famille de la misre.

loan.use: To buy and sell chickens

loan.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Mr. Abraham ADAMAMO is a single, 20-year-old man. As he comes from a large, poor family, he abandoned school early to come to Lom to work as a porter in the large Lom market. As this job became more and more tiresome without earning him decent wages, he quickly became an unlicensed street vendor in the large intersections of Lom. With this job he earned a small amount of savings, which allowed him to study for two years to be a barber. As he did not have the financial means to open his own workshop after his training, he worked in a shop helping a friend, who was only taking advantage of him.

A brave a courageous man, Mr. Abraham ADAMAMO has decided to open his own barber shop in order to take his destiny into his own hands. To do so, he is requesting a loan of $950, which will allow him to rent a shop and buy the necessary equipment, such as mechanical and electric clippers and necessary cosmetic products. This very dedicated young man deserves to be supported in order to allow him to better his life and get out of poverty. He would serve as a good example for other young people who are falling into difficult situations.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Abraham est un jeune clibataire g de 20 ans. Issu dune famille nombreuse et pauvre, il abandonna vite ses tudes pour venir Lom exercer le mtier de portefaix au grand march de Lom. Ce mtier devenant de plus en plus pnible sans gain consquent, il se transforma rapidement en vendeur ambulant la sauvette aux grands carrefours de Lom. Par cette activit, il ralisa une petite conomie qui lui a permis dapprendre la coiffure homme pendant 2 ans. Nayant pas les moyens financiers douvrir son propre atelier aprs sa formation, il aida un ami dans son atelier qui ne fait que lexploiter.

Brave et courageux, Monsieur A. Abraham dcide douvrir son propre atelier de coiffure afin de prendre en main sa destine. Pour ce faire, il sollicite un appui financier de $950 qui va lui permettre de louer un local et acheter des matriels ncessaires tels que les tondeuses mcaniques et lectriques et les produits de beaut au besoin son activit. Ce jeune homme trs dvou mrite dtre soutenu pour lui permettre de relever son niveau de vie et de sortir de la pauvret. Ceci sera un bel exemple pour les autres jeunes en divagation et en situation difficile.

loan.use: To rent a shop and buy barber shop equipment

loan.name: Vale

texts.en:
Born on April 16, 1984 in Lom, Ms. Vale K. is single but takes care of one child. She is a trained hairdresser, and in addition to working as a hairstylist, she sells cosmetic products (hair extensions, shampoo, conditioner, etc.) in her hair salon. Her excellent work has earned her a good reputation in her neighborhood. As she has a very good business sense, she has easily repaid her first two loans.

So to attract even more customers, Ms. Vale K. plans on expanding and better equipping her hair salon by buying better-performing, modern equipment and a supply of cosmetic products. To do so, she is requesting a loan of $850, which will allow her to develop her business. This will earn her an increased income and allow her to improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Ne le 16 Avril 1984 Lom, Mlle K. Vale est clibataire, mais a un enfant sa charge. Coiffeuse de formation, elle exerce en plus de ce mtier, la commerce des produits de beaut (mches, shampooing, produit dmlant) dans son salon de coiffure. Son travail bien fait, fait sa rputation dans le quartier. Trs entreprenante, elle a rembours ses deux premiers crdits sans difficult.

Ainsi, pour sduire et attirer davantage sa clientle, Mlle K. Vale prvoit agrandir et mieux quiper son salon de coiffure par lacquisition de matriels modernes et plus performants et sapprovisionner en produit de beaut. Elle sollicite, pour ce faire, un crdit de $850 qui lui permettra daugmenter ses activits. Ce qui lui procurera des revenus pour amliorer ses conditions de vie.

loan.use: To equip her hair salon and buy good quality, modern equipment

loan.name: Massan

texts.en:
Ms. Massan F. was born on Aril 10, 1955 in Tohoun in the Moyen-Mono prefecture. She is a married mother of three children and takes care of two others. Very early on, she got into the business of selling bags of rice and then opened a shop from which to do so. This flourishing business allows her to contribute to her familys income, because her husbands salary is no longer stable due to situation of his business. She is rigorous in the management of her business and has easily been able to repay her loans.

She is requesting a new loan of $1200, which will allow her to buy bags of rice direct from wholesalers and to respond to market demands. She could then increase her income and meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame F. Massan est ne le 10 Avril 1955 Tohoun dans la prfecture du Moyen-Mono. Elle est marie et mre de trois (03) enfants avec deux (02) enfants sa charge. Trs tt, elle sest lance dans la vente de sacs de riz et a ouvert une boutique en la circonstance. Ce commerce florissant lui permet de contribuer aux charges du mnage car le salaire de son mari nest plus rgulier cause de la situation de son entreprise. Rigoureuse dans la gestion de ses activits, elle a su rembourser ses crdits obtenus sans difficult.

Elle sollicite un nouveau crdit de $1200 qui lui permettra dacheter directement les sacs de riz chez les grossistes et rpondre la demande de son march. Elle pourra accrotre ainsi son revenu et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loan.use: To buy and sell rice

loan.name: Hougnamtor

texts.en:
Born on August 7, 1965 in Lom, Ms. Hougnamtor A. is a married mother of two children and also takes care of one other child. As soon as she was married, her aunt got her into the business of selling tomatoes. Her husband, a taxi driver with unstable employment and income, leaves the responsibility of almost all of the household expenses up to his wife, who has difficulty paying them all. Setting up her business has not been easy for her because of her very limited means. With her belief in what she was doing and her courage, she succeeded in increasing her capital thanks to having obtained an initial loan of $250. Despite the fact that she is illiterate, she has an acute business sense and is rigorous in the management of her business, which has allowed her to repay her loan before the payment date.

She is requesting a new loan of $750 to go to neighboring villages to buy tomatoes in bulk and sell them retail. This will increase her profit margin, and she will be able to improve her familys living conditions.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Ne le 07 Aot 1965 Lom, Madame A. Hougnamtor est marie et mre de deux (02) enfants et sa charge 1 enfant. Initie par sa tante aussitt marie, elle se lance dans le commerce des tomates. Son mari un chauffeur de taxi aux emplois et revenus irrguliers, laisse presque toutes les charges du foyer sur sa femme qui a du mal sen sortir. Les dbuts de cette activit nont pas t faciles pour elle cause de ses moyens trs limits. Avec sa foi en ce quelle fait et par son courage, elle a russi augmenter son capital grce un premier crdit de $250 obtenu. Malgr quelle soit analphabte, elle a un sens aigu et rigoureux de gestion de son commerce, ce qui lui a permis de rembourser son crdit avant lchance.

Elle sollicite un nouveau crdit de $750 pour aller dans les villages environnants acheter en gros les tomates pour les revendre en dtail. Ceci augmentera sa marge bnficiaire et ainsi elle pourra amliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille.

loan.use: To buy and sell tomatoes

payment.comment:
Adjogble thanks sincerely KIVA and all those who have contributed to his project funding which allows him today to increase his activities and automatically his incomes to his proper living conditions improvement and those of his family. May Almighty and Merciful God bless you, and rendered it to you everlastingly!!!
The credit is repaying normally and without any incident at this moment.

loan.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Ms. Jeanne A. is a married mother of three children who takes care of two other girls who help her with her business. Born in 1959 in Lokossa in the Republic of Benin, she gave up school and left her impoverished parents to go to Lom and live with a restaurant-owning aunt, who she helped for a long time. Her husband unfortunately has no training or qualifications and only works part-time doing manual labor at construction sites. She has thus had to meet her familys needs and ensure her childrens education alone through her business of preparing and selling local dishes (pte, akpan, and kom). This business has taken off since she received her first loan of $150, which allowed her to improve the quality of her dishes and in particular to set up her small workshop. As her customers are becoming increasingly numerous and demanding, she is requesting a new loan of $800, which will allow her to create a sufficient stock of corn, rice and other products necessary for her business. She could sell some of them to increase her income and improve her familys living conditions.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Jeanne est marie et mre de trois (03) enfants avec deux (02) filles charge qui laident dans ses activits. Ne en 1959 Lokossa en Rpublique du Bnin, elle a abandonn ses tudes et quitta alors ses parents dmunis pour se rfugier Lom auprs dune tante restauratrice quelle aida pendant un bon moment. Son mari, malheureusement, sans aucune formation et qualification, nexerce qu temps partiel le manuvrage sur des chantiers de construction. Elle dt alors faire face toute seule aux besoins de sa famille et lducation de ses enfants avec son activit de prparation et de vente de mets locaux (pte, akpan, et kom). Cette activit a pris de lampleur lorsquelle a bnficie de son premier crdit $150 qui lui a permis damliorer la qualit de ses plats et surtout damnager son petit hangar. Sa clientle devenant de plus en plus importante et exigeante, elle sollicite un nouveau un crdit de $800 qui lui servira constituer un stock suffisant de mas, de riz et autres produits pour les besoins de son activit. Elle pourra en vendre une partie pour augmenter ses revenus et amliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loan.use: To buy corn and rice to make the dish Ablo

loan.name: Amfa

texts.en:
Born in 1965 in Ghana, Amfa O. is married and the mother of four. She is a persevering and very courageous woman. Though very active, she does not have a lot of financial resources. She has a small table business, where she sells various items displayed at her stand. Her husband, an accountant, has been without a job for three years, and the situation has become difficult for the family. That is why he turns to his wife to pay practically all the bills. Now then, the income from her business is not at the level needed to meet this responsibility.

And so she is requesting a loan of $750 to increase the size of her business and to clear a substantial profit, in order to deal with household requirements.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Ne en 1965 au Ghana, Madame O. Amfa est marie et mre de quatre (04) enfants. Elle est une femme persvrante et trs courageuse. Trs active mais nayant pas beaucoup de moyens financiers, elle fait un petit commerce de table de produits divers. Son mari, un comptable, est sans emploi depuis 3 ans et la situation est devenue trs difficile dans la famille. Cest alors quil revient la femme de prendre en charge la quasi-totalit des charges du mnage. Or, le revenu tir de son commerce nest pas la hauteur de cette responsabilit.

Aussi, sollicite-t-elle un crdit de $750 qui va augmenter la taille de son activit et dgager un revenu substantiel afin de faire face aux exigences de son mnage.

loan.use: Table business and various items

loan.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Bea is 42 years and a mother of two. She has been selling local liquor over the last 5 years. The liquor store is located in a heavily populated area of the city which bustles with a lot of social activities. She has gone through the TEACH learning sessions of KRABAN SUPPORT FOUNDATION and hopes to increase sales significantly if KIVA assists her with requested amount.

loan.use: Working Capital

loan.name: Ablavi

texts.en:
Ablavi D. was born in Lom in 1974. She is married to a substitute teacher and is the mother of a child. She also takes care of another child. Not fortunate enough to pursue schooling, she taught herself haute couture. Today, she excels at it. In her shop, she is the boss and manages 15 apprentices. A very friendly and patient woman with a level-headed demeanor, she is much loved and appreciated among her friends and neighbors. As generous as she is charitable, she also provides free training in her shop for certain girls who are really in need.

Her shop gets a lot of business, but her sewing machines are inadequate to meet the current demand. To address the situation, Ms. D. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to renovate her shop and to buy other sewing machines, in order to satisfy her customers and improve the living conditions of her family and also of her apprentices.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Ne en 1974 Lom, Madame D. Ablavi est marie un professeur vacataire et mre dun (01) enfant et sa charge un autre enfant. Nayant pas eu la chance de poursuivre ses tudes, elle sest fait former en haute couture quelle exerce impeccablement aujourdhui. Elle est patronne de 15 apprenties. Trs sociable, son aire trs calme et sa patience font delle une femme trs aime et apprcie dans son entourage et dans le quartier. Aussi gnreuse que charitable, elle forme gratuitement dans son atelier certaines filles trs ncessiteuses.

Son atelier est trs frquent et ses machines sont insuffisantes pour rpondre aux exigences du moment. Pour ce faire, Madame D. sollicite un crdit de $1200 pour ramnager son atelier et pour acheter dautres machines coudre afin de satisfaire sa clientle et amliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille et les conditions de travail de ses apprenties.

loan.use: Renovate her shop and buy five new sewing machines.

loan.name: Lasty

texts.en: Lasty, a mother of two, is 34 years old. She started her retail business immediately after her secondary education. The initial capital was provided by her mother. Due to very good sales over the last 2 years, the need has come for her to increase stock of goods. She enjoys good patronage. Having gone through the TEACH sessions of KRABAN, she is putting together her business plan to formalize the operations. She hopes to achieve this with KIVA\'s support.

loan.use: Working Capital

loan.name: Komlan

texts.en:
Komlan S. was born in Lom on February 21, 1967. Married and the father of two, he entered a carpentry apprenticeship after earning his middle school diploma. Today, he is definitely a master carpenter with three apprentices working under him in his own workshop. Opening his shop was possible due to financial support in the amount of $450, which he promptly repaid. Making cabinets, armchairs (living room furniture), armoires, buffet tables, and beds, among others items, are his specialty. His fine work only brings in more customers! But unfortunately his financial means are limited when it comes to satisfying on a timely basis the stated expectations of his customers. This situation might create a crisis of trust with his customers.

To overcome this problem and to earn the loyalty of his customers, Mr. S. is requesting a new loan of $1,200 to buy Iroko and Teck boards, rafters, and hand tools in order to be able to satisfy his customers orders on time. The loan will grow his business and thus increase his income considerably to better support his family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur S. Komlan est n le 21 Fvrier 1967 Lom. Mari et pre de deux (02) enfants, il entra dans lapprentissage de menuiserie aprs avoir obtenu le CEPD. Il est aujourdhui un matre menuisier confirm avec trois (03) apprentis charge et a son propre atelier. Louverture de cet atelier a t possible grce un appui financier de $450 obtenu et promptement rembours. La fabrication des meubles, des fauteuils (salon complet), des armoires et buffets, des lits sont entre autres sa spcialit. Par son travail bien fait, sa clientle ne fait quaccrotre, mais malheureusement ses moyens financiers se trouvent trs limits pour satisfaire temps les demandes exprimes. Ce qui risque de crer une crise de confiance avec sa clientle.

Pour palier ce problme et fidliser sa clientle, Monsieur S. sollicite un nouveau crdit de $1200 pour lachat des planches en Iroko et Teck, des chevrons et de petit outillage afin de pouvoir satisfaire dans le dlai les commandes de ses clients. Ceci accrotra ses activits et augmentera considrablement ses revenus pour mieux entretenir sa famille.

loan.use: To buy hand tools and the basic materials for carpentry and furniture-making.

loan.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is 59 years old and a mother of five. She relocated close to a major secondary school in the city and started a general provisions store about 6 years ago. Her store retails items like canned foods, confectionary, beverages (canned and bottled) and pastries. These are well patronized by students and staff of the school and other community members. Hannah would like to expand her operations due to a major expansion works in the school for additional student enrollment this year. She has gone thru KRABAN\'S TEACH learning sessions.

loan.use: Working Capital

loan.name: Kossi Agbssi

texts.en:
Kossi Agbssi A. is a young craftsman who was born on March 6, 1983 in Danyi-Elavanyo in the Plateaux region. He was not fortunate enough to finish middle school because his parent were poor, thus compelling him to work as a farmer on cocoa and coffee plantations. Later on, he wanted to learn a trade, so he chose shoe-making, which would be successful for him if he had more funds at his disposal. Married and the father of a child, plus being responsible for two apprentices, this young boy has completely mastered his trade and practices it with a passion. He possesses everything it takes to be great and experienced in leather-crafts. But unfortunately he lacks sufficient financial means to buy the essential basic materials (leather) needed to make shoes of all kinds, as well as purses and bags, belts, another other products.

Concerned about serving his customers better and gaining their loyalty, he is requesting a loan of $950 to buy materials of the trade and hand tools for his business. The success of his plans will allow him to grow his business and increase his income for the welfare of his family and to serve as a good example to struggling young people.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur A. Kossi Agbssi est un jeune artisan n le 6 Mars 1983 Danyi-Elavanyo dans la rgion des Plateaux. Il na pas eu la chance de poursuivre ses tudes secondaires cause de la pauvret de ses parents, lobligeant travailler dans les plantations de caf cacao comme mtayer. Plus tard, il a voulu apprendre un mtier et a choisi la cordonnerie qui peut bien lui russir aujourdhui sil disposait plus de moyens. Mari et pre dun (01) enfant avec deux (02) apprentis charge, ce jeune garon a une parfaite matrise de son mtier quil exerce avec enthousiasme et abngation. Il possde les atouts dun grand maroquinier confirm et expriment mais malheureusement ne dispose pas de moyens financiers suffisants pour acheter les matires premires indispensables (peaux en cuir) pour la fabrication des chaussures de tout genre, des sacs, des ceintures etc.

Soucieux de mieux servir sa clientle et la fidliser, il sollicite un crdit de $950 pour lachat des matires et de petit outillage pour les besoins de ses activits. La ralisation de ce projet lui permettra daccrotre ses activits et daugmenter ses revenus pour le bien-tre de sa famille et servira un bel exemple pour les jeunes en situation difficile.

loan.use: Buying tools and basic materials for shoe-making

loan.name: Flicia

texts.en:
Born in Ghana in 1959, Flicia A. is married and the mother of three, plus she is responsible for two domestics. Her husband has been unemployed for three years, so she covers a large part of family expenses. This is only possible due to her business selling ablo (steamed cornbread), a dish that is highly appreciated in all areas of Togo. Twice she has benefited from loans that allowed her to increase her business with ever-growing orders from customers, who are more and more numerous, especially on weekends, holidays, and other occasions, such as marriages and funerals. Now then, Flcias current financial resources do not allow her to meet customer demands. It has finally become necessary to seek out new financing.

And so, she is requesting a new loan of $750 to build an inventory of corn, the primary ingredient of her business. This will clearly help increase her income for supporting her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Ne en 1959 au Ghana, Madame A. Flicia est une femme marie et mre de trois (03) enfants avec deux (02) domestiques charge. Son mari est en chmage depuis trois ans, alors elle soccupe en grande partie des charges familiales. Cela nest possible que grce son activit de prparation et de vente de ablo , un met base de mas trs apprci dans toutes les contres du Togo. A deux reprises elle a bnfici de prts, ce qui lui a permis daugmenter ses activits avec des commandes sans cesse croissantes de sa clientle qui devient de plus en plus importante, surtout les week-end, jours des ftes et occasions de mariage ou de funrailles. Or, les moyens actuels de Flicia ne lui permettent pas de rpondre aux demandes de ses clients. La recherche de nouveaux financements savre ncessaire.

Pour ce faire, elle sollicite un nouveau crdit de $750 pour lui permettre de constituer un stock de mas, la matire premire de bas de son activit. Ceci contribuera videmment laugmentation de ses revenus pour les besoins de sa famille.

loan.use: To buy corn and make ablo.

loan.name: Victoria

texts.en: Vic is 27 years old and a mother of two. She began her trading activities approximately 5 years ago shortly after junior school. She sells both rubber and leather footwear. She participated in the TEACH learning sessions of KRABAN in September, 2006. Currently, she is negotiating with a major supplier to provide regular supply of the goods. She therefore expects to be assisted with the loan from KIVA to increase the capital base.

loan.use: Working Capital

loan.name: Kokouvi

texts.en:
Kokouvi A. was born in 1980 in Kouv (Yoto prefecture). He is a very devoted and intelligent young man. Born of polygamy, where the women and their children are left to fend for themselves, he left school to start a business selling tomatoes at the marketplace. Two years later with a developed business, he got married and had two children, plus he is the guardian of one other child. His wife helps him at work. With an initial loan, which he has repaid, he was able to expand his business a little.

Today, Mr. A. would like to become a wholesaler. To do this, he is requesting a loan of $850 to stock up on and to sell other produce from farming villages, in addition to tomatoes. The produce will include red and green peppers, eggplant, and onions. He will thus be able to increase his income and improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur A. Kokouvi est n en 1980 Kouv dans la prfecture de Yoto. Cest un jeune homme trs dvou et trs intelligent. Issu dune famille polygame o les femmes sont laisses elles mmes avec leurs enfants, il abandonna ses tudes et se lance dans le commerce des tomates au march. Deux ans aprs, vu lvolution de son activit, il sest mari et pre de deux (02) enfants et un (01) autre enfant charge. Sa femme laide dans son activit. Avec un premier crdit qui a t bien sold, il a pu augmenter un peu la taille de son commerce.

Aujourdhui, Monsieur A. veut devenir grossiste et pour cela il sollicite un crdit de $850 pour aller sapprovisionner dans les villages de production et ajouter la vente de tomate dautres condiments comme piments rouges et verts, aubergines, oignons etc. Ainsi il pourra accrotre son revenu et amliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loan.use: To sell grocery produce items.

loan.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Bekie is 27 years old and a mother of two. She sells her goods in front of the family house. Some of the items include canned foods, biscuits, confectionary and some stationary. This happens to be a family business and she is running it now. She took part in the TEACH learning sessions of KRABAN in September, 2006. She needs the KIVA loan to be able to grow the business.

loan.use: Working Capital

loan.name: Massan

texts.en:
Born in Lom on February 1, 1935, Massan A. is married and the mother of four. Ever since her husband retired, she has continued all by herself to deal with household expenses by selling ice cubes, ice water, and fruit juice. This business has gotten big due to the strong demand in her neighborhood, particularly during the dry season when the heat is excessive and people consume a good deal of her beverages to refresh themselves.

Unfortunately, her production capacity is insufficient to meet the demands of the customers in her area. Ms. A. is requesting financial support in the amount of $1,000 to acquire another, bigger freezer. This new loan will make a major difference for her business and the life of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer
