Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Invest in more items for her store

loan.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco has a stand where he sells tortillas and common Ecuadorian foods. He started the business off with only $10 of capital several years ago. This business has provided for Francisco and his 3 children. He depends on the stand to provide food, shelter and education for his family. He is requesting the loan in order to buy chairs and tables to put around his stand. He hopes that his business will continue to become popular and that one day he can open a restaurant.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Buy tables and chairs for his clients to use

loan.name: Khalid

texts.en: Khalid is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin. He settled with his family in Sumgait city. Khalid is 29 years old. He married and has 2 children. He is the only breadwinner in family. He has an ability to buy the best perfumery. He is very polite with all his clients. Khalid decided to apply for a loan $300 in order to busy with retail trade. He applies for the loan $600 to open his own perfumery and to increase the range of goods.

loan.use: To open his own perfumery and to increase the range of goods

loan.name: Zafar

texts.en: 34-year-old Zafar with his 2 children settled in Sumgait city. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Gubadli region. Since 2001 Zafar has been engaged in animal sales to improve his familys living condition. As he did not have enough funds, he could not develop his business well enough in the beginning. Having borrowed 2 loans ($500; $800;) from Normicro Zafar significantly expanded his business, bought 11 calves, achieved progress in his business and increased his family income. The loans were paid back timely. He applies for a loan amount of $1000 to buy 15 calves.

loan.use: To buy 15 calves

loan.name: Muhammed

texts.en: Muhammed is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli. He is hard working person. He is 48. He married and has 2 children. He began his business 18 years ago and it allows him to support to his family. He borrowed the amount of $400 to renovate for repairing cars. Muhammed is mechanic. He has been engaged in this business for 8 years. He works as the master. The second time he borrowed the loan amount of $800 and with this loan he enlarged and renovated the area of his garage. Muhammed applies for a loan amount of $400 to buy the spare parts and to expand his business area.

loan.use: To buy the spare parts and to expand his business area

loan.name: Farhad

texts.en: Farhad is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Cebrail. He is a professional driver. He has a . 44-year-old Ferhad is hard working person. He married and has 2 children. He began his business 20 years ago and it allows him to support to his family. In 2002 he borrowed $500 from Normicro spent this loan amount to buy the spare parts for his car. For the second time he borrowed the loan of amount $600 to repair his cars motor. His car is old. Therefore he plans to sell it and to buy a new car. Farhad applies for a loan amount of $1400 to buy a new car.

loan.use: To buy a new car

loan.name: Elsevar

texts.en: Elsever has been engaged in this business for 2 years. He is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli region, settled in Sumgait city. This 40-year-old man is hard worker. He is married, has 2 children. At the beginner he borrowed the loan amount of $400 from Normicro, has bought grocery googs. Now Elsever wants loan amount of $600 to rent a shop and increase the range of goods.

loan.use: To rent a shop and increase the range of goods

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy materials for welding

loan.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica owns a small caf where she sells shakes and lunches. She started the business of with her mother after her husband abandoned her and their daughter. She will use the loan in order to invest in a grill so she may be able to sell shish kabobs and other grilled meats. She hopes that this will allow her to open her business at night and generate much more revenue. She is only 24 years old but she plans on having a very successful restaurant.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Buy a grill for her business

loan.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene has a business where she sells household furniture made out of metal. These items are becoming very popular in these poor sectors of Guayaquil because they offer convenient furniture at affordable prices. Marlene is also very popular because she offers her clients the option of financing the products. She currently has 50 clients that she collects payments from. Marlene has 3 children and is married. She is not from Guayaquil, but moved there in search of work and better opportunities.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Invest in furniture products to sell

loan.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria owns a small store where she sells many food items. She started off by just selling fruits and vegetables, but eventually her business grew to include dairy products and soft drinks. She is requesting the loan because she wants to invest in canned goods that are very popular amongst her customers. She does not have the investment capital to go out and buy these goods and make them part of her product line. Maria has a very stable business that shows the capacity of introducing new products. Her customer base is very strong and the product she plans to introduce promise to generate revenue. Maria is a 28 year old single mother of three children who moved to Guayaquil in search of work and a better for life for her children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Invest in new products for her store

loan.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis has a store where he sells fresh fruit and other food items. Luis started his business with the help of his wife who saved up bout $400 in capital for the market. At first, Luis only sold fruit and vegetables which were the easiest to buy and sell. He now sells many different items including the dairy products he wants to continue to invest in. Luis relies on the business to feed and educate his children. He and his wife have four children. He hopes to one day have an operation large enough to employ his wife and to pay for the schooling of his children at the college level.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Invest in products of his market

loan.name: Fizuli

texts.en: This 55-year-old man has been engaged in this business for 10 years. This kind man is married, has 3 children. He lives with his family in Baku city Bulbula settlement. You can see in the picture his flower garden. This flower garden is in the yard of his house. There are red, white, yellow roses and other sort flowers in his flower garden. These flowers are always given every support by Fizuli. He enjoys looking after flowers. For the first time he borrowed a loan of $600 and bought flower seeds. For the second time he borrowed a loan of $800 and expand the area of flower garden and began to be busy with seed-bed. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to open a flower shop and a vegetable-shop for sale the flowers and vegetables.

loan.use: To open a flower-shop and vegetable-shop

loan.name: Matanat

texts.en: Matanat has her own tailor\'s shop. She has been engaged in this business for 10 years. She enjoys with her work. Hawing borrowed a loan of $500 she bought a lot of leather in order to sew on a machine stylish leather jackets. Now she needs a loan of $1000 to buy a bench for leather wares and a iron for leather wares. This 47-year-old Matanat is single, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in Surakhani region Yeni Guneshli settlement.

loan.use: To buy a bench for leather wares and an iron for leather wares

loan.name: Aygun

texts.en: She has rented this tailor\\\'s shop for 10 years. In the beginning of her business she borrowed a loan of $600 and bought a sewing-machine. She sews on a machine stylish feminine clothes. Aygun creates the new fashionable feminine clothes. She likes to do innovation in her business. Now she needs $1200 to buy cloth. She was born in 1961, married, has 2 children, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Beylagan region. She and her family settled in Surakhani region Bulbula settlement.

loan.use: To buy cloth

loan.name: Vitalyi

texts.en:
Vitalyi and Natasha T. are a husband and wife team. They both worked at a factory in the past, however their salaries were too small to provide for the needs of their family. For that reason they decided to start their own small business selling clothing for teens and youth. Vitalyi and Natasha got their first loan from Nadiya Ukraine in March 2004. At that time they had only one vending stall in an open-air market. Lending services helped the couple purchase four kiosks and hire two employees who work as vendors. The active involvement of both spouses in this business is one reason for its success. Not long ago Vitalyi was in a bad car accident. He had serious injuries and was hospitalized for more than three months. Natasha was the only breadwinner in the family during that time. She had to run their business and learn to manage it efficiently without her husband. The business has not only remained stable but has seen considerable growth since that time. Vitalyi and Natasha are requesting a loan to expand their assortment of clothing for young people. They are planning to purchase trendy jeans, sweaters, blouses, pullovers, skirts and pants that will sell really well. Good taste and the ability to keep up with fashion guarantee high demand for the clothes Vitalyi and Natasha can offer. Their flexibility, loyalty, and ability to handle challenges are some of the reasons this couple will continue to see success in their business.

. . , . . 2004 . , . 4 . . , , 3 . . . , . , . , , , , , . . , , .

loan.use: To expand the assortment of clothing

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to expand his bicycle repair business

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to expand his used clothing business

loan.name: Conforte

texts.en:
Born in Lom in 1960, Conforte A. is married and the mother of five, and she also takes care of two other children. She sells chickens at the marketplace helping to support her family. Since her husbands spare parts store was looted by thieves, Mrs. A. feels she must take on all household expenses, something that is not at all easy to do. But thanks to her devotion and dynamism, she manages somehow to provide the necessities for her family.

Today, she is requesting a loan of $650 as capital to be able to sell sheep in addition to her poultry. This will grow her business and augment her income. The loan will help her to raise the standard of living for her and her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Ne en 1960 Lom, Madame A. Conforte est marie et mre de cinq (05) enfants et sa charge deux (02) enfants. Elle exerce comme activit la vente des poulets au march et contribue aux besoins familiaux. Depuis que le magasin de pices dtaches de son mari a t pill par les voleurs, Madame A. se voit dans lobligation de prendre toutes les charges du mnage. Cela ne lui est pas du tout facile mais grce son dvouement et son dynamisme, elle arrive tant que mal subvenir aux besoins vitaux de la famille.

Aujourdhui, elle sollicite un crdit de $650 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour quen plus de lachat et vente de volailles y associer la vente de moutons afin daccrotre ses activits et augmenter ses revenus. Ce crdit va laider relever son niveau de vie et celui de sa famille.

loan.use: To buy and sell poultry and sheep

loan.name: Fin

texts.en:
Mrs. Fin D. was born in 1962 in Lom (P/Golfe). She is married and mother to three (03) children, with two (02) other children under her care. Her husband, a police officer who has been retired for 5 years, no longer makes any real contribution to the household's needs. The family's costs are becoming more and more difficult to bear, because Mrs. D. lacks the funds to develop her business of selling poultry, which should be able to earn her a substantial income. Very determined although she is illiterate, Mrs. D. has a sharp business sense, which helped her greatly in managing the first credits she received and paid off without incident. She is building her confidence, and deserves once again to receive financial support. She is asking for a credit of $850 to be able to go to farms herself and buy poultry. This credit will increase the size of her business and improve her socio-economic standing.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame D. Fin est ne en 1962 Lom (P/Golfe). Marie et mre de trois enfants (03) et deux (02) autres enfants sa charge. Son mari, un gendarme admis la retraite depuis 5 ans, ne contribue plus rellement aux besoins du foyer. Les charges du mnage deviennent de plus en plus lourdes car elle manque de fonds de commerce pour dvelopper ses activits de vents de volailles qui devraient bien lui procurer des revenus substantiels. Trs dtermine et malgr quelle soit analphabte, Madame D. a un sens aigu de gestion des affaires, Cela la beaucoup dans la gestion de ses premiers obtenus et rembourss sans incident. Elle nourrit confiance et mrite dtre nouveau soutenue financirement. Elle sollicite un crdit de $850 pour pouvoir aller elle-mme dans les fermes pour lachat des volailles. Ce crdit augmentera la taille de son activit et amliorera son niveau de vie socio conomique.

loan.use: Buying and selling poultry

loan.name: Aziza

texts.en: AZIZA R. lives near the Dar es Salaam International Airport. She makes and sells concrete bricks. She has employed four assistants in her business. She is married with five children, three of whom are in secondary school and two in primary school. Aziza started this business three years ago. Since then, the business had grown very slowly, contrary to what she anticipated, although concrete bricks are in high demand. She identified two main problems facing her business. One problem is inadequate capital and the second is irregular water supply. She now intends to combat these problems to make her business improve. Water is vital to her business. Concrete making uses a lot of water. Irregular water supply in her area makes her business difficult. She wants to build a concete water tank to act as a reservoir when the water supply is irregular. To implement her plan, Aziza is in need of $550.

loan.use: To purchase materials for a concrete making business

loan.name: Enyonam Sna

texts.en:
Mrs. Enyonam Sna A. is a young woman born in 1979 in Lom. She is married with one (01) child. After she failed twice to pass the Bac university entry-level exam, she abandoned her studies in favor of an office training program, at which she did very well. However, she did not have the resources to begin working in this profession right away. Her husband, also unemployed, could not help her. With a credit that she received and successfully paid back, she opened a small service center where she provided word processing and photocopying services. However, her ambition is to increase her business by selling computer consumables and office supplies. In order to carry out this plan, she is asking for a further $1200 in financing. She is a woman of character who has a strong desire to succeed where other women have failed. Her dynamism and devotion deserve to be supported.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Enyonam Sna est une jeune femme ne en1979 Lom. Elle est marie et mre dun (01) enfant. Suite deux checs successifs au Bac1, elle abandonna les tudes pour suivre une formation en bureautique qui lui a bien russi. Mais faute de moyens elle na pas pu exercer ce mtier temps. Son mari galement sans emploi ne pouvait pas lui venir en aide. Avec son crdit obtenu et dailleurs bien rembours, elle a ouvert un petit centre de multi services o elle fait des traitements de texte et des photocopies. Toutefois, son ambition est daccrotre ses activits par la vente des consommables informatiques et de fournitures de bureau. Pour raliser ce projet, elle demande un autre financement de $1200. Cest une femme de caractre qui a une forte envie de russir l o dautres femmes ont chou. Son dynamisme et son dvouement mritent dtre soutenus.

loan.use: selling computer consumables and office supplies

loan.name: Hortense

texts.en:
Mrs. Hortense D., born in 1975 in Lom, is married and the mother of three (03) children. Her business is running a restaurant serving local specialties in the market of B, a popular district in Lom. Her husband, a traveling photographer without a permanent job, can no longer meet all the needs of the family. Mrs. D., an ingenious woman, has put all of her know-how into her work and the idea of good hygiene, which means that everyone likes to eat in her restaurant. With such a large clientele, Mrs. D. cannot satsify everyone with her meager resources. That is why she is asking for a $500 credit to update the restaurant and build up a stock of the ingredients she uses in her business. This will increase her income and improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame D. Hortense, ne en 1975 Lom est marie et mre de trois (03) enfants. Elle exerce comme activit la restauration de mets locaux au march de B, un quartier populaire de Lom. Son mari, un photographe ambulant sans emploi fixe, narrive plus satisfaire tous les besoins de la famille. Femme ingnieuse, elle met tout son savoir-faire dans son travail et a la notion de lhygine, ce qui fait que tout le monde aime restaurer chez elle. Devant cette clientle, Madame D. narrive pas les satisfaire par ses maigres moyens. Elle sollicite donc un crdit de $500 pour lamnagement du lieu et faire un stock des denres qui entrent dans son commerce. Ceci pour augmenter son revenu et amliorer les conditions de vie d sa famille.

loan.use: Update the restaurant and build up a stock of ingredients

loan.name: Kamil

texts.en: Kamil sews on a machine the leather jackets for men. He is hardworker, has been engaged in this business for 15 years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy a leather sewing-machine. This 38-year-old man is single, Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Khojavend region, settled in Sabunchu region Bakikhanov settlement.

loan.use: To buy a leaher sewing-machine

loan.name: Elman

texts.en: Elman was born in 1953 in Baku ciy Sabunchu region. He is married, has 1 child. Having borrowed a loan of $600 he bought materials for individual manufacture. He has been engaged in this business for 6 years. Now he needs $1200 to buy a stone cutter.

loan.use: To buy a sone cutter

loan.name: Yahya

texts.en: Yahya is internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin region Minkend village. He is married. He settled with family and 2 children in Sumgait city. This 42-year-old man, Yahya started his business 10 years ago. His first loan was $700, bought 9 sheep. He spent the second loan $900 to buy 13 sheep. Third time he borrowed $1200 and bought 5 calves. It is necessary to note that Yahya is the one of the active clients of Normicro. Now he is planning to buy 8 sheep and 5 calves. Yahya applies for a loan amounting 1800$.

loan.use: To buy 8 sheep and 2 calves

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Lucy would like to buy 125 bags of cement for her hardware store.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Judy would like to pay School Fees for her child

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Veronica wants to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her land

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Leah would like to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Susan wants to buy fertilizer for her farm

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Margrate would like to buy an upgraded dairy cow

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Lucy would like to buy animal feeds

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Lucy wants to buy a dairy cow and renovate her cow shed.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Naomi would like to buy an upgraded dairy calf

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Ruth would like to buy 3 sacks of fertilizer and a dairy calf

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Shilliakah would like to buy cereals, beverages, laundry detergents and soft drinks for her business

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Flora would like to buy a dairy cow

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Esther would like to buy shares from stock exchange market

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Esther would like to buy 2 crates of tomatoes,1 sack of potatoes, a pack of onions and carrots for her grocery shop

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Esther would like to buy seedlings for planting on her land.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Lucy would like to buy varieties of vegetables for grocery

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Beatrice would like to buy cereal, laundry detergent, soft drinks, fuel, and beverages for her shop.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Esther would like to buy an ox

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Margrate would like to buy a bull

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Grace would like to buy 2 sacks of rice, laundry detergents, and soft drinks for her shop.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Jane would like to buy sacks of cereals, laundry detergents,beverages and antiseptics for her shop.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Nancy would like to buy bales of second hand clothes

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Jane would like to buy more chicks and expand theirthe poultry house

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Margaret would like to buy motor vehicle spare parts for her hardware business.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Joyce would like to buy inorganic manure for her land.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Christine would like to buy new clothes to sell.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Esther would like to buy cosmetics, and beauty products for her shop

loan.name: Oralia

texts.en:
Oralia is 53 years old and is mother of four children of 13, 15, 17 and 20 years of age. Her husband is a labourer and earns minimum wage. Four years ago she decided, seeing the need of her 4 children, to help her husband and started a small business selling seafood, with the ultimate goal of earning extra income to cover all of their necessities. Her husband\'s earnings were not enough and now that their children find themselves in school, their expenses are more every day. With a great deal of effort and hard work, she has managed to expand her small restaurant, having always counted on the emotional support of her family.

She needs a loan of $475 to pruchase products andn utensils that she requires for the preparation of food and, in this manner, generate greater earning to further expand her business. Oralia has fought hard to build what she now has. Help her keep growing. She and her family will thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Oralia es madre tiene 53 aos de edad y es madre de 4 hijos de 13, 15, 17 y 20 aos de edad, su esposo es obrero y gana el salario mnimo. Hace cuatro aos ella, al verse en la necesidad de sacar adelante a sus 4 hijos y ayudar a su esposo, inici un pequeo negocio de venta de mariscos, con la finalidad de poder obtener ingresos extras que le permitieran cubrir todas las necesidades. Pues con lo que gana su esposo no es suficiente, ya que sus hijos se encuentran estudiando y los gastos son cada da mayores. Con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado ampliar su negocio de comida, contando con el apoyo emocional de su familia.

Ella necesita de un crdito de $ 475 DLLS par poder comprar productos y utensilios que requiere para la elaboracin de sus alimentos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para poder ampliara su negocio. Oralia ha luchado mucho par construir lo que hasta ahora tiene, aydala a seguir creciendo, ella y su familia te lo van a agradecer.

loan.use: purchase merchandise

loan.name: Inocencia

texts.en:
Inocencia is orginally from the State of Guerrero, but 10 years ago she saw the need to emigrate to the community of Pedro Escobedo in the State of Queretaro, looking for better opportunities as their financial situation was in grave trouble. With a few savings she had she started a stand selling seafood, the very same one that today still exists and has evolved with satisfaction over the years. Inocencia has fought hard for her family and with all her effort she has managed to give them what they need.

she now requires a loan of $475 to purchase merchandise, and therefore increase her sales and expand the business. Help her grow. She will thank you. Become part of her effots. Don\'t doubt it any longer. Your generosity will be of great help.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Inocencia es originara del estado de Guerrero, pero hace 10 aos se vio en la necesidad de emigrar a la comunidad de Pedro Escobedo, en el estado de Quertaro, en busca de una mejor oportunidad, pues su situacin econmica estaba en graves problemas. Con un poco de capital que tena lleg y estableci un puesto de venta de mariscos, mismo que hoy sigue vigente y que al pasar de los aos ha ido evolucionando satisfactoriamente. Inocencia ha luchado mucho por su familia y con todo su esfuerzo ha logrado darles lo necesario.

Ella ahora requiere de un prstamo de $475 DLLS para poder comprar ms mercanca, incrementar sus ventas y poder as ampliar su negocio. Aydala acrecer, ella te lo va agradecer, vulvete parte de sus logros, no lo dudes ms, tu generosidad ser de gran ayuda.

loan.use: purchase merchandise

loan.name: Simn

texts.en:
Simon is married and lives with his family in the community of Huinala, in the city of of Apodaca, Nuevo Leon. He makes and sells rustic furniture and this is the only source of sustenance for his family. With great effort and dedication he managed to keep to his business, always motivated by the great love he feels for his family.

He requires a loan of $1100 to purchase wood and therfore produce more furniture and increase his sales. He realizes now that his earnings are not enough to cover the school expenses for his two little ones. Help Simon provide his children with the education they need. He and his family will sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Simn es casado y vive con su familia en la comunidad de Huinala, en el municipio de Apodaca, Nuevo Len. El se dedica a la produccin y venta de muebles rsticos, es el nico medio de sustento para su familia. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicacin ha logrado continuar con su proyecto, siempre incentivado por el gran amor que le tiene a su familia.

El requiere de un prstamo de $1100 DLLS para poder comprar madera y fabricar un mayor nmero de muebles y as incrementar sus ventas. Ya que con lo percibe actualmente no es suficiente para cubrir los gastos escolares de sus dos pequeos. Ayuda a Simn a darles la ecuacin que requieren a sus hijos, no lo dudes ms, la decisin sta en tus manos, el y su familia te lo van agradecer sinceramente.

loan.use: purchase wood

loan.name: Gnapot

texts.en:
Born in Lom in 1952, Mrs. Gnapot A. is married and the mother of six (06) children, with one domestic staff member. She is a vendor of various products. Her husband, a taxi driver who is no longer working, now barely contributes anything to the households needs. This means that his wife must bear all the expenses. Despite her enthusiasm and good faith, she is limited by her resources. Mrs. A. has thus decided to ask for financial support to expand her business. The $550 credit that she is seeking will serve as seed money to buy a variety of products in order to expand her selection. Her experience is a useful asset in making her business profitable and earning a substantial income to meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, Kiva Volunteer.

Ne en 1952 Lom, Madame A. Gnapot est marie et mre de six (06) enfants avec un domestique charge. Elle est commerante de produits divers. Son mari, un chauffeur de taxi qui nest plus en activit, ne contribue presque plus dans les besoins du foyer. Ainsi, toutes les dpenses reviennent la femme. Malgr son ardeur et sa bonne foi, elle est limite par les moyens. Elle dcide alors de solliciter un appui financier pour largir son commerce. Le crdit de $550 quelle demande va donc servir de fonds de commerce pour lachat des produits divers afin dagrandir son talage. Son exprience est un bon atout pour rentabiliser ses activits et dgager un revenu substantiel pour les besoins sa famille.

loan.use: Selling various products

loan.name: Agns

texts.en:
Mrs. Agns A. was born in 1964 in Dalav (P/Zio). She is married and the mother of two (02) children, with one (01) other child under her care. Her main business is selling coconuts that are used in making palm oil, which is highly valued in Togo. Her husband, a retiree, does not even receive his meager pension, and so Mrs. A. must bear all of the household expenses. However, she has gained a real mastery of her business, which she has been managing for more than 20 years with all the rigor of a responsible manager. Mrs. A. began her business in very difficult conditions, but thanks to her management abilities and especially her business sense, her activities grew to a very encouraging size, requiring additional financing. Her honesty and good faith were demonstrated when she paid back her first credit without any problems. The trust she earned should be worth further financing to expand her business in order to increase her income and improve her living conditions. The $850 credit will thus allow her to buy a large stock from the farms.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Agns est ne en 1964 Dalav (P/Zio). Elle est marie et mre de deux (02) enfants et un (01) enfant autre charge. Son activit principale est la vente des noix de palme qui entrent dans la fabrication de lhuile de palme trs apprcie au Togo. Son mari, un retrait, ne peroit mme pas sa maigre pension. Toutes les charges du mnage reposent alors sur elle. Toutefois, Madame A. fait preuve de la matrise de son activit quelle gre depuis plus de 20 ans avec toute la rigueur dune gestion responsable. Madame A. a dbute ses activits dans des conditions trs difficiles mais, grce sa capacit de gestion et surtout son sens daffaires, son commerce a pris une ampleur trs encourageante qui ncessite des financements dappoint. Son honntet et sa bonne foi ont t dmontres lors de son premier crdit rembours sans difficult. Cette confiance peut lui valoir dautres financements pour augmenter ses affaires afin daccrotre ses revenus et damliorer des conditions de vie. Ainsi, le crdit de $850 va lui servir de sapprovisionner en grande quantit dans les fermes.

loan.use: Buying and selling coconuts

loan.name: Christine

texts.en:
Mrs. Christine E. is the mother of four (04) children. She has lived for some twenty years with her two (02) sisters in the house she shares with her husband. A blacksmith by trade, her husband has difficulty meeting the familys needs. This is why Mrs. E. covers more than 70% of the household expenses using the income from her business of selling generic products. She has been in this business for 5 years and has completely mastered it. During the day, Mrs. E. walks from neighborhood to neighborhood with her products before displaying them on the side of the road in the evening. Dynamic and honest, Mrs. E. has proven herself to be a capable manager and a trustworthy woman by receiving and successfully paying back her first two credits of $100 and $200 respectively without any incidents. In order to expand her selection and increase her business, Christine is asking for a new credit of $750, which will allow her to buy medicines directly from wholesalers. This will make it possible for her to increase her revenue and better take care of her family.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame E. Christine est mre de quatre (04) enfants. Elle vit depuis une vingtaine danne avec ses deux (02) surs au domicile conjugal. Forgeron de mtier, son mari subvient difficilement aux besoins de la famille. Aussi, intervient-elle plus de 70% dans les charges du foyer travers les revenus issus de ses activits de vente des produits gnriques. Elle exerce cette activit depuis 5 ans et en a une matrise totale. Pendant la journe, Madame E. Christine se promne de quartier en quartier avant de les exposer le soir au bord de la route. Dynamique et honnte, Madame E. Christine fait preuve dune bonne gestionnaire et dune femme de confiance travers ses deux premiers crdits respectifs de $100 et $200 obtenus et rgulirement rembourss sans incident. Pour largir son talage et accrotre son activit, Christine sollicite un nouveau crdit de $750 qui lui permettra dacheter les mdicaments directement chez les grossistes. Ceci lui permettra daugmenter son chiffre daffaires afin de mieux soccuper de sa famille.

loan.use: Buying and selling generic medicines

loan.name: Sylvain

texts.en:
Sylvain T. is a very energetic and friendly man. His wife is a retailer, and they have married three children. His mother and his kids are additions to his responsibilities. Seeing that his profits from selling fuel oil is insufficient to provide for them, he began tutoring some of the neighborhood children for extra income. That was how he was able to pay off his initial loan without a problem.

Mr. T. is always short of fuel oil because of insufficient resource capital to meet the demands of the market. So, to develop his business which he calls Papa Petro and derive a higher profit margin for the benefit of his family, he is requesting a second loan, amounting to $850, which would allow him to construct a bigger supply tank. He could then have a substantial supply of fuel oil to satisfy customer demand.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur T. Sylvain est un homme trs dynamique et ouvert. Mari une revendeuse, il est pre de trois (03) enfants. Sa mre et ses petits ont alourdi ses charges. Sapercevant que les bnfices de la vente du ptrole ne suffisent pas subvenir aux besoins de la famille, il y associe les cours de rptition quelques enfants de son quartier. Ce qui lui procure des revenus complmentaires. Ainsi, il a pu solder son premier crdit sans difficult.

Monsieur T. Sylvain est toujours en rupture de stock car son capital est insuffisant pour rpondre aux demandes de son march. Ainsi, accrotre son activit et en tirer plus de marges bnficiaires pouvant contribuer lamlioration des conditions de vie de sa famille, Sylvain sollicite un second crdit de $850 qui lui permettra de construire une citerne plus grande afin de faire un stock plus consistant de ptrole et rpondre aux demandes de sa clientle.

loan.use: Construction of a tank and buying fuel oil

loan.name: Brice

texts.en:
Brice D. is married, the father of three, and is the guardian for two of his brothers. He is a mechanic by training and has demonstrated a good mastery of his trade. The quality of his work is what has won him a good reputation in his neighborhood and beyond. Very energetic and a go-getter, he has noticed that there is not one single shop selling spare parts in his area while the need for them exists. He would like to seize the opportunity to establish one next-door to his shop. This would provide him with extra income and allow him to better ensure the education of his children and apprenticeships for his brothers.

This is why he is requesting a loan of $850 which will serve to buy tools and to build an inventory of spare parts. The loan will allow him to increase his income in support of his familys welfare.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur D. Brice est mari et pre de trois (03) enfants et a sa charge deux (02) de ses frres. Il est mcanicien de formation et fait preuve dune bonne matrise de son mtier. La qualit de ses prestations lui confre une bonne rputation dans son quartier et ses environs. Trs dynamique et pleine dinitiatives, il saperoit quil ny a pas une boutique de vente de pices dtache dans son quartier alors que les besoins et existent. Il veut saisir cette opportunit pour mettre ct de son atelier, une petite boutique de vente des pices dtaches qui peut lui procurer des revenus complmentaires lui permettant de mieux assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants et lapprentissage de ses frres.

Cest ainsi quil sollicite un crdit de $850 qui va lui servir de dacheter de petit outillage et de sapprovisionner en pices dtaches. Ce crdit lui permettra daccrotre ses revenus pour le bien-tre de sa famille.

loan.use: To buy tools and sell spare parts

loan.name: Aml Elisabeth

texts.en:
Aml Elisabeth H. has been married for over twenty years. In addition to her six children, she takes care of her mum. They all add to her household expenses. Nevertheless, her courage and energy have allowed her to keep selling beignets (a kind of doughnut) for 13 years, there on the roadside, to supplement her husbands small salary. Despite her grade-school level of education, Ms. H. has a keen sense for managing loans and is very frugal. Naturally honest through and through, she embodies trust and deserves financial support.

Elisabeth is currently requesting a loan of $500 to buy a larger quantity of flour, which is the primary ingredient in preparing beignets. She would also like to acquire various goods to offer for sale. The loan will allow her to better take care of her childrens needs with regards to health, nourishment, and schooling. It will also raise her familys living standard.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame H. Aml Elisabeth est une femme marie depuis une vingtaine dannes. En plus de ses six (06) enfants, elle a en charge sa maman, ce qui accrot ses dpenses familiales. Nanmoins, son courage et son dynamisme lui ont permis depuis 13 ans de vendre des beignets aux abords des routes pour accompagner le petit salaire de son mari. Malgr son niveau dinstruction primaire, Madame H. Aml Elisabeth a un sens aigu de la gestion de crdits et une notion approfondie dpargne. Dote dune honntet parfaite elle nourrit confiance et mrite dtre financirement soutenus.

Elisabeth sollicite aujourdhui ce crdit de $500 pour acheter une quantit plus importante de farine de bl, matire premire de base la prparation des beignets et acheter pour revente de divers produits. Ce crdit lui permettra de mieux soccuper de besoins de sant, de nourriture, de scolarit de ses enfants et relever le niveau de vie de sa famille.

loan.use: To buy flour to make and sell beignets

loan.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine F. got married to a teacher with whom she had three children. She also looks after a little brother and three sisters, who are in apprenticeships. Her husbands salary cannot cover the bills, so she is compelled to help him with income from selling ice water and fruit juice. She has had this business, which she names Esprance (Hope), for five years and has been doing well in it. She is a very disciplined woman with regards to management and has proven to be honest and trustworthy by successfully repaying an initial loan of $250 without a problem.

She is requesting another loan, in the amount of $550, which will allow her to acquire sugar, fruit, and other ingredients for making juice and ice water. The success of her plans will augment her production and therefore increase her income for the welfare of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame F. Justine sest marie un enseignant avec qui elle a trois (03) enfants et a sa charge 1 petit frre et 3 surs en apprentissage. Le salaire de son mari ne pouvant pas couvrir les charges, elle est dans lobligation de contribuer en aidant son mari avec les revenus de vente deau glace et du jus de fruit. Cela fait 5 ans quelle exerce ce commerce quelle matrise assez bien. Elle est femme trs rigoureuse en matire de gestion et a fait preuve de femme dhonntet et de confiance travers son premier crdit de $250 obtenu et rgulirement rembours sans incident.

Elle sollicite un second crdit de $550 qui va lui permettre de sacheter du sucre, fruits, et autres matires qui entrent dans la fabrication du jus et de leau glace. La ralisation de projet augmentera sa production et de facto accrotra ses revenus pour le mieux-tre de sa famille.

loan.use: To buy sugar and fruit to make fruit juice and to sell ice water.

loan.name: Abla

texts.en:
Abla Z. has been married for 13 years to a taxi driver, and they have four children. She is practically a professional when it comes to producing and marketing cassava flour and tapioca. She has derived a great deal of experience from this business of hers, which she had before getting married. And she has proved herself to be a good manager. Yet she is no longer able to meet the expectations of her customers due to a lack of capital funds and thus is always short on inventory. This situation might create a crisis of trust with her customers if she cannot gain financial support.

To avoid this problem, Ms. Z. is requesting a loan of $550 to buy fields of cassava plants (the source of both cassava flour and tapioca) in order to develop her business, which she calls Le Ptit Grain (The Little Bead) and extend it to Lom, the capitol. The loan will allow her to augment her income to better ensure the welfare of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame Z. Abla sest marie depuis 13 ans un conducteur de taxi. De leur union, sont ns quatre (04) enfants. Elle est une vritable professionnelle dans la production et la commercialisation du gari et de tapioca. Cette activit quelle exerce avant son mariage lui procure une large exprience et elle fait preuve dune bonne gestionnaire. Toutefois, elle narrive plus satisfaire les demandes de sa clientle elle est toujours en rupture de stock cause de linsuffisance de son capital. Cette situation risque de crer une crise de confiance avec ses clients si elle ne bnficie pas dun appui financier.

Pour ce faire, Madame Z. Abla sollicite un crdit de $550 pour acheter des champs de manioc (matires de premires de base la production du gari et de tapioca) en vue daccrotre ses activits et diriger son commerce ver Lom. Ce qui lui permettra daugmenter ses revenus afin de mieux assurer le bien-tre de sa famille.

loan.use: To buy cassava fields an to produce cassava flour and tapioca.

loan.name: Kossiwa

texts.en:
Married to a primary school teacher for ten years, Kossiwa F. has three children and also takes care of her mother. Her husband lost his salary 18 months ago, and she feels compelled to cover all family expenses with her income from selling various manufactured goods. Her primary-school education gives her insight into management, and she exhibits a dynamism in her activities. She embodies trust and deserves financial support.

She is requesting a loan of $550 to augment her purchasing power towards selling manufactured products, such as shoes and sandals. Her goal is to increase her income and to better provide for the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Marie un enseignant du primaire depuis 10 ans, Madame F. Kossiwa a trois (03) enfants et sa mre en charge. Son mari est sans salaire il y a 18 mois et elle se voit dans lobligation de prendre toutes les charges familiales avec les revenus de la vente des divers produits manufacturs. Son niveau dinstruction primaire lui confre une clairvoyance dans sa gestion et un dynamisme dans ses activits. Elle nourrit confiance et mrite dtre appuye financirement.

Elle sollicite un crdit de $550 dans le but daugmenter son pouvoir dachat et de vente des produits manufacturs afin daccrotre ses revenus et de mieux subvenir aux besoins de la famille.

loan.use: To buy and sell shoes and sandals

loan.name: Ablavi

texts.en:
Ablavi A. is the mother of three children who are still in school. Her husband's retirement pension does not ensure that family needs are totally covered. So Ms. A. is obliged to contribute to their household income by selling corn and sodabi (a local distilled palm wine). Having a good handle on her business, she is doing well. But her capital funds are quite insufficient to develop her business. No longer able to meet the expectations of her customers with the funds that she has, she is therefore requesting a loan of $650 as capital to build a substantial stock of corn and sodabi. The loan will allow her to raise her economic and social living standard for the welfare of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Ablavi est mre de trois (03) enfants encore en scolarit. Les pensions de retraite de son mari nassurent pas une totale couverture des besoins de la famille. Alors Madame A. est oblige de contribuer partir des revenus de son commerce de mas et de sodabi (boisson locale base de palmier). Matrisant bien son activit, elle arrive bien sen sortir. Mais, son fonds de commerce est trs insuffisant pour dvelopper et accrotre ses activits. Ainsi, ne pouvant plus satisfaire la demande de sa clientle avec ses propres moyens, elle sollicite un crdit de $650 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce faire un stockage consistant de mas et de sodabi. Ce crdit lui permettra dlever son niveau conomique et social pour le bien-tre de sa famille.

loan.use: To buy and stock corn and sodabi

loan.name: Qandi Gul

texts.en:
Qandi Gul is a 39 year old widow with 3 of her children living in Distrit 15 of Kabul City, her original place is the North of Afghanistan where the place was extremely damaged during the 5 years of Taliban Gov, she lost her Husband and the whole house 7 years ago.

She got AFSG first loan to make more hand embroidery and peral sewing to design women and girls dresses for wedding and other special occasions.

loan.use: To buy the sewing supplies, Fabric and peral to make dresses

loan.name: Anis Gul

texts.en:
Anis Gul is a widow of 41 years old with her 11 children. She is a baker who is making bread in her house in a small Tandor (Local Stove) and then her son and her small daughter sell them in the street.

She also accepts orders from her clients to make breads from the dough that they bring. She is mainly from Shamali where there was war for almost 30 years and she lost everything there and now she is living in Kabul.

loan.use: To buy Flour to make dough for baking bread

loan.name: Bibi Sadaf

texts.en:
Bi Bi Sadaf is 50 years old with her 5 children living in District 2 of Kabul City. She is a widow who passed almost 10 years of her life in poverty and living through very difficult times.

She lost her husband due to his sickness while she did not have money to take him to the Doctor. She hopes to receive her first loan through AFSG so she can process and package the vegetable and fresh fruit and her son is selling them on a small hand cart.

loan.use: To buy Vegetable and Fresh fruit

loan.name: Charles

texts.en: CHARLES K. lives in the Vituka area of Dar es Salaam. He is 55 years old and married with four children. Charles is a retired civil servant. He owns a bar and guest house near a bus terminal with buses to the southern regions of Tanzania. His business is well situated. The guest house is usually filled with customers who spend a night before they get on the buses the next day. The house has a section used as a bar where guests can have different kinds of drinks. He built this guest house from retirement benefits accrued to him for the years he served as a civil servant. He employs six people in his business. He himself keeps the finances, while his wife takes care of daily operations. The business is the sole income generating unit for the family. He wants to improve the business by adding enough sitting chairs, tables, bedsheets, and curtains. He also wants to buy a storage tank for reserving water in case of irregular public water supply. To implement his plan, Charles is in need of $1000.

loan.use: To buy chairs, tables, bedsheets, and curtains

loan.name: Leonard

texts.en: LEONARD L. is 52 years old and married with five children. He lives in the Vituka area of Dar es Salaam. L. owns and runs a refreshment center located near his residence. He is a retired civil servant, and the business is the sole income generating unit for the family. In his center, he sells cold drinks, alcoholic drinks, and different kinds of snacks. His center is used by the people of the area as a place to refresh themselves after working hours. He has a plan to improve the business by stockpiling enough drinks and, more importantly, sitting chairs and tables. He experienced a shortage of chairs and tables during the time around Christmas. He does not like to lose as many customers as he lost during Christmas due to insufficient chairs and tables. He also wants to buy a pool table to make his center even attractive. Pool has become very popular nowadays in Dar es Salaam. People travel a long way to find places to play pool. To make his plan work, L. is in need of $1000.

loan.use: To purchase chairs, tables, and serving vessels

loan.name: Chacha

texts.en:
CHACHA M. is 33 years old and married with two children. He keeps chickens(layers) in huts built near his residence.

Chacha is planning to add a new flock of chicks, as the existing flock is soon to be culled (taken out of the hut). For this strategy, he will need to add a stock of chicken feed and medications. Raising chicks up to the time when they start laying eggs needs a lot of investment, both in terms of money and time. Chacha has employed two assistants in his business who take care of the chickens while he supplies eggs to his customers. He wants to expand the business by increasing the number of chickens kept from the 600 birds he usually keeps to 1000 birds. The expansion strategy also needs some funding. To implement his plans, Chacha needs $750.

loan.use: To buy chicks, chicken feed, and medications

loan.name: David

texts.en: DAVID L. lives in Yombo-Vituka in the outskirts of Dar es Salaam. He is married with four children. Two are in primary school and one is in secondary school. David owns a small pharmacy near his residence selling human medications. He has six years' experience in this business. His business is licenced by the authorities. He frequently faces shortages of medications for malaria and water contamination diseases like cholera, typhoid, and amoebiasis. The situation is intense, especially during the rainy periods. Dar es Salaam is now in the rainy season. He is in need of $750 to replenish his stock.

loan.use: To increase the stock of medications

loan.name: Mara Teresa

texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Teresa has been divorced for some time. She has two children and she lives in the city of Kanasin in Yucatan. She saw the need to start a business that would permit her to support her children, as her ex-husband did not help them with their expenses. Following this difficult situation, Maria Teresa started two years ago with a small grocery store, and to increase her earnings she started a movie rental. She found that movie rentals were in great demand to she decided to set up her Video club, a business that she has managed for the past two years, and it has been improving thanks to her efforts and arduous work.

Her integrity and responsibility are the qualities that define Maria Teresa. She now requires a loan in the amount of $925 to purchase movies and be able to have more new releases and improve her income. Your generosity can be a great help for her. Do not doubt any longer and support her. She and her children will forever thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Mara Teresa es divorciada desde hace algn tiempo, tiene 2 hijos y vive en la localidad de Kanasn, Yucatn. Ella se vio en la necesidad de buscar una actividad que le permitir sostener a sus hijos, ya que el su ex esposo no le ayuda con los gastos. Frente a esta difcil situacin, Maria Teresa comenz hace dos aos con una pequea tienda de abarrotes y para incrementar sus ingresos decidi rentar pelculas, ella vio que la renta de pelculas tena mucha demanda y se decidi a poner un Video club, con este negocio lleva ms de 2 aos y ha mejorado gracias a su esfuerzo y arduo trabajo.

La entereza y la responsabilidad son cualidades que definen a Mara Teresa, ella ahora requiere de un prstamo por la cantidad de $ 925 DLLS par comprar un lote de pelculas y as poder tener ms estrenos y mejorar sus ingresos. Tu generosidad puede ser de gran ayuda para ella, no lo dudes ms y apyala, ella y sus hijos te lo van agradecer siempre.

loan.use: purchase movies

loan.name: Mara Agustina

texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Agustina started selling cosmetics to have an income as she was widowed 16 years ago. She also provides house cleaning and little by little, with her efforts as her foundation, she started increasing her cosmetic sales. Her strongest motivation has been the great love she feels for her four children. Despite the difficult times she face when her husband passed away, she aged to keep going and fought for the sake of her family.

Now Maria Agustina requires a loan of $475 that she will use to purchase a display cabinet for her products. You can become a fundamental part of her effots and those of her family. Do not hesitate, remember that they need you and they thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Mara Agustina empez a vender cosmticos por la necesidad de tener un ingreso ya que enviud hace 16 aos. Ella tambin se dedica a hacer limpieza en casas particulares y poco a poco con base a su esfuerzo ha logrado incrementar sus ingresos con su venta de cosmticos. El principal impulso de ella ha sido el gran amor que le tiene a sus cuatro hijos. A pesar de los difciles momentos que enfrent cuando su esposo falleci ella supo seguir y luchar por su familia.

Ahora Mara Agustina requiere de un prstamo de $ 475 DLLS, mismos que utilizar en la compra de una vidriera de exhibicin para la presentacin de sus productos. T puedes convertirte en parte fundamental de los logros de ella y su familia, no lo sudes ms, recuerda que ellos te necesitan y te lo agradecen.

loan.use: purchase cabinet

loan.name: Guloglan

texts.en: Guloglan is internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Zangilan region. He is married. He settled with family and 3 children in Sumgait city. 43-year-old Guloglan started his business 9 years ago. His first loan was $700, bought 3 calves. The loans were paid back timely. Now he is planning to buy 4 calves. Guloglan applies for a loan amounting 1000$.

loan.use: He is planning to buy 4 calves

loan.name: Florence

texts.en: Mrs. Florence Y. is a 40 year old woman who is married and has 6 children. She lives in a semi-urban area in the Edo State in Nigeria, and she runs a small food market in her community. Florence hopes to use her loan to buy more goods and increase her business growth.

loan.use: To buy goods for her store

loan.name: Abunoya

texts.en: Mrs. Abunoya I. is 33 years old. She owns a small store in the Edo State of Nigeria that sells general provisions such as food and cooking supplies. Abunoya is seeking a loan for the expansion of her business. She is married and has four children.

loan.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loan.name: Amezee

texts.en: Mrs. Amezee E. is a 29 year old woman who lives in a semi-urban area in the Edo State of Nigeria. She sells soft drinks at her own store. Amezee spent 2 months learning her trade before she decided to start her own business. She would like to use a loan to buy more soft drinks to sell.

loan.use: To buy more drinks to sell

loan.name: Taiwo

texts.en: Mrs. Taiwo I. is 41 years old. She is married and has one child. Taiwo lives in an urban area in the Edo State of Nigeria, and she owns a tailoring business. She completed two years of training to learn how to sew clothes, and then she opened her own business. A loan will help Taiwo buy more material to expand her business.

loan.use: To expand her business

loan.name: Monica

texts.en: Mrs. Monica A. is 38 years old, and is married with 3 children. She lives in the semi-urban area of Benin City, Nigeria where she sells firewood to her friends and neighbors. Monica cherishes her business very much. A loan will help her purchase more firewood and expand her business so that she can help support her family.

loan.use: to improve on her business

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To expand her farming business

loan.name: Rose

texts.en: A mother of three children, Mrs. Rose O. lives in Benin City in the Edo State of Nigeria. She owns a store, and has been in business for five years. Rose sells provisions and food items to the public. She is looking forward to getting a loan to improve her business by purchasing more goods to sell.

loan.use: To buy more goods for expansion

loan.name: Adesuwa

texts.en: Mrs. Adesuwa O. is 34 years old, and is married with two children. She lives in an urban area in the Edo State of Nigeria, and owns a clothing store. Adesuwa spent five months learning her trade before she started her own business in 2005. She would like a loan to increase her inventory and grow her business.

loan.use: To buy clothes to sell

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To expand his farming business

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To expand his farming business

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To expand his farming business

loan.name: Grace

texts.en: A 25 year old experienced trader, Mrs. Grace I. sells clothes to the people of her community. She owns her own store entitled Grace Bouquet. Grace would like a loan so that she can increase her inventory and grow her business.

loan.use: To buy clothes to sell

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To expand his farming business

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To expand his tomato farming business

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To expand her tomato farming business

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To expand his tomato farming business

loan.name: Mabel

texts.en: A 38 year old experienced business woman, Mrs. Mabel O. sells building materials to the public. She is married with four children and she hails from Benin City in the Edo State of Nigeria. A loan will help Mabel purchase more building supplies to satisfy the demand of her customers.

loan.use: To buy more goods to sell

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To purchase another knapsack sprayer for rental

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To purchase farming inputs

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To purchase a dairy cow and to build a cow shed

loan.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Mrs. Elizabeth E. specializes in the sale of "baby items" such as clothes and toys. She is 39 years old and a mother of four children. She plans to expand her business with a loan.

loan.use: To buy more items to sell

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To restock his boutique

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To purchase a motorbike to use as a taxi

loan.name: Kamil

texts.en: Kamil is married. 33-year Kamil is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli. He settled with his family in Sumgait city. Kamil has been engaged in newspaper sales and an lottery sales, to improve his familys living condition. Having borrowed the 2 loans from Normicro he solved his business problems. Now he plans to sell office supplies. He applies for a loan amount of $700 to buy the different office supplies.

loan.use: To buy the different office supplies

loan.name: Mahir

texts.en: Mahir is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli. He settled with his family in Sumgait city. He is 36. He married and has 3 children. Since 2005 he has been engaged in newspaper sales and an lottery sales. Having borrowed the loan amount of $300 from Normicro he has bought the newspaper store. The second time he borrowed $300. He applies for the loan $500 to rent the grocery store and buy writing materials.

loan.use: To rent the grocery store and buy writing materials

loan.name: Sakina

texts.en: Sakina is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Zangilan. She settled with his family in Sumgait city. Sakina is 47 years old and has 3 children. She is the only breadwinner in family. In the beginning hers business she rented a small cafe. Having borrowed the loan from Kiva she wants to buy the new chairs, tables and to expand the area of hers cafe. On a dinner break workers have dinner here and clients are very happy with the servant. She applies for the loan $400 to buy the new chairs and to expand the area of hers cafe.

loan.use: To buy the new chairs and to expand the area of hers cafe

loan.name: Dilgam

texts.en: 43-year-old Dilgam with his 4 children settled in Sumgait city. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Lachin region. Since 2002 he has been engaged in meat sales to improve his familys living condition. As he did not have enough funds, he could not develop his business well enough in the beginning. Having borrowed first loans of amount $500 he significantly expanded his business, bought the new ax and the scales. The loans were paid back timely. Now Dilgam wants the loan in amount $800 to build own butcher shop.

loan.use: To build own butcher shop

loan.name: Khaiyam

texts.en: Khaiyam has been engaged in food distribution and sales for the past five years. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Jabrail region, relocated to Sumgait city. He is 39 years old with two children. He has his own mini market. He borrowed a loan of $500 from Normicro in order to build the grocery store. The second loan he borrowed of $800 was used to purchase foodstuffs like sugar, tea, rice, etc. Now Khaiyam wants another loan for $1200 to increase his inventory and to provide his customers with more product options.

loan.use: To increase his inventory

loan.name: Mawul

texts.en:
Mawul A. is married and the mother of four. Her husband barely grows enough to feed his family. You see, this household is confronted daily with hardship of all sorts, notably hunger and sickness. To help with household expenses, Ms. A. has started a small business selling food crops. She has now gained a great deal of experience allowing her to really grasp the inner workings of the business. Thanks to her heightened sense of management, she was been able to repay each loan that she has obtained.

Today, Ms. A. is requesting a loan of $650 to augment her ability keep an inventory of goods to sell in times of shortages. The loan will serve as capital to buy, stock, and sell food crops. The success of her dreams will be very beneficial, particularly in terms of savings. She will also succeed at better providing for her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Mawul est une femme marie et mre de quatre (04) enfants. Son mari pratique une agriculture de subsistance qui suffit peine pour lalimentation de la famille. Du coup, le mnage est confront quotidiennement aux difficults de tout genre notamment la faim et la maladie. Pour contribuer la prise en charge des besoins de la famille, Madame A. a entrepris le petit commerce de vente des produits vivriers. Aujourdhui, elle a acquis une grande exprience qui lui permet de bien cerner les rouages de son activit. Grce son sens lev de gestion, elle a pu rembourser tous les crdits quelle a obtenus.

Aujourdhui, Madame A. Mawul sollicite un crdit de $650 pour augmenter sa capacit de stockage afin de vendre ses produits en temps de pnurie. Le crdit servira de fonds de commerce pour lachat, le stockage et la revente des produits vivriers. La ralisation de ce rve lui sera trs bnfique notamment en matire dpargne. Aussi, russira t-elle mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loan.use: To buy, stock, and sell produce

loan.name: Ywwoto

texts.en:
Married and the mother of three, Ywwoto G. makes gari (cassava flour), one of the staples of southern Togo for over thirty years. Despite being in her sixties, her experience and energy are undeniable. Her husband lost his ability to work which leaves Ms. G. to face paying the bills by herself. The quality of her product has earned her a large customer base because good women come from Lom to buy her gari. But without enough money, her production of gari is very limited, and her customers are increasingly disappointed. She is now dealing with a strong demand that she cannot meet. Making gari is difficult, given the high risk of injury, particularly when grating the cassava root by hand. Today, she is requesting a loan of $600 to buy a grater in order to increase her production and her profit margin, all to better provide for her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Marie et mre de trois (03) enfants, Madame G. Ywwoto produit du gari (farine base de manioc), lun des aliments de base au Sud du Togo depuis une trentaine dannes. Malgr sa soixantaine, elle possde une exprience et un dynamisme impeccable. Son mari a perdu sa force de travail ; ce qui laisse Madame G. seule devant les charges du mnage. La qualit de sa production lui a procur une clientle importante car les bonnes femmes viennent depuis Lom pour acheter son gari. Mais nayant pas assez de moyens sa production est trs limite et les clients sont de plus en plus dus. Elle fait face aujourdhui une forte demande quelle est incapable de satisfaire. La fabrication du gari est une activit trs pnible avec tous les risques de blessures que cela comporte surtout avec le rpage manuel du manioc. Elle sollicite aujourdhui un crdit de $600 qui servira lachat dune rpeuse afin daccrotre sa production et augmenter son chiffre daffaire et de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loan.use: To buy a grater

loan.name: Ablavi

texts.en:
Ablavi K. is a young woman who has been married since 1995. She is the mother of four. Besides her four children, she also takes care of her retired elderly parents. Her husband, a farmer, does not have a steady income that would allow him to effectively support the family. The children are often sent home from class because the tuition goes unpaid. Ms. K. is compelled to diversify her business because she must cover a big share of household expenses. So, aside from her work in the fields, she makes rope and sells it at the marketplace. She would now like to improve her business, which she names "La Fileuse du Village" (The Village Weaver) but lacks the money to acquire the materials for her work. She is requesting a loan of $600 for raw materials in sizable amounts to make rope.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame K. Ablavi est une jeune dame marie depuis 1995 et mre de quatre (04) enfants. En dehors de ses enfants, elle prend en charge ses parents inactifs cause de leur ge avanc. Son mari qui est un cultivateur na pas un revenu fixe qui lui permet de subvenir efficacement aux besoins de la famille. Les enfants sont souvent renvoys de lcole pour non payement des frais de scolarit. Madame K. qui doit prendre une grande part dans les charges du mnage est oblige de diversifier ses activits. Ainsi, en dehors des travaux champtres, elle tisse des cordes quelle vend au march.

Aujourdhui elle veut amliorer cette activit mais ne dispose pas assez de moyens pour lacquisition du matriel de travail. Elle sollicite un crdit dun montant de $600 qui va servir lacquisition en quantit du matriel ncessaire pour le tissage des cordes.

loan.use: To acquire materials to make rope

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Rosemary would like to buy foodstuffs for her business

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Emily would like to buy 5 boxes of second hand shoes.

loan.name: Aymiah

texts.en:
Aymiah D. has been a widow for five years. Her deceased husband left her with three children that she supports in addition to her parents. To feed her family, she started a business selling common chickens. She is especially courageous and worries about making sure her children are educated. So she works tirelessly going from village to village to look for chickens to sell back in town. But since family expenses have grown more and more onerous, Ms. D. just cannot go any further. And so she is asking for help to improve her business. Her skill and honesty has resulted in more business than she can handle. She is therefore requesting a loan of $850 to enlarge her chicken coop and to serve as capital to do trade in chickens. The profits gained from this activity will allow her to provide for her orphaned children. She will also be able to save more money to improve her financial situation.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame D. Aymiah est veuve depuis 5 ans. Son mari dfunt a laiss sa charge trois (03) enfants quelle supporte en plus de ses parents. Pour pouvoir nourrir sa famille, elle sest lance dans le commerce des poulets ordinaires. Particulirement courageuse et soucieuse dassurer lducation de ses enfants, elle travaille sans relche en allant de village en village pour rechercher des poulets quelle vient revendre en ville. Mais les charges de la famille devenant de plus en plus lourdes, Madame D. nen peut plus et demande un appui pour pouvoir amliorer son commerce. Son habilet et son honntet font que la demande est plus forte que loffre. Elle sollicite alors un crdit de $850 qui va servir agrandir son poulailler et disposer de fonds de commerce pour lachat et la revente des poulets ordinaires. Les bnfices tirs de cette activit lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins des orphelins. Aussi arrivera t-elle mieux pargner afin daccrotre son conomie.

loan.use: To enlarge the chicken coop, and to do trade in chickens.

loan.name: Jane

texts.en: Ms N. is a single mother of 4 children. The eldest daughter is marries while the other 3 are still in school. She deals in new clothes moving from one market to another over the week. She has been doing this kind of business for over 20 years. Hence she is well experienced in it. This is the first time she has taken a loan to boost her business. The loan of US$528/450 will be used to boost her stock which has been eroded with the payments of school fees in the month of January. She will also be able to sustain her stock longer as she is now forced to keep on traveling to the city to restock. Ms N. is supporting the local economy through her business.

loan.use: Buy Clothing Stock

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Peninah would like to buy chicks

loan.name: Michael

texts.en: Mr MICHAEL K. is a pastor of a local church (Full Gospel). He is married with 3 children. His eldest girl is married. In addition to his pastoral duties, he is also a farmer specializing in raising pigs. The loan of $225 to Mr K. is intended to purchase feed for his growing stock. Once they mature, they are sold to one of the major meat processing companies. The project is intended also to act as a training ground for his church members as a way of empowering them economically. Pastor K. is therefore providing an important service to the local community, and this is a project that deserves our support by PEMCI.

loan.use: To buy pig feed

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Susan wants to buy more stock of foodstuff

loan.name: John

texts.en: JOHN B. is an O-level leaver, married with four children. Prior to his current venture, he used to perform clearing & forwarding of cargo trucks at the Kenya-Uganda border. He started his business from capital raised through friends and family in 2003. His first loan of $143 from PEMCI enabled him to move into a permanent location (shop) unlike before, when he was in a kiosk. With a second loan of $300, he plans to increase the stock of parts in his new shop. Mr B. is also involved in a network marketing of a Chinese health product TIASH, which supplements his income. He is a well respected member of the local community.

loan.use: To stock a Cycle-Mart

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Eunice would like to buy 3 more steers

loan.name: Vronique

texts.en:
A married mother of six (6) children, Mrs. A. Vronique is well known for selling groceries in her region. Her husband is the community "taxi" driver. However, even with her husband's work, Mrs. Vronique A. is responsible for taking care of most of her family's needs. Very intelligent and practical, she is a woman people look up to in her community. Mrs. Alidjiso has proven to be an honest and trustworthy woman and has reimbursed her first two loans.

She is asking for a new loan of $700, to be able to increase her inventory and, as a result, her income. This loan could also have a very positive impact on her and her family's quality of life.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Marie et mre de six (6) enfants, Madame A. Vronique est rpute dans la vente de denres alimentaires dans sa localit. Lactivit principale de son mari est la conduite de vhicule de transport en commun Taxi . Malgr la fonction du mari, Madame A. Vronique a en charge presque la totalit des besoins de la famille. Trs intelligente et trs bien applique, elle reste lune des femmes de rfrence dans sa localit. Madame A. a fait preuve dhonntet et de femme de confiance travers les remboursements sans incidents de ses deux premiers crdits obtenus. Elle sollicite un nouveau crdit de $700 afin de pouvoir augmenter le niveau de stockage de ses produits et par consquent de son rendement. Ce crdit pourrait ainsi avoir un impact trs positif sur son niveau de vie et celui de sa famille.

loan.use: Increase the inventory of her grocery store

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Mary would like to buy 3 more steers

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Celina wants to buy 3 more steers

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Leah would like to buy 3 more steers

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To expand his farming business

loan.name: Amento

texts.en:
Mr. H. Amento is a very dynamic man. A married father with four (4) children, he manages a mill he set up himself thanks to a $450 credit that was subsequently reimbursed. This initiative allowed him, with the assistance of his wife, a salesperson, to feed his children and provide them with an education.

Now, in Mr. H. Amentos' community, there is a great need for a spice mill and he would like to provide it to his people. However, he does not have the money needed for this new project. He is asking for an $850 loan to build this new mill. The loan will help Mr. H. to take better care of his family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur H. Amento est un homme trs dynamique. Mari et pre de quatre (4) enfants, il gre un moulin quil a install lui-mme grce un crdit de $450 quil a obtenu et rembours sans incident. Cette activit lui permet, avec le concours de sa femme, revendeuse, de nourrir les enfants et dassurer leur scolarit. Aujourdhui, un grand besoin de moulin condiments se fait sentir dans la localit et Monsieur H. Amento se propose den mettre un la disposition des populations. Mais il na pas les moyens ncessaires pour ce nouveau projet. Il sollicite pour ce faire un crdit de $850 pour lacquisition dun moulin condiments. Comme impact, ce crdit permettra Monsieur H. de mieux subvenir aux charges de sa famille.

loan.use: to acquire a spice mill

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Alice would like to buy more packs of sweets, biscuits, cakes and soft drinks.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To start dairy farming

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Grace would like to buy packs of sweets, chocolates, cakes and soft drinks.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To purchase one dairy cow

loan.name: Latifa

texts.en: Latifa was born in Yardimli region of Azerbaijan. After death of the husband they have moved in Sumgait. She is 39 and has 1 child. She runs a small Cafe that she started when she found herself in the despair not having the support for her family that was once provided by her husband before his passing. Of course, the struggle has not been at all easy, but with work and effort they have been able to make it through. They need you and they thank you. Now Latifa needs a loan of $700 to purchase ingredients that she uses to make the foods she sells in her small Cafe.

loan.use: To purchase ingredients that she uses to make the foods she sells in her small Cafe

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Rose would like to buy two bales of second hand shoes.

loan.name: Sokand

texts.en:
Mrs. E. Sokand has been married to a farmer for twenty years and together they have six (6) children. Sokand is a very active woman, and her work involves making and selling doughnuts. Her husband's farming does not bring in sufficient funds to support the family, so she tries to contribute to the family's needs with her small income. Her children are now older and their needs are greater, so Mrs. E. would like to increase the revenue of her business.

This is why she is asking for a loan of $700 that would help her buy more supplies for the production and sale of her doughnuts. The sales income will benefit her entire family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame E. Sokand est marie un cultivateur depuis une vingtaine dannes et mre de six (06) enfants. Femme trs active, elle fait comme activit principale la production et la vente des beignets. Lactivit de son mari (agriculture) ne permet pas de couvrir la totalit des charges de la famille. Elle contribue donc avec son petit revenu subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. Mais aujourdhui que les enfants sont devenus grands, les charges sont devenus plus grandes et Madame E. cherche les moyens pour amliorer son activit et par consquent son revenu. Cest dans ce sens quelle sollicite un crdit de $700 qui va lui permettre dacheter et de stocker des matires premires en vue de la production et la vente des beignets. Les bnfices quelle tirera de la vente des beignets seront destins la satisfaction de besoins de la famille.

loan.use: to buy supplies for making and selling doughnuts

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To expand his farming business

loan.name: Zaur

texts.en: Zaur was born in 1975 year in Sumgait. After graduation secondary school he could not act Unirersity. Because the family condition was very heavy. He is only breadwinner in family.
