This 31-year-old man lives with his parents. Zaur has rented very small place near the market, has been busy with repair of mobile phones and sales of phone accessories. He applies for the loan $700 to expand his business area.

loan.use: To expand his business area

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Grace would like to buy varieties of cereal

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To build a house and start farming

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To expand her grain business and start farming

loan.name: Aywa

texts.en:
A married mother of 2, Ms. Aywa A. is in the business of retail rice sales in her locale. Her husband, a bike mechanic, is unable to meet the needs of his family as he does not have a shop. The majority of the familys expenses are covered by Ms. Aywa A.. She therefore feels obligated to increase her efforts to fulfill her responsibilities to her family. To acheive this, she has but one wish: to improve her business. Dynamic and sincere, she has managed numerous loans with a prompt attitude toward repayment.

Ms. A. is asking for a loan of $700 in order to increase her rice stocks and satisfy her ever-growing clientele. The receipt of this loan will be very beneficial to her in that she will be able to increase her income and achieve true financial independence.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Marie et mre de 2 enfants, Madame A. Aywa exerce comme activit la vente du riz en dtail dans sa localit. Son mari, un mcanicien deux roues narrive pas satisfaire les besoins de sa famille car nayant pas datelier. La plupart des dpenses de la famille sont la charge de Madame A. Aywa. Elle se sent donc oblige de redoubler dardeur pour tre la hauteur de ses responsabilits familiales. Pour cela, elle na quun seul dsir : amliorer son commerce. Dynamique et sincre, elle a eu grer plusieurs crdits avec une attitude prompte dans les remboursements.

Madame A. sollicite un crdit de $700 en vue daugmenter son stock de riz et satisfaire sa clientle de plus en plus nombreuse. Loctroi de ce crdit lui sera trs bnfique en ce sens quelle augmentera son revenu pour une vritable autonomie financire.

loan.use: Purchase and resale of rice

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To expand her farming business

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To expand her farming business

loan.name: Dots

texts.en:
Mr. Dots H. is a married father of five (5) children. His primary business activity is shoe manufacturing and repair. His wife, reduced to being a simple housewife, has no ability to contribute to the household. Mr. H. is solely responsible for providing for the needs of the family. As generous as he is charitable, he provides free training to a group of very poor young men in his shop and provides benefits for his apprentices such as healthcare and lunch. His shop is very well frequented due to the quality of his work, but he is in dire need of materials to better meet the demands of his clients.

Mr. Dots H. is asking for a loan of $850 to purchase a machine and acquire shoe manufacturing materials in order to increase his clientele and improve his services. Realizing this ambition will benefit him greatly, particularly with regard to increasing his income.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur H. Dots est mari et pre de cinq (5) enfants. Il a pour activit principale la fabrication et la rparation des chaussures. Sa femme, rduite une simple mnagre na aucune capacit de contribuer aux charges du mnage. Monsieur H. se bat seul pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Aussi gnreux que charitable, il forme gratuitement dans son atelier certains garons trs ncessiteux et subvient certains besoins de ses apprentis comme la sant et le djeuner. Son atelier est trs bien frquent cause de la qualit de son travail mais il manque cruellement de matriels pour mieux rpondre aux exigences de ses clients.

Monsieur H. Dots sollicite ce crdit de $850 pour sacheter une machine et sapprovisionner en matriels de fabrication de chaussures pour largir la liste de sa clientle et amliorer sa prestation de service. La ralisation de cette ambition lui sera trs bnfique notamment en matire daugmentation de son revenu.

loan.use: Purchase a machine and acquire materials for manufacturing shoes

loan.name: Zahid

texts.en: 48-year-old Zahid with his 2 children settled in Sumgait city. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Agdam region. Since 2003 Zahid has been engaged in cheese making to improve his familys living condition. As he did not have enough funds, he could not develop his business well enough in the beginning. Having borrowed 2 loans ($400; $700;) from Normicro he significantly expanded his business and increased his family income. The loans were paid back timely. Now Zahid needs a loan of $1000 to rent the food market.

loan.use: To rent the food market

loan.name: Agns

texts.en:
Ms. Agns A. is a young married mother of three (3) children. A hair stylist by profession, she has opened a salon which she manages efficiently and has a team of apprentices. Her husband, a bike mechanic, is not financially able to adequately cover the familys expenses. Quite the entrepreneur, Ms. A. has now expanded her styling business to include the sale of beauty products. The additional revenue allows her to provide for the needs of her household. Her excellent level of service has resulted in a marked increase in the demand for her salon. She would like to implement a plan to improve the speed and sophistication of her work. For this purpose she needs modern and more efficient materials. For this reason, Ms. A. is asking for a loan of $850 to better equip the salon and meet her clients expectations.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Agns est une jeune femme marie et mre de trois (3) enfants. Coiffeuse de profession, elle a ouvert un salon quelle gre avec efficacit et dispose des apprenties. Son mari, un mcanicien 2 roues na pas une situation financire lui permettant dassumer convenablement les charges de la famille. Trs entreprenante, Madame A. joint aujourdhui son mtier de coiffure, le commerce des produits de beaut. Ce qui lui procure des revenus complmentaires pour subvenir aux besoins de son foyer. Cette bonne prestation de services a entran une forte augmentation de la demande dans son salon. Elle souhaite mettre en place un dispositif pour un travail plus rapide et plus raffin. Pour cela, il lui faut du matriel moderne et plus performant. Cest dans ce sens que Madame A. sollicite un crdit dun montant de $850 pour pouvoir mieux quiper le salon et rpondre lattente de ses clientes.

loan.use: Beauty salon equipment

loan.name: Antoinette

texts.en:
Ms. Antoinette G. is a mother of three (3) children. Born to poor parents, she takes care of her mother and her two younger sisters. Her business is the sale of food in schools. Thanks to this business, she somehow manages to feed her children. She has a great deal of experience in saving money, managing loans and has a good understanding of all the aspects of her business.

She would like to increase the amount of food she prepares by buying bags of rice, corn and other necessary items to meet the demand, particularly during the school year. For this purpose, she is seeking a loan of $750. Realizing this project will have a very positive effect on her financial situation and will allow her to take good care of her family.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame G. Antoinette est mre dune famille de trois (3) enfants. Ne de parents pauvres, elle prend en charge sa mre et ses deux petites surs. Elle a pour activit la vente des denres alimentaires dans les tablissements scolaires. Grce cette activit, elle parvient tant bien que mal nourrir ses enfants. Elle possde dnormes expriences en matire dpargne, de gestion de crdit et cerne tous les rouages de son activit.

Elle compte augmenter son travail de prparation de ses denres : acheter des sacs de riz, de mas et autres ncessaires afin dtre la hauteur de la demande surtout en ce milieu danne acadmique. Pour cela, elle sollicite un crdit de $750. La ralisation de ce projet aura un effet trs positif sur son conomie et lui permettra de bien soccuper de sa famille.

loan.use: Purchase bags of rice, corn and other goods for the preparation of food.

loan.name: Charlotte A.

texts.en:
A married mother of two (2) children, Ms. Charlotte A. E. cares for the young daughter of one of her older brothers. Her business is the sale of food products. She is a dynamic woman and a fighter who works hard for the success of her children. Her husband is a woodworker with no shop and is obliged to help his friends on construction sites. This does not provide him with consistent income to cover household expenses. It is therefore Ms. E. who supports the majority of the family's needs thanks to her commercial activities. Rigorous in the management of her business, she has demonstrated exemplary promptness in the repayment of her loans. She is looking today to improve her business and is asking for financial support. She is therefore seeking a loan of $850 to increase her product stock levels and improve her revenue, which will result in better living conditions for her family.

Translated from [language] by [your name], Kiva Volunteer.

Marie et mre de deux (2) enfants, Madame E. A. Charlotte a sa charge une petite fille dun de ses grands frres. Elle exerce comme activit la vente des produits alimentaires. Cest une femme combative et dynamique qui travaille avec ardeur pour la russite de ses enfants. Son mari qui est un menuisier na pas datelier et est oblig daider ses amis sur des chantiers. Ce qui ne lui procure pas un revenu consistant pour couvrir les charges du mnage. Cest donc Madame E. qui supporte la grande partie des besoins de la famille grce son commerce. Rigoureuse dans la gestion de son activit, elle a fait preuve dune promptitude exemplaire dans le remboursement de ses crdits. Elle cherche aujourdhui amliorer son activit et demande un appui financier. Elle sollicite pour ce faire un crdit de $850 pour pouvoir augmenter le niveau de stock de ses produits et amliorer son revenu qui se traduira par de meilleures conditions de vie de sa famille.

loan.use: Increase stock levels of food products

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To expand her farming business

loan.name: Basile

texts.en:
Mr. Basile S. is a teacher by profession. After 2 years, he abandoned his job for the bakery, as teaching provided him practically no income. A married father of three (3) children, Mr. S. is marrying his second wife after the death of his first. Blessed with a spirit of creativity and a good sense of management, he offers quality service to his clientele. Demand is now very high, and he is researching ways to strengthen his business.

He is asking for a loan in the amount of $850 to install a second oven and expand his sales to other markets in the region. The profits will allow him to care for the health, nourishment and education of his children; in short, to lead a better life.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur S. Basile est enseignant de profession. Depuis 2 ans, il a abandonn son travail au profit de la boulangerie car lenseignement ne lui rapportait pratiquement rien. Mari et pre de trois (3) enfants, Monsieur S. va pouser une seconde femme aprs le dcs de la premire. Dot dun esprit de crativit et dun sens lev de gestion, il offre un service de qualit sa clientle. Aujourdhui, la demande est trs forte et il recherche des moyens pour renforcer son activit.

Il sollicite un crdit dun montant de $850 pour installer un second four et tendre la vente sur les autres marchs de la rgion. Les bnfices serviront soccuper de la sant, la nourriture et la scolarit des enfants, bref mener une vie meilleure.

loan.use: Install a second oven

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To expand her farming business

loan.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Mr. Daniel G. is a married father of five (5) children. His wife helps cover their numerous household expenses through the sale of fruit juices. Mr. G. is a woodworker by profession. He is in high demand by his clientele and offers a level of quality that enchants everyone. His dream now is to purchase high-quality wood in large quantities for building and selling furniture. He is asking for a loan of $700 which will allow him to change his financial situation and adequately meet his family's needs, particularly with regard to health, clothing, nourishment and education.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur G. Daniel est un homme mari et pre de cinq (5) enfants. Sa femme contribue aux nombreuses charges du mnage partir de la vente du jus de fruit. La profession de Monsieur G. est la menuiserie. Trs sollicit par sa clientle, il fait une prestation de qualit qui sduit tout le monde. Aujourdhui son rve est de payer du bois en qualit et en quantit trs leve afin de confectionner des meubles et les vendre. Il sollicite un crdit de $700 qui va lui permettre de changer sa situation conomique et bien subvenir aux besoins de la famille notamment en matire de sant, habillement, nourriture et scolarit

loan.use: Purchase wood for the construction and sale of furniture

loan.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes has been selling clothes for four years. Before opening her own business, she worked for her sister selling seafood. Her sister had always encouraged her to start her own business, and one day Mercedes decided to take her advice. She set out purchasing clothes that she would eventually sell in her own store. Mercedes made her initial purchases with some money she had saved, and with the generous help of her family and friends. Her store is open 1 p.m. to 6 p.m., thus allowing her to care for her house and family in the mornings.

Mercedes would like a loan so that she can invest in her business, which is now without capital. She will use the loan money to purchase clothes for the beach season, and she is confident this investment will improve her business.

Mercedes is married and has five children. Thanks to her work she has been able to provide education to all of them. Her husband is a mechanic in a workshop in the capital. She hopes that in the future she will be able to repair her house and make it cement- a goal that will make all of her and her husband's struggles worthwhile.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Kreger, a Kiva Volunteer.

Mercedes tiene una experiencia de 4 aos en su negocio de venta de ropas. Al principio ella trabajaba vendiendo mariscos con una hermana la que le pagaba. Luego, por iniciativa de su propia hermana, decide comprar ropa para vender ya que algunas personas le haban pedido. Con un dinero que tena ahorrado lo hace y le ha ido muy bien gracias el esfuerzo de varios familiares que le han ayudado. El negocio lo trabaja desde la 1 p.m. hasta las 6 p.m. ya que en la maana tiene que dejar haciendo los quehaceres de la casa para su familia.

Mercedes desea el crdito para poder invertir en su negocio el cual esta sin capital y va a comprar ropa para la temporada playera, sabe que con esa inversin le ira mejor.

Mercedes es casada, tiene 5 hijos y gracias a su trabajo le ha logrado dar la educacin a todos. Su esposo tambin trabaja de maestro mecnico en un taller por el centro, desea a futuro poder arreglar su casita y hacerla de cemento, meta que dice la cumplir con su lucha y junto a su esposo.

loan.use: Invest in warm weather clothing

loan.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia has 15 years of work experience. When her husband passed away 15 years ago, she was forced to go to work as a domestic employee to provide for her children. Each day, Julia put aside a portion of the money she earned so that she could eventually open up her own store in her house. Because she wanted her children to grow up alongside her, she took out a loan to launch her own business. Her store is now open from 7 a.m. until 10 p.m., and she works alongside her daughter who lives with her.

Julia would like a new loan so that she can provide for her business that is now low on finances: Recently, Julia's partner had a heart operation, and she paid for many of the expenses. While he is recuperating well, Julia is still low on capital.

Julia is 63 years old, and she has 7 children that help her with the store whenever they can. She would like to be able to improve the facade of her house in order to let more light into the space and bring a better service to her clients. With the help of some credit and her clients, she is sure she will be able to realize her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Kreger, a Kiva Volunteer.

Julia tiene una experiencia de 15 aos trabajando. Su esposo falleci hace quince aos lo que la motivo a salir adelante por sus hijos y se inicio trabajando como empleada domestica. Luego todos los das parte del dinero que le daban lo ahorraba y tenia por iniciativa propia ponerse una tienda en su domicilio ya que por ah no haba. La necesidad de que sus hijos crezcan a su lado y estar junto a ellos, hizo que ella realice un prstamo para poner su tienda en su domicilio la que mantiene hasta el da de hoy en horario de 7 a.m. hasta las 10 p.m., la trabajaba junto a una hija que vive con ella.

Julia desea el crdito para poder surtir su negocio ya que esta un desfinanciada por que su actual pareja fue operado del corazn y ella corri con una parte de los gastos, actualmente el se esta recuperando.

Julia tiene 63 aos, y 7 hijos los cuales ya son adultos y le ayudan cuando pueden. Tiene pensado poder hacer una mejora en la fachada de su domicilio como es enlucir el local y parte de la casa de esta manera darle un mejor servicio a sus clientes, y con la ayuda del crdito y sus ganancias esta segura que lo va ha lograr.

loan.use: Increase the inventory in her store

loan.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Cesar has been selling clothes and shoes for 9 years. Before opening his own business he taught tennis at a local academy where he used to practice with his friend in his free time.

While Cesar was happy with his job, as time passed he decided to leave the tennis academy so that he could dedicate his life to the teachings of Christ. He began preaching at a local penitentiary to the inmates and prison guards, and one day an inmate was admiring the pants he was wearing, and asked him to sell them to him. At this moment, Cesar realized that even inside the prison system there existed a market for the sale of merchandise. He began to bring goods-clothes, shoes, and accessories- with him when he visited the prison, and little by little he established his business. Cesar now visits the prison three days a week, on Wednesdays, Saturdays and Sundays, from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. He is able to both preach, and make a living. In addition, he has two inmates who help him with his business on the weekends, when the demand is highest.

Cesar would like a loan so that he can invest in more merchandise as he has reached a point where the demand for his products outweighs what he is able to supply. He would also like to expand his business to another area of the prison system, but has not been able to yet due to a lack of capital.

Cesar is 40 years old, and has three children who are in school, and help him with the business in their spare time. He is married, and his wife is a nurse. Cesar owns a motorcycle, but would like to buy a car one day to help him transport his goods. He is confident in his business skills, and he knows that with the help of those around him he will continue to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Kreger, a Kiva Volunteer.

Cesar tiene una experiencia de 9 aos en la venta de ropa y zapatos. Al comienzo el se inicio como profesor de tenis gracias a un amigo que lo llevo a practicar donde se gano la confianza del dueo y lo contrato para que comience a ensear en su academia. Luego con el transcurrir del tiempo logra dar un giro a su vida y se convierte a Cristo, lo que lo lleva a predicar la palabra a la Penitenciaria del Litoral en donde estn los presos del Ecuador. En ese lugar cierto da lleva un pantaln y un preso le dijo vndemelo a lo que el accedi viendo en ese momento que dentro de ese lugar haba potencial de venta. Comenz a llevar mercadera y al momento ya cuenta con su mercado de clientes, logrando hacer las dos actividades dentro de ese lugar el que lo visita los das mircoles, sbado y domingos desde las 8 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m. Inclusive tiene dos internos que le ayudan con el negocio los fines de semana ya que la demanda es buena.

Cesar desea el crdito para poder invertir en mercadera ya que al momento tiene bastante demanda y desea abrirse a otro sector dentro del Penal pero por falta de capital no lo hace.

Cesar tiene 40 aos y tres hijos los cuales estudian y en sus das libres trabajan junto a el ayudndolo en el negocio, su esposa es enfermera particular. Actualmente el cuenta con la moto en la foto pero a futuro deseara comprarse un carro para poder trasladar la mercadera ya que en su moto no puede llevar mucho. El sabe con la ayuda de todos lo va ha lograr.

loan.use: Invest in clothing to sell in local penitentiaries

loan.name: Brenda Guadalupe

texts.en:
Mrs. Brenda D. is married and has 5 children of 10, 8, 6, 4 and 2 years of age. They live in the city of Merida in the State of Yucatan. She started selling shoes after her husband was left unemployed and while he looked for a job. With his severance pay they invested it and started to sell among their family and little by little the business started to grow. It's already been two years since Brenda decided to start her business, whose only objective is to support her husband and her family while going through those difficult times.

Persistence, strength and hard hard, and the great love that Brenda feels for her family, is what has made it possible for them to obtain a daily sustenance. Now she needs a loan of $275 that she will put towards the purchase of more merchandise, to increase her sales, and increasing their income. Help Brend and her family. Your generosity will be of great help. Don't wait any longer, they will thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Brenda D. es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 10,8,6 , 4 y 2 aos de edad, ellos viven en la comunidad de Mrida, en el estado de Yucatn. Ella inici la venta de zapatos a ras de que su esposo se qued sin trabajo y mientras encontraba otro empleo, con lo de su liquidacin, invirti y empez a vender entre sus familiares y poco a poco fue creciendo su negocio. Ya son dos aos de que Brenda inici con su proyecto, cuy nico objetivo fue el apoyar a su esposo y a su familia en los momentos difciles por los que atravesaban.

El empeo, la fuerza y el trabajo, aunado el a el gran amor que Brenda le tiene a su familia, es lo que ha hecho posible le obtencin de un sustento diario. Ahora ella necesita de un crdito de $ 275 DLLS, mismos que utilizar para la compra de ms mercanca y as incrementar sus ventas, obteniendo de esta forma mayores ingresos. Apoya a Brenda y su familia, tu generosidad ser de gran ayuda, no lo dudes ms, ellos te lo van a agradecer.

loan.use: purchase merchandise

loan.name: Rosana Amalia

texts.en:
Rossana and her family, husband and four under aged children, live in the city of Merida, Yucatan. She and her family went through some difficult times five years ago after her husband was left unemployed. This situation made Rossana think of a solution, as she needed to provide her children with the necessities, such as an education. This is how she started selling corn on the cob from her home. Soon thereafter with the help of some loans she was able to purchase a tricyle to be able to go out and sell her products, which also increased in variety. The want to provide her children with a better quality of life motivated Rossana to work very hard every day, and she has managed to reach her goal through effort and dedication.

Today she requires a loan in the amount of $275, that she plans to repay in a term of 5 to 10 months. She will use this amount to purchase ingredients and materials necessary for her products, and upkeep of her tricycle. With your generosity you can help Rossana and her family. Don't wait any longer. They sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Rossana y su familia, esposo y 4 hijos menores de edad, vive en la localidad de Mrida Yucatn, ella y su familia hace cinco aos atravesaron por momentos econmicamente muy complicados, pues su esposo se quedo sin empleo. Esta situacin llev a Rossana a pensar en una solucin, pues tena que darles a sus hijos lo necesario, como educacin. Es as como comenz con la venta de elotes en su casa, luego con la ayuda de algunos prstamos logr comprar un triciclo para salir a vender y ampli tambin los productos ofrecidos. Las ganas de brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida impuls a Rossana a trabajar muy duro cada da y ha logrado con esfuerzo y dedicacin la meta propuesta

En este momento ella requiere de un prstamo por la cantidad de $ 275 DLLS, mismos que planea regresar en un plazo de 5 a 10 meses. Ella destinar sta cantidad para la compra de insumos necesarios para elaboracin de sus productos, y para dar mantenimiento a su triciclo. Con tu generosidad puedes apoyar a Rossana y su familia, no lo dudes ms, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loan.use: purchase merchandise

loan.name: Norma Aracely

texts.en:
Norma is mother of a young man of 19 years of age and lives in the community of Huhi in a southern State, Yucatan. Two years ago she suffered the loss of her husband and following the loss of an income she started selling shoes with the help of her son. She started selling among family members and friends, but the demand grew and she decided to work full time in her business. Tenacity is a characteristic that Norma undoubtedly possesses. Despite the loss of her husband that she suffered she kept moving forward for the love of her son.

Now she requires a loan in the amount of $925, of which she will use for the purchase of shoes in greater quantity, to get a better price for them and greater earnings. Help Norma and her family. They need you, don't wait any longer. You only need to make your decision now. They thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Norma es madre de un joven de 19 aos de edad y vive en la comunidad de Huh, en un estado del sur del pas, Yucatn. Hace 2 aos ella sufri la perdida de su esposo y ante la falta de ingresos comenz a vender zapatos con la ayuda de su hijo. Empez vendiendo entre familiares y amigos, pero ante la creciente demanda, decidi dedicarse por completo a sta actividad. La tenacidad es una caracterstica que indudablemente Norma posee, pues a pesar de la prdida que sufri sigui adelante por el amor a su hijo.

Ahora ella necesita de un crdito por la cantidad de $ 925 DLLS, mismos que utilizar para la compra de zapatos en una mayor cantidad para poder un obtener un menor precio y por ende mayores ganancias. Ayuda a Norma y a su familia, ellos te necesitan no lo dudes ms, slo hace falta que te decidas, ellos te lo agradecen.

loan.use: purchase merchandise

loan.name: Freddy Rogelio

texts.en:
Freddy is a very hard working and responsible man, but above all he is a highly enterprising. Some time ago he worked as a driver with a company, but they paid him very little and it was not enough to cover the family expenses, nor enough to cover the education of his three children. In his spare time he learned how to be a carpenter withthe help of a friend. Some time later he started his own shop, the very same one that is running now thanks to his dedication and perseverence.

Thanks to this business that Freddy started he has been able to provide his children and his wife with a better quality of life. In order to maintain his business, he requires a loan of $925 that he will use for the purchase of wood to increase his production and consequently his income. Become an important part of Freddy's increasing success, and help him.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Freddy es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable, pero sobre todo es una persona altamente emprendedora. El hace tiempo se desempeaba como chofer en una empresa, sin embargo le pagaban muy poco y esto no alcanzaba a cubrir los gastos familiares, ni a cubrir la educacin de sus tres hijos. Por ello en sus ratos libres aprendi el oficio de carpintero por medio de un amigo que le ense. Luego de un tiempo inaugur su propio taller, mismo que sigue en servici hasta ahora a base de dedicacin y constancia.

Gracias a este proyecto que Freddy comenz hace algn tiempo ha podido brindarles a sus hijos y su esposa una mejor calidad e vida. Para poder mantener y hacer crecer su negocio, el requiere de un prstamo de $925 DLLS, mismos que utilizar en la compra de madera y aumentar su produccin y consecuentemente sus ingresos. Vulvete parte importante del crecimiento de Freddy y aydalo.

loan.use: purcahse wood

loan.name: Laufai

texts.en: Laufai is a 29 year old woman, married with 3 children. Her husband like her has always been unemployed and the family has depended on relatives for financial support for things such as educating the children. Her business is a taro plantation. She is now selling 50 bundles of taro at USD 7 each per week and earns USD 300 per week. Previous loans from SPBD have been used to build up the plantation to a level where she is now able to use some of the income for school fees.

loan.use: Purchase fertiler, weed killer, equipment

loan.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ms. Ama D. is a married mother of four children. Her husband works primarily as a fisherman, but his income in insufficient to pay all of the familys expenses. This situation requires Ms. Ama D. to work hard to contribute a large part of the familys income. She has already obtained a loan of $400 to build her business of selling cosmetic products, which she has been running for six years. Her energy and her ability to manage a loan have earned her the reputation of a model woman in her town. Faced with new responsibilities in paying household expenses, she is seeking to improve her business but does not have the means to do so. She is requesting a loan of $600, which will help her to buy, stock and resell cosmetic products. The success of this project will allow her to improve her familys living conditions.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame D. Ama est une femme marie et mre de quatre (4) enfants. Lactivit principale de son mari est la pche artisanale dont le rendement est insuffisant pour couvrir la totalit des frais lis la gestion des charges de la famille. Cette situation obligea Madame D. Ama travailler ardemment pour contribuer dans une large mesure aux charges du mnage. Elle a obtenu un crdit de $400 pour renforcer son commerce de produits de beaut quelle exerce il y a 6 ans. Son dynamisme et son aptitude grer un crdit lui confrent une place de femme modle dans la localit. Face sa nouvelle responsabilit dans son mnage, elle cherche amliorer son commerce mais ne dispose pas assez de moyens. Elle sollicite un de $600 qui va servir acqurir, stocker et revendre les produits de beaut. La ralisation de ce projet lui permettra damliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille.

loan.use: To buy and sell cosmetic products

loan.name: Rita

texts.en:
A married mother of four children, Ms. Rita A.s business consists of roadside sales of foodstuffs. Determined in all that she does, she contributes a large amount of the household income because the money her husband, a motorcycle taxi driver, earns is largely insufficient to feed, clothe, educate and take care of their children. Recognizing the seriousness of the situation, Ms. A. dedicates all of her energy to serving her family. She is a tireless woman who works day and night to pull her family out of poverty. To increase her income, she would like to further build her business in order to be able to meet the growing demand for her products.

For this, she is requesting a loan of $600, which will allow her to increase the range of products that she sells. The amount requested will thus serve as the capital to buy and resell her goods. This project deserves to be supported, as it will allow a very poor family to improve its living conditions.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Marie et mre de quatre (04) enfants, Madame A. Rita a comme activit la vente des denres alimentaires dans les abords des routes. Dtermine dans tout ce quelle fait, elle participe normment la gestion du mnage car le revenu de son mari, conducteur de taxi moto, est trs insuffisant pour nourrir, habiller, soigner et scolariser les enfants. Consciente de la gravit de la situation, Madame A. met toute son nergie au service de sa famille. Femme infatigable, elle travaille de jour comme de nuit pour rduire la misre dans sa famille. Pour amliorer son revenu, elle souhaite largir davantage son commerce afin de pouvoir rpondre une plus grande demande qui se prsente elle.

Elle sollicite pour cela un crdit de $600 qui va lui permettre dlargir la gamme de ses produits. Le montant sollicit constituera donc un fonds de commerce pour lachat, et la revente de ses marchandises. Ce projet mrite dtre soutenu car il permettra damliorer les conditions de vie dune famille dmunie.

loan.use: To buy and sell foodstuffs

loan.name: Marguerite

texts.en:
An energetic and honest woman, Ms. Marguerite A. is a married mother of three children. Despite running a business of cosmetic product sales, she has great difficulty in meeting the daily needs of her family. Her husband, a farmer, earns less and less due to recent climate irregularities. This poor and degrading financial situation required Ms. Marguerite A. to request her first loan in order to increase her stock of products. She repaid this loan without incident. Her capability has today earned her a good reputation in her town, and her customers have become demanding and large in number. In order to effectively meet this ever-growing demand, Ms. Marguerite A. is requesting a credit of $800 to buy a supply of cosmetic products in order to better satisfy her customers and to contribute what is needed to her familys income.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Femme dynamique et honnte, Madame A. Marguerite est marie et mre de trois (3) enfants. Malgr son commerce des produits cosmtiques, elle rencontre beaucoup de difficults au quotidien dans la gestion des charges de sa famille. Son mari, cultivateur a des rendements de plus en plus maigres dus aux anomalies climatiques de ces derniers temps. Cette situation financire faible et dgradante obligea Madame A. Marguerite demander un premier crdit pour agrandir son talage. Un crdit quil a rembours sans incident. Son habilet lui confre aujourdhui une bonne rputation dans la localit et sa clientle est devenue abondante et exigeante. Afin de pouvoir rpondre efficacement cette demande sans cesse croissante, Madame A. Marguerite sollicite un crdit de $800 pour sapprovisionner en produits cosmtiques afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientle et parvenir contribuer convenablement aux charges de son mnage.

loan.use: To buy and sell cosmetic products

loan.name: Dawlossi

texts.en:
Ms. Dawlossi A. is a mother of five children. She has been married for twelve years, but her husbands farming business does not earn him enough to pay all of the familys expenses. This is why she has invested the profits from selling ice water at the market in Afagnan in the production of palm oil, something highly popular and widely consumed in her country. Having seen that the production and sale of palm oil is a very profitable activity in her town, she is seeking the means to develop her business. To do so, she is requesting a loan of $600, which will serve as the capital to buy palm nuts in large quantity and to prepare red palm oil. Ms. A. has a lot of experience in managing loans, and the success of her business gives her the ability to repay them. The granting of this loan will give her the ability to meet the needs of her children.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Dawlossi est mre dune famille de cinq (5) enfants. Marie depuis une douzaine dannes, la profession de cultivateur de son mari ne lui permet pas de bien subvenir aux charges de sa famille. Cest pour cette raison quelle a investi les bnfices de la vente de leau glace au march dAfagnan dans la production de lhuile de palme, une huile bien apprcie et consomme dans le pays. Ayant constat que la production et la vente de lhuile de palme est une activit trs rentable dans la localit, elle cherche des moyens pour lagrandir. Elle sollicite cet effet un crdit de $600 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour lachat des noix de palme en grande quantit et la prparation de lhuile rouge. Madame A. possde une grande exprience en gestion de crdit et son activit lui confre une bonne capacit de remboursement. Comme impact, loctroi de ce crdit lui procurera une capacit de bien subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants..

loan.use: To buy palm nuts to make palm oil

loan.name: Sowanou

texts.en:
Mr. Sowanou H. is an energetic man. Married to a shopkeeper for twenty years, he has eight children, two of whom are in apprenticeships. The income from his wifes business is not enough to contribute to the familys needs. Mr. Sowanou H.s business is the production and sale of the local drink, sodabi, which is very popular in the region. The quality of the drink he produces has led to him receiving orders from as far as the capital, Lom. In order to be able to produce a large quantity of sodabi, he must be able to buy enough palm trees. To do so he would need substantial financial means, something which Mr. H. does not have. He is requesting a loan of $850 to buy palm tress and produce and sell sodabi. The income generated by the sale of the drink could help Mr. H. bear his numerous household expenses.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur H. Sowanou est un homme dynamique. Mari une commerante depuis une vingtaine dannes, il a au total huit (8) enfants dont deux (2) en apprentissage. Le revenu issu du commerce de sa femme ne lui permet pas de contribuer aux besoins familiaux. Monsieur H. Sowanou exerce comme activit la production et la vente de la boisson locale sodabi bien apprcie dans la zone. La qualit de la boisson quil produit fait quil reoit des commandes depuis Lom la capitale. Pour pouvoir produire une grande quantit de sodabi, Il lui faut alors acheter assez de palmiers. Ce qui demande assez de moyens financiers dont Monsieur H. ne dispose pas. Il sollicite un crdit de $850 pour lachat des palmiers, la production et la vente du sodabi. Les revenus tirs de la vente de la boisson pourra aider Monsieur H. supporter les nombreuses charges de son mnage

loan.use: To buy palm trees to produce and sell sodabi

loan.name: Togbossi

texts.en:
Ms. Togbossi A. has been a widow for five years. Her husbands farming business did not enable him to leave any money for his family when he died. Today, Ms. Togbossi A. struggles daily with all her energy to be able to meet the needs of her children. Her principal activity is rope weaving. A clever woman, she works hard to shelter her children from hunger and poverty. But today she is being crushed by her expenses and is calling out for help. She has already obtained a first loan, which she paid off faithfully and without incident. She is now requesting a second loan of $600 to equip herself with materials in order to increase her production of rope. The profits she will earn from this business will be used to improve her familys living conditions. Financing this project will mean giving back hope to children who have lost their father.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Togbossi est une femme veuve depuis 5 ans. Lactivit agricole de son mari ne lui a pas permis de laisser un hritage la famille avant sa mort. Aujourdhui, Madame A. Togbossi se bat quotidiennement avec toute son nergie pour pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. Son activit principale est le tissage des cordes. Femme ingnieuse, elle travaille durement pour mettre ses enfants labri de la faim et la misre. Mais aujourdhui, elle est crase par les charges et crie au secours. Elle a dj obtenu un premier crdit quelle a pu solder fidlement sans incident. Elle demande donc un second crdit dun montant de $600 pour se doter de matriel afin daccrotre sa production en tissage de corde. Les bnfices qui seront issus de cette activit seront destins lamlioration des conditions de vie de sa famille. Financer ce projet, cest redonner lespoir de vivre des orphelins.

loan.use: To buy materials and supplies for rope weaving

loan.name: Akofala

texts.en:
Ms. Akofala A. is a young, married woman and the mother of four children. Her age allows her to be energetic in the running of her business. An energetic woman with great endurance, she has a passion for coconut oil production, something she has been doing for a long time. The income that she earns from this activity, little as it may be, allows her to contribute a large amount to the paying of the household expenses. Her husbands business of raising chickens in the traditional way is not sufficient to meet all of the familys needs. As the familys expenses are becoming more and more difficult to pay, Ms. A. wants to increase her production of coconut oil and thus increase her income. The quality of her product is highly appreciated at the market, and the demand for it is high. She is requesting a loan of $800 to buy more coconuts and production materials to increase her output. This loan will have a positive effect on her financial situation, and she will thus be better able to take care of her children.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Akofala est une jeune femme marie et mre de quatre (4) enfants. Son ge lui confre un dynamisme dans son activit. Femme dynamique et endurante, elle a une passion pour la production de lhuile de coco, activit quelle exerce depuis longtemps. Le revenu quelle en tire quoique insignifiant lui permet de contribuer largement aux charges du mnage. Llevage traditionnel des volailles que son mari fait ne suffit pas pour couvrir les besoins de la famille. Les charges de la famille devenant de plus en plus lourdes, Madame A. veut augmenter sa production dhuile de coco et amliorer ainsi son revenu. La qualit de son produit est trs apprcie sur le march, ce qui fait que la demande est forte. Elle sollicite un crdit de $800 pour acheter plus de coco et de matriel de production pour augmenter son rendement. Comme impact, ce crdit aura une rpercussion positive sur son conomie. Elle pourra cet effet mieux prendre soin de ses enfants.

loan.use: To buy nuts and materials for coconut oil production

loan.name: Ayoko

texts.en:
A married mother of five children, Ms. Ayoko A. has also taken in her two younger sisters as apprentices. Having not gone to school, she earns her living through the production and sale of gari (cassava flour). As someone who appreciates a job well done, she takes great care in the fabrication of gari, which endows her product with a high level of quality. And her gari, which is highly esteemed, sells very well at the market. The demand has become great, as wealthy women come all the way from Lom to buy it. Today, she no longer has the means to meet the high demand for her product. She is requesting a loan of $650 to buy cassava in large quantity and produce gari.

Despite the fact that she is illiterate, she is gifted with an understanding and a mastery of managing credit. She anticipates increasing her production capacity of gari and selling it at the markets in the region, which will give her the ability to better meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Marie et mre de cinq (5) enfants, Madame A. Ayoko prend aujourdhui en charge ses deux (2) petites surs en apprentissage. Nayant pas t lcole, elle fait comme activit la production et la vente du gari (farine de manioc). Aimant le travail bien fait, elle entoure la fabrication du gari de beaucoup de soins. Ce qui confre dnormes qualits au produit. Du coup, son gari, bien apprci, est trs bien vendu sur le march. La demande est devenue grande car les bonnes femmes viennent de Lom pour sen procurer. Aujourdhui, elle na plus assez de moyens pour satisfaire la forte demande laquelle elle fait face. Elle sollicite un crdit de $650 pour lachat en grande quantit de manioc et la production de gari.

Malgr quelle soit analphabte, elle est dote dune comprhension et dune matrise de gestion de crdit. Elle estime augmenter sa capacit de production du gari afin de le vendre sur les marchs des villes de la sous rgion, ce qui lui la capacit de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loan.use: To buy cassava to produce gari

loan.name: Amtohoun

texts.en:
Ms. Amtohoun H. is a widow and almost fifty years old. Her business consists of selling sodabi, a local drink made from the African oil palm tree. She takes care of the five children left to her by her late husband, and she works every day to ensure their education. Despite her courage and determination, she is often overcome by her problems but has no one to confide in. In order to pull her family out of this difficult situation, Ms. Amtohoun H. has only one ambition: to take her sodabi business to the next level. To do so, she is requesting a loan of $600 to buy a supply of bottles of sodabi, stock them and resell them. Once this business is financed, Ms. H. will be better able to meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame H. Amtohoun est une veuve de prs dune cinquantaine danne. Elle exerce comme activit le commerce de sodabi , une boisson locale base du palmier huile. Les cinq (5) enfants laisss par son mari dfunt sont sa charge et elle sactive tous les jours pour les duquer. Malgr tout son courage et sa dtermination, elle est souvent dpasse par les problmes mais na personne qui se confier. Pour sortir sa famille de cette situation difficile, Madame H. Amtohoun na quune seule ambition : relever le niveau de son commerce de sodabi. Elle sollicite cet effet un crdit de $600 pour sapprovisionner des bidons de sodabi, les stocker et la boisson locale et les revendre. Cette activit une fois finance, permettra Madame H., de mieux satisfaire les besoins de sa famille.

loan.use: To buy, stock and sell sodabi

loan.name: Dassi

texts.en:
Ms. Dassi A. sells firewood. She is a mother of four children, who she has been raising for twenty years. Her husband, who does not have stable employment, does not earn enough income to meet the familys needs. So Ms. Dassi A. works relentlessly to help her husband manage the familys expenses. The business of selling firewood is very prosperous, but her income barely makes a dent in the household expenses.

Faced with the ever-growing demand of her customers, Ms. A. is no longer able to satisfy everyone by her own means. That is why she is requesting a loan of $850 to build a sufficient stock of firewood and sell it when there is a shortage. This way, she could increase the size of her business and improve her familys living conditions.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Dassi est une commerante de bois de chauffe. Elle est mre de quatre (4) enfants quelle lve depuis une vingtaine dannes. Son mari nayant pas un emploi fixe ne dispose pas de revenu pour supporter les besoins de la famille. Ainsi, Madame A. Dassi travaille avec acharnement pour aider son mari dans la gestion des charges du mnage Le commerce du bois de chauffe est une activit trs florissante. Mais les charges de son mnage font que ses efforts ne sont pas visibles.

Devant la demande sans cesse croissante de sa clientle, Madame A. nest plus en mesure de satisfaire tout le monde avec ses propres moyens. Cest pour cela quelle sollicite un crdit de $850 pour faire un stockage consistant de bois de chauffe et les revendre en temps de pnurie. Elle pourra ainsi augmenter la taille de son commerce et amliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille.

loan.use: To buy and sell firewood

loan.name: Marie

texts.en:
Ms. Marie D. is a divorced woman who takes care of three children. As she is quite gifted in the identification and analysis of business opportunities, she has chosen to get into the business of selling fish and condiments, in which she is doing rather well. However, due to her very limited financial means, she is confronted with high demand that she is unable to meet. She currently needs a loan, which will allow her to increase the size of her business in order to increase her revenue. She is requesting a loan of $700, which will give her the capital to buy and resell fish and condiments. This new possibility will allow her to meet not only the needs of her customers but also those of her family. This will allow Ms. D. to live off the fruits of her labor and to better meet her immediate needs, notably the feeding, clothing, health and education of her children.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame D. Marie est une femme divorce avec trois (3) enfants charge. Trs doue dans lidentification et dans lanalyse des opportunits daffaires, elle sest choisie pour activit principale la vente de poissons et condiments qui lui russit assez bien. Cependant, par ses moyens financiers trs limits, elle est confronte beaucoup de demandes quelle est incapable de satisfaire. Elle a besoin aujourdhui dun appui financier qui lui servira augmenter la taille de son activit en vue daccrotre son chiffre daffaires. Elle sollicite un crdit de $700 qui lui permettra de disposer dun fonds de commerce pour lachat et la revente du poisson et des condiments. Cette nouvelle possibilit lui permettra de satisfaire non seulement les besoins de sa clientle mais aussi ceux de sa famille. Ceci permettra Madame D. de vivre du fruit de son travail et de mieux subvenir ses besoins immdiats, notamment: lalimentation, la sant, lhabillement et lducation de ses enfants.

loan.use: To buy and sell fish and condiments

loan.name: Sodjd

texts.en:
A widow for ten years, Ms. Sodjd A. takes care of her two grandsons, left to her when her oldest daughter passed away. Three of her four children are currently unemployed and are still dependent on her. To meet these numerous demands, she buys the material for rope weaving, makes rope and sells it at the market. Despite her efforts and her courage, her income does not enable her to shelter her children from hunger and poverty. Even though she is illiterate, she has the ability to rigorously manage her business and has been able to repay her first loan of $250 without incident. She desperately wants to improve her familys living conditions and is requesting a loan in order to do so. The loan of $500 that she is requesting will allow her to buy materials in large quantity to weave and sell rope. The income generated by these sales will allow her to come to the aide of those who depend on her.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Devenue veuve depuis une dizaine dannes, Madame A. Sodjd a sa charge ses deux (2) petits fils laisss la mort de sa fille ane. Trois de ses quatre enfants qui nexercent aucune activit ce jour sont toujours sa charge. Pour subvenir ces nombreuses charges, elle achte le matriel de tissage de corde, fabrique les cordes et les revend sur le mme march. Malgr ses efforts et son courage, son revenu ne permet pas de mettre ses enfants labri de la faim et de la maladie. Mais bien quelle soit analphabte, elle dispose dune aptitude de rigueur dans la gestion de ses activits et a su rembourser son premier crdit de $250 sans incident. Elle dsire vivement amliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et demande un appui financier cet effet. Le crdit de $500 quelle sollicite va servir acqurir du matriel de travail en quantit pour le tissage et la vente des cordes. Les revenus tirs de cette vente lui serviront venir en aide aux personnes qui sont sa charge.

loan.use: To buy material and supplies for rope weaving

loan.name: Nagossi

texts.en:
Ms. Nagossi A. produces palm oil. She learned this skill from her mother. Having abandoned school because of a lack of financial means, she got into this business to take care of herself. Married to a motorcycle taxi driver, she is a mother of four school age children. She also takes care of her parents, bringing the total number of people who depend on her to seven. Determined and enthusiastic, she now has a lot of experience in the production of palm oil, which makes her product very desirable at the market. Demand has become very high, but Ms. Nagossi A. is unable to meet it because she does not have the means for production.

To re-energize her business and to satisfy all her clients, Ms. Nagossi A. is requesting a credit of $700 to buy a supply of palm nuts and the materials to produce palm oil. The profits from her business will allow her to effectively take care of her familys needs.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Nagossi produit de lhuile de palme. Cette activit, elle la acquise de sa mre. Abandonnant les tudes fautes de moyens, elle se lance dans ce commerce pour se prendre en charge. Marie un conducteur de taxi moto, elle est mre de quatre (4) enfants en ge de scolarisation. Elle a aussi sa charge ses parents soit au total sept (7) personnes. Dtermine et enthousiaste, elle possde aujourdhui une grande exprience en matire de production de lhuile de palme. Ce qui fait que lhuile quelle produit est trs apprcie sur le march. La demande tant devenue trs forte, Madame A. Nagossi est incapable de la satisfaire car elle ne dispose pas assez de moyens pour la production.

Pour redynamiser son activit et satisfaire tous ses clients, Madame A. Nagossi sollicite un crdit de $700 pour sapprovisionner en noix de palme et en matriel de production dhuile de palme. Les bnfices de son activit lui serviront soccuper efficacement des besoins de sa famille.

loan.use: To buy palm nuts and materials for the production of palm oil

loan.name: Elmira

texts.en: Elmira was born in Salyan region Khaladj village. She is married, has 3 children. She is cattle-breeder. You can see in the picture woman, who likes cattles. She enjoys looking after the calves. This 58-year-old woman likes this calf more than other calves. Having borrowed a loan of $400, she bought 10 pedigree lambs. Then she decided to borrow a loan of $600 to buy 3 pedigree calves. Now she needs a loan of $1000 to buy 4 pedigree calves. She has been engaged in this business for 12 years.

loan.use: To buy 4 pedigree calves

loan.name: Lala

texts.en: Lala lives in Salyan region Khaladj village. This 55-year-old woman is married, has 4 children. She has been engaged in this business for 10 years. In the beginning her business she borrowed a loan of $400 and bought a milch-cow and 4 sheeps. Now she needs a loan of $800 to buy 2 milch-cows.

loan.use: To buy 2 milch-cows

loan.name: Gulnaz

texts.en: Gulnaz is 28, single, lives in Salyan region Khaladj village. She has been engaged in farming for 4 years. She is hard worker, strong woman, enjoys with her business. It is a very dificult work, but she is not afraid of work. Gulnaz has a lot of plans. She wants to expand her business. You can see in the picture a sociable, very kind, friendly young woman. Now she needs a loan of $700 to start being busy with a stock breeding. She wants to buy 10 sheeps.

loan.use: To buy 10 sheeps

loan.name: Shakhla

texts.en: This 42-year-old woman is married, has 2 children, lives in Absheron region Hovsan settlement. She has been engaged in this business for 7 years. For the first time she borrowed a loan of $700 and bought cloth. Now she needs a loan of $1100 to buy a new sewing-machine. Her sewing-machine is old and bad works. This machine has been broken very often and it disturbs her to work. She plans to buy the new sewing-machine in order to increase number of her clients. .

loan.use: To buy a sewing-machine

loan.name: Vugar

texts.en: This 36-year-old young man is cameraman, married, has 3 children, lives in Salyan region Yenikand village. He enjoys with his business. It is a very interesting business. In the beginning his business he borrowed a loan of $500 and bought a camera. Now he needs a loan of $700 to buy a new video camera and a montage apparatus. He has a lot of plans. He is a very kind, friendly and hard-working person. He has been engaged in this business for 13 years. He is very optimistic about the future of his business.

loan.use: To buy a new video camera and a montage apparatus

loan.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina runs a small business selling sportswear for men and women. She is married with one son. A Technical school graduate, Marina had previously worked in a factory. However, her salary was too small to provide for the needs of the family and she was forced to seek other opportunities to earn a living. Marina has been in the clothing business for over 4 years and has repaid 19 loans to Nadiya Ukraine without any delinquencies. Her diligent, hard work has helped her succeed in business and maintain loyal clientele. Marina would like to receive a loan for $800 to serve as working capital in her business. Financial assistance will help her purchase an assortment of T-shirts, jackets, vests, and knitted wear. High-quality, durable, and comfortable sportswear will sell really well and will help Marinas business grow especially in this cold winter season.

. , . , . , , . 4 . 19 . , . 800 , . , , . , , , , .

loan.use: To increase on stock for winter season

loan.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila M. is married with two grown children. Her son is in college and her daughter helps her with her business. Ludmilas husband is disabled and is not able to work. She is the only breadwinner in the family. Ludmila used some of her savings to start a small business selling womens lingerie. She was able to purchase a small kiosk located in one of the local markets in busy downtown. Her polite manner and rich experience have helped her operate her business successfully. Over time she has gotten to know the preferences and tastes of her customers making her kiosk a popular stop when they visit the market. Her daughters active participation in the business has also added greatly to its success. To meet growing demand from her customers, Ludmila is requesting a loan for $1000 which will allow her to purchase more underwear at wholesale prices. Increased selling capacity will not only meet the needs of her clients, but the additional profits generated will meet another of Ludmillas goals to help pay for her sons college tuition. This loan will allow her to increase her income and provide the necessary funds to pay for her sons education which she considers her most valuable investment.

, . , . , . . , , . , . . , . . , 1000 , . , . , .

loan.use: To generate more profits to pay her sons college fees

loan.name: Mareta

texts.en: Mareta is a single mother with two children attending school. She manages a small plantation growing taro, banana, ufi and taamu. Her income from this is usually around USD 200 per week and she takes her produce to the market on Friday and Saturday. She also makes donuts which she sells at the local school between 10AM and 11 AM every day for the morning break. Her previous loans have mostly been used to buy fertilizer and weed killer for the plantation. In addition part of the loans have been used for school fees. She is the leader of her lending group in the village of Sataoa.

loan.use: Purchase fertiliser, weed killer and ingredients for donut business

loan.name: Ruta

texts.en: Ruta is a single mother with one child. She runs a plantation with her brother and his adopted son. The plantation only grows taro which is sold once a week in the market in the capital Apia on the weekend. From this she earns approximately USD 1500 per week. She also sells donuts in the village on Saturdays and Sundays which provides her with some additional income. With the loan she wishes to purchase some fertilizer and weed killer. She is a member of the Nuusutia village center which won second prize in SPBDs best center competition in 2006. She is pictured with her brothers adopted son outside the house where the weekly meeting is held. Also in the picture are materials used on the plantation .

loan.use: Purchase weed killer and fertilser for her plantation

loan.name: Fale

texts.en: Fale is married with two children who are attending school. With her husband she runs two businesses. The first business is a small store which is pictured. This is located at her parents in law house and has been going for 5 years. They also have a plantation which grows taro. Fale wants to open another store in another part of the village which will assist with achieving greater independence. She will get some assistance from relatives from overseas. The loan from SPBD will assist with buying staple goods such as sugar, salt, soap, noodles, sweets, flour and frozen goods

loan.use: Purchase goods for a new general store

loan.name: Aleimalo

texts.en: Alaimalo is married with 8 children. Only one still goes to school, the rest are of working age. Alaimalo is an industrious women who is the chief of the lending group of her village consisting of 14 other women. She earns her income from a number of pursuits. Her main business is a plantation which grows taro, bananas and ufi. She also has two cows and wishes to purchase one more with this loan. Aside from this she makes ice cakes which she sells from her home and sometimes at the local school. She is pictured in the photo in her kitchen holding one of her ice cakes. In the past she has used loans to build up the plantation, buy cows and also build an outside toilet.

loan.use: Purchase fertilizer, weed killer and one cow

loan.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza has a small store where she sells basic groceries. She has owned the store for about 3 years, after having to move into a new home because her property was being taken away by the government. She had been working as a domestic assistant for about 25 years until the pain in her legs was too unbearable to continue working. She opened the store in her home and runs it with the help of her granddaughter and children.

Esperanza needs the loan in order to invest in goods for her market. Currently she feels she is very under stocked and she is not selling products that could increase her profits. She has had 9 children, all of which are grown up and independent. She is 69 years old but has been a single mother for 30 years after her husband left her and the children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Invest in goods for her market

loan.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen has been selling clothes as a street sales woman for 4 years. She travels into the rural sectors about three times a week in order to sell there because there are better business opportunities. She has had to work and sell from a very young age because her parents were not in a good financial situation. She started the business with a $50 loan from informal lenders that charge very high interest rates. She is requesting the loan because she wants to invest in clothes for the hot weather and rainy season. Helen is 23 years old, she already has 2 children and she is also pregnant with another. She is currently seperated from her husband because he does not contribute to the household and he she considers him to be irresponsible. This business is currently the only source of income she has and she is very dedicated to it.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Invest in summertime clothing

loan.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny sells all types of decorations for the home and she also sells clothing for men and women. She has over 10 years of experience in this line of work. Thanks to the support of her husband, who provided start up capital for the business, she has opened a small location in front of her home where she displays her products and merchandise. She opens her store three times a week from 7 in the morning and 7 at night. The other days she travels outside of the city to sell cosmetics and clothing to under served communities where there are sale opportunities. She is 43 years old and has one child, whose father passed away 8 years ago. She is now in a new relationship with a industrial mechanic who is very supportive.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Invest in clothes for hot weather

loan.name: Shem

texts.en:
Shem O. operates a bicycle repair and shoe shining business in Kondele, Kisumu. He is married with two children. He also takes care of 3 children who were orphaned following the death of his elder brother and wife from HIV/AIDS. He needs a USD 25 loan to add spare parts to his business and pay for a business license.
He will pay the loan in 6 installments as he struggles with basic family needs.

loan.use: To buy bicycle spares and purchase a business license.

loan.name: Shakhmurad

texts.en: Shakhmurad lives in Salyan region Yenikand village. He is 47, married, has 3 children. He likes animals, enjoys looking after the animals. One day he decided to be busy with a stock-breeding. He did not have a cattle-shed. Having borrowed a loan of $300 he built the cattle-shed. Then he borrowed a loan of $500 and bought 10 pedigreed ewes. For the third time he borrowed a loan of $800 and bought 20 lambs. Having fattened these animals, he started to be busy with sale of lambs and sheeps. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy 25 pedigreed ewes to fatten for sale. He is purposeful person. He has been working very hard to develop his business. Being engaged in this business, he supports his family. He has been engaged in this busines for 10 years.

loan.use: To buy 25 pedigreed ewes to fatten for sale

loan.name: Bikakhanim

texts.en: This 40-year-old young woman is married, has 2 children, lives in Salyan region, Yenikand village. She has been selling milk. In the beginning of her busines , she borrowed a loan of $200 and bought a milch-cow. For the second time he borrowed a loan of $500 and bought 2 pedigree cows and 100 compressed clover. Now she needs a loan of $1000 to buy 4 pedigree cows. She has been engaged in this business for years.

loan.use: To buy 4 pedigree cows

loan.name: Solmaz

texts.en: Solmaz has been engaged in farming for 4 years. Having borrowed a loan of $400 ne bought 0,04 hectare plot of land. She cultivates the plot of land to grow vegetables. She is 30, married, has a child, lives in Salyan region, Khaladj village.. Now she needs a loan of $800 to buy in addition the plot of land in order to grow the vegetables.

loan.use: To buy plot of land

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to expand her farming business

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loan.use: to expand her farming business

loan.use: to expand her farming

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to expand her vegatable farming business

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to expand her farming business

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To expand her farming business

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To expand her farming business

loan.name: Cleotilde

texts.en:
Cleotilde lives in the city of Tampico in the State of Tamaulipas, and she is mother of three girls. Her husband passed away some time ago and she, despite the difficult emotional moments she was going through, had to support her daughters and this is hoe she started selling seasonal clothes. Through this business she has been able to pay for the education of her duaghters and for the medications of one of her daughters, who is handicapped.

Things have not been easy for Cleotilde and her family, but thanks to her daily effort and hard work she has been able to provide for her duaghters despite the absence of the head of the family, her husband. Now she requires a loan in the amount of $925 that she will use towards the purchase of more merchandse to have a greater variety of clothing, which will allow her to increase her sales and her income. Do not leave Cleotilde and her daughters - today, now more than ever, they need your generosity. Do not wait any longer and support them. They will thank you sincerely.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Cleotilde vive en la localidad de Tampico, en el estado de Tamaulipas, y es madre de 3 hijas. Hace tiempo que su esposo falleci y ella, a pesar de los difciles momentos emocionales por los que atravesaba, se tuvo que hacer cargo de la manutencin de sus hijas y es as como comenz con un pequeo negocio de venta de ropa de temporada. Con esta actividad ha podido pagar la educacin de sus hijas y sobre todo pagar loe medicamentos de una de sus hijas, quien es discapacitada.

Las cosas no han sido fciles para Cleotilde y su familia, pero gracias al esfuerzo y el trabajo diario ella ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijas ante la falta de la cabeza de la familia, su esposo. Ahora ella requiere de un prstamo por la cantidad de $ 925 DLLS, mismos que utilizar para poder comprar ms mercanca y tener mejor surtido en ropa, lo que le permitir incrementar sus ventar y obtener mejores ganancias. No dejes sola Cleotilde y sus hijas, ellas hoy ms que nunca requieren de tu generosidad, no lo dudes ms y apyalas, ellas te lo van a agradecer sinceramente.

loan.use: purcahse merchandise

loan.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 47 years old and is an honest, active, enthusiastic and entrepreneurial person. She and her three childrenlive in the city of Tampico. Two years ago, on the side walk outside her home, she started to make and sell hamburgers. But later she built a small stand with an overhead roof in from of her house. She started this for her need to obtain an income to help out her husband, mostly with the education of their children. Her husband's income was only enough to cover the household expenses. The daily struggles and the love of her family have permitted Cristina to keep up her business through so many years.

She needs to expand and continue with her business, as it is the onlyh way to provide her children with the education they need. Today she needs a loan of $925 for the purchase of ingredients that she uses to make her foods, such as, meat, cooking oil, natural gas, bread, tomatoes, onions, napkins, disposable cups and plates. These needed especially during this time of year when sales are highest. It is up to you, don't wait any longer. Become part of Cristina's efforts. She thanks you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Cristina tiene 47 aos, es una persona honesta, activa, entusiasta y emprendedora. Ella es casada, tiene tres hijos y vive en la localidad de Tampico. Hace doce aos, en la banqueta de afuera de su casa, comenz a elaborar y vender tortas, pero despus construy un pequeo local techado al frente de su domicilio. Esto lo inici por la necesidad de obtener un ingreso para ayudar a su esposo, sobre todo con la educacin de sus hijos, ya que con lo que l ganaba no nos alcanzaba ms que para solventar los gastos del hogar. El esfuerzo diario y el amor a su familia han permitido que Cristina, despus de tantos aos conserve el proyecto que un da emprendi.

Ella necesita crecer y continuar con su actividad, pues la nica forma de poder brindarle a sus hijos la educacin que necesitan. En ste momento ella necesita de un crdito de $925 DLLS para la adquisicin de materia prima con la que prepara sus alimentos, tales como carne, aceite, gas, pan, tomate, cebolla, servilletas, vasos y platos, desechables, ya que en sta poca aumentan las ventas. La decisin esta en tus manos, no lo dudes ms, vulvete parte de los logros de Cristina y su familia, ella te lo agradece.

loan.use: purchase merchandise (food)

loan.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Hard working, entrepreneurial, honest and responsible, these are the principal qualities that define Miss Felipa. She is mother of 4 children and is married. In 1981 she started selling cookies, snacks, candies, soft drinks, etc., in front of her house to help out her husband as his wages were not enoguh to cover the household costs (mostly because she had just resettled from another city, Cerro Azul, and they had many expenses following their change in residence to Tampico). All these years Miss Felipa has worked very hard, with the only objective being to obtain income to improve the family economy and to pay for their children's studies. This business has made it all possible as her husband's income is very small.

Today she requires a loan in the amount of $925 that she will use towards the purchase of merchandise to increase her sales and consequently her income. With your generosity you can contribute to the wellbeing of Felipa and her family. Do not wait any longer. She will sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Trabajadora, emprendedora, honesta y responsable, son las principales cualidades que definen a Doa Felipa, quien es madre de 4 hijos y es casada. En 1981 ella comenz vendiendo galletas, frituras, dulces, refrescos, etc., en la parte delantera de su casa para ayudar a su esposo, ya que lo que l ganaba no nos alcanzaba para los gastos del hogar, sobre todo porque haban llegado de otra ciudad, Cerro Azul, y tuvieron muchos gastos por el cambio de residencia a Tampico. Todos estos aos Doa Felipa ha trabajado arduamente con el nico objetivo de obtener ingresos para mejorar su economa familiar y adems poder solventar los estudios de sus hijos, que si esta actividad sera imposible, pues el sueldo de su esposo es muy bajo.

En ste momento ella requiere de un prstamo por la cantidad de $925 DLLS, mismos que utilizar en la compra de mercanca para poder incrementar sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos. Con tu generosidad puedes contribuir a el bienestar de Felipa y su familia, no lo dudes ms, ella de lo agradeceder sinceramente

loan.use: purcahse merchandise

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: EXPAND FARMING

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: EXPAND FARMING

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: EXPAND FARMING

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: EXPAND HER NURSERY SCHOOL

loan.name: Slt Pauline

texts.en:
Born in 1965 in Kpm (Lake Region), Mrs. G. Slt Pauline is a mother of five (5) children. A widow for several months, she now has the burden of taking care of her entire family alone.

To meet her family's financial needs, she has been storing and selling the vegetable "gari" and corn flour for the last 5 years. This very profitable activity has enabled her to contribute to household needs until the death of her husband. Today, faced with her new situation, Mrs G. cannot make ends meet with her business. Concerned with the education of her children, she would like to build on her business but does not have the necessary means. Her experience and management skills enabled her to refund her first two loans promptly. The new credit of $650 that she is requesting will be used for the purchase, the storage and the resale of gari and corn. The improvement of her business will enable her to improve the quality of life of her family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Ne en 1965 Kpm (Prfecture des Lacs), Madame G. Slt Pauline est mre de cinq (5) enfants. Veuve depuis quelques mois, elle a aujourdhui la lourde charge dassumer toutes les charges familiales. Pour leurs besoins et les problmes financiers de sa famille, elle exerce depuis 5 ans le stockage et la vente de la farine de manioc gari et du mas. Cette activit trs rentable lui a toujours permis de contribuer efficacement aux charges du mnage jusqu la mort de son mari. Aujourdhui seule face ses charges, Madame G. na plus la capacit de les assumer. Soucieuse de lducation de ses enfants, elle cherche renforcer son activit mais il na pas assez de moyens. Sa sagesse et son sens de gestion lui ont permis de rembourser promptement ses deux premiers crdits. Le nouveau crdit de $650 quelle sollicite lui servira de fonds de commerce pour lachat, le stockage et la revente du gari et du mas. Lamlioration de son commerce lui permettra de relever le niveau de vie de sa famille

loan.use: Buying, storage and resale of gari and corn.

loan.name: Flora

texts.en:
Mrs Flora M. was born in 1972 in Anho. She is married and mother of a boy. Her husband is a teacher with a very low income. Daily life in this family is very difficult because the sources of income are not reliable. Having noticed that frozen goods are unavailable in her district, Mrs M. surveyed people in the area to assess their need for these goods. Thanks to her first credit of $400, she managed to buy a freezer and began selling frozen products. This activity quickly became sucessful since Mrs M. is the only business selling these products in the vicinity. Dynamic and honest, she already refunded her first credit. However, her product supply does not meet the demand. To improve her business in this regard, she is asking for a credit of $850 to be able to buy a new freezer for the wholesale of the frozen products. The success of this business will relieve her family's grave situation.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame M. Flora est ne en 1972 Anho. Elle est marie et mre dun garon. Son poux est un instituteur qui na quun revenu minable. La vie au quotidien dans cette famille est trs difficile car les sources de revenu ne sont pas fiables. Madame M. ayant remarqu le manque de boutique dapprovisionnement en produits congels dans son quartier a fait un sondage pour avoir une ide sur limportance de la demande. Cest ainsi que grce son premier crdit de $400, elle parvient acqurir un conglateur et commence un commerce de produits congels. Cette activit prend vite une grande ampleur car Madame M. est la seule commerante de ces produits dans sa localit. Dynamique et honnte, elle a dj rembours sans aucun incident son premier crdit. La demande tant devenu trs forte, son capital ne lui permet plus de satisfaire tous ses clients. Pour renforcer son activit, elle sollicite un crdit de $850 pour pouvoir acqurir un nouveau conglateur pour la vente en quantit des produits congels. Le succs de cette activit soulagera la misre dans la famille de Madame M.

loan.use: To buy a new freezer for the wholesale of frozen goods

loan.name: Adot Payi

texts.en:
Mr A. Adot Payi was born on March 20, 1978 in Anho. A married father of a child, he is an electrician. Not having found work, he opened a small cell phone, radio and computer equipment repair shop. He supports his entire family as well as his mother, despite his low income. Conscious of its responsibilities, he is a hard worker aiming to satisfy all his customers. With the growth of the cell phone industry, Mr A. realized that it would be very profitable to also sell cell phones.
