To this end he would like to open a small kiosk beside his workshop and is asking for a loan of $800 which will enable him to open the kiosk and to have enough capital for the purchase and the resale of cell phones and their accessories. The profits would increase his income and help him better provide for the needs for his family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Adot Payi est n le 20 Mars 1978 Anho. Mari et pre dun enfant, il est technicien en lectronique de formation. Nayant pas trouv de travail, il ouvre un petit atelier de rparation de tlphone portable, de radio et de matriels informatiques. Malgr linsuffisance de son revenu, il est oblig de nourrir sa famille et aussi sa mre qui est sa charge. Conscient de ses responsabilits, il travaille sans relche pour satisfaire tous ses clients. Aujourdhui, avec lvolution sans cesse croissante de la tlphonie mobile, Monsieur A. sest rendu compte quil serait trs rentable de vendre des tlphones portables. A cet effet il voudrait ouvrir un petit kiosque ct de son atelier. Il sollicite alors un crdit de $800 qui va lui permettre douvrir le kiosque et de disposer de fonds de commerce pour lachat et la revente des tlphones portables et leurs accessoires. Cela augmenterait son revenu pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loan.use: Open a kiosk to sell cell phones and accessories

loan.name: Kvin

texts.en:
Born on September 22, 1983, Mr Kvin S. is a photographer. To make enough money, he goes to visit his customers from district to district because he does not have the money to establish a photo studio. Very dynamic and devoted, he has quickly gained the trust of his customers and is in high demand, especially for big events. At the request of many of his customers, he would like to open his own studio. This project requires the capital that Mr. S.'s small income would not be able to support. He would therefore like to ask for a credit of $700 to open his own studio, buy a high-quality camera as well as a video camera for event reporting. This credit will allow him to bring his work to a more professional level and, ultimately, earn a better income.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

N le 22 Septembre 1983, Monsieur S. Kvin est photographe de formation. Pour se prendre en charge, il se promne de quartier en quartier pour aller vers les clients car il na pas les moyens davoir un studio photo. Trs dynamique et dvou, il gagna vite la confiance de ses clients et est trs sollicit aujourdhui surtout dans les grandes manifestations. A la demande de ses nombreux clients, il souhaite ouvrir son propre studio. Ce projet ncessite assez de moyens que les petites conomies de Monsieur S. ne pourront pas supporter. Il sollicite alors un crdit de $700 pour ouvrir son atelier, acqurir un appareil photo de bonne qualit et une camra pour les minis reportages des ftes. Loctroi de ce crdit lui permettra de professionnaliser son travail et den tirer plus de revenu.

loan.use: Open a photo studio, buy a high-quality camera and a video camera

loan.name: Afi Virginie

texts.en:
Born in 1978, Miss Afi Virginia K. has had her small business for 4 years. Thanks to her income, she takes care of her mother and brothers. Miss K. sells groceries and staple goods. She is a very dynamic and entrepreneurial woman. Her business know-how and enthusiasm has brought in a growing customer base, and she is now looking to grow her business to be able to efficiently respond to the needs of her clientele. To this end, she would like to open a shop for her business and is asking for a $700 loan to do so. Moreover, this credit will help increase her inventory, which will, in turn, help her increase her sales and improve her economic and social status.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Ne en 1978, Mlle K. Afi Virginie exerce son petit commerce depuis 4 ans. Elle a charge sa mre et ses frres quelle se doit dentretenir grce aux revenus de ce commerce. Mlle K. vend des produits dalimentation, des produits gnriques et des produits de premire ncessit. Cest une femme trs dynamique et trs entreprenante. Son enthousiasme et son savoir faire lui ont procur une clientle abondante et elle cherche aujourdhui agrandir son commerce pour pouvoir rpondre efficacement la demande qui soffre elle. Elle dsire cet effet ouvrir une boutique afin de donner une envergure professionnelle lactivit. Elle sollicite pour ce faire un crdit de $700 pour acqurir un local qui va lui servir de boutique. De plus ce crdit laidera augmenter son stock, ce qui lui permettra daccrotre son chiffre daffaire et amliorer sa condition conomique et sociale.

loan.use: Buy a shop that will serve as a grocery store

loan.name: Abiassi Agbo

texts.en:
Born in 1968 in Anho, Mr. Abiassi Agbo B. is married and a father of two (2) children. Because he is blind, he always stays in the family house. In spite of his handicap, he has become an artisan. The quality of his works surprises the locals, and he thus has a large client base who order his products. This business makes it possible for Mr B. to provide for the needs for his small family. The main products he makes are chairs, cloths and scarves. He would now like to open a gallery in order to better showcase his products. His work is highly regarded and appreciated in the area. He is asking for a loan of $650 to carry out this project and to improve the standard of living of his family. To support this project of a blind person, is to encourage handicapped people to support themselves.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

N en 1968 Anho, Monsieur B. Abiassi Agbo est mari et pre de deux (2) enfants. A cause de son handicap de non voyant, il demeure toujours dans la maison familiale. Malgr son infirmit, il a pu apprendre le mtier de tisserand quil exerce aujourdhui. La qualit de ses uvres surprend les habitants de sa localit. Cest ainsi quil a une clientle importante qui raffole ses produits. Cette activit permet Monsieur B. de subvenir aux besoins de sa petite famille. Les principaux produits quil fabrique sont les chaises, les nattes, les pagnes et les foulards. Afin de faire mieux apprcier ses produits, il voudrait ouvrir une boutique dexposition de ses uvres. Ses fabrications sont trs apprcies dans le milieu. Il sollicite un appui financier de $650 pour raliser son projet et changer le niveau de vie de sa famille. Soutenir ce projet dun mal voyant, cest encourager les handicaps se prendre en charge.

loan.use: Open an artisan shop

loan.name: Abla

texts.en:
Bread is one of the most consumed foods in Togo and particularly in Anho (Prefecture of the Lakes). Born in 1977, Mrs. Abla A. has has been making and selling bread for 7 years already. She is married and a mother of three (3) children. Her husband has been unemployed for the last few years also helps with the business. The growing business makes it possible for Mrs. A. to meet the family's needs. The exceptional quality of the bread she sells has brought her many loyal customers. Bread retailers come in great numbers for their own supplies. However, she cannot meet the market needs because she is limited in the production of the bread. She is thus looking to build a new oven and increase the daily production. Unfortunately, her income does not enable her to cover all the expenses of this undertaking. She is thus asking for a loan of $850 to build a second oven. This will, in turn, increase the family income and improve their living conditions.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Le pain est lune des denres alimentaires les plus consommes au Togo et particulirement Anho (Prfecture des Lacs). Ne en 1977, Madame A. Abla exerce comme activit la fabrication et la vente du pain depuis 7 ans dj. Elle est marie et mre de trois (3) enfants. Son poux qui est sans emploi depuis quelques annes laide dans ses tches. Lactivit trs florissante, permet Madame A. de satisfaire dans une grande mesure les besoins de la famille. La qualit exceptionnelle du pain quelle vend sur le march fait quelle a une clientle abondante. Les revendeurs de pain viennent en grand nombre sen approvisionner. Aujourdhui, elle narrive plus satisfaire tout le monde car elle est limite dans la production. Elle cherche fabriquer un nouveau four en vue daugmenter la production quotidienne du pain. Malheureusement, son conomie ne lui permet pas de couvrir toutes les dpenses que cette restructuration ncessiterait. Cest pour cela quelle sollicite un crdit de $850 pour construire un second four. Ca permettra daugmenter le revenu familial et amliorer les conditions de vie.

loan.use: Build a second oven

loan.name: Vronique

texts.en: Ne en 1960 Anho, Madame A. Vronique est marie et mre de six (6) enfants. Son poux en retraite depuis 5 ans narrive plus assumer les charges de la famille car sa pension de retraite est trs insuffisante. Exerant comme activit le tissage et la vente des nattes, Madame A. arrive subvenir aux charges du mnage avec son petit revenu. Elle vient de recevoir une importante commande de 400 nattes dune gamme spciale. Avec son quipe, elle a dcid de satisfaire cette commande provenant dun centre de formation pour jeunes dlinquants. Les nattes commandes sont de grandes dimensions et demandent plus de travail parce quil faut y insrer le logo du centre. Seulement, Madame A. na pas les moyens ncessaires pour faire ce travail. Elle sollicite pour ce faire un crdit de $750 pour acheter les matriaux de fabrication et engager quelques personnes pour que le travail soit rapide. Cette commande va beaucoup augmenter son chiffre daffaire et changer ses conditions de vie et celles de sa famille.

loan.use: acheter les matriaux de fabrication

loan.name: Francisca

texts.en:
I am in a group of 25 widows who have been contracted to supply fertilized eggs to a hatching project in Ugunja. If we succesfully supply the eggs, we will be loaned chicks to rear and supply eggs to the same project.
The loan will be used to purchase five fowls: 1 cock and 4 hens. This will enable me to supply fertilized eggs to the hatching project after 21 days at a cost of 0.45 USD per day. Apart from supplyings eggs, fertilised eggs are recommended for people living with HIV /AIDS and all of the group members are living positively.

loan.use: To purchase five fowls.

loan.name: Sharon

texts.en:
I am in a group of 25 widows who have been contracted to supply fertilized eggs to a hatching project in Ugunja. If we succesfully supply the eggs, we will be loaned chicks to rear and supply eggs to the same project.
The loan will be used to purchase five fowls: 1 cock and 4 hens. This will enable me to supply fertilized eggs to the hatching project after 21 days at a cost of 0.45 USD per day. Apart from supplyings eggs, fertilised eggs are recommended for people living with HIV /AIDS and all of the group members are living positively. This loan will ensure that I meet my basic needs.

loan.use: To purchase five fowls.

loan.name: Laureen

texts.en:
I am in a group of 25 widows who have been contracted to supply fertilized eggs to a hatching project in Ugunja. If we succesfully supply the eggs, we will be loaned chicks to rear and supply eggs to the same project.
The loan will be used to purchase five fowls: 1 cock and 4 hens. This will enable me to supply fertilized eggs to the hatching project after 21 days at a cost of 0.45 USD per day. Apart from supplyings eggs, fertilised eggs are recommended for people living with HIV /AIDS and all of the group members are living positively. This loan will ensure that I meet my basic needs.

loan.use: To purchase five fowls.

loan.name: Salome

texts.en:
I am in a group of 25 widows who have been contracted to supply fertilized eggs to a hatching project in Ugunja. If we succesfully supply the eggs, we will be loaned chicks to rear and supply eggs to the same project.
The loan will be used to purchase five fowls: 1 cock and 4 hens. This will enable me to supply fertilized eggs to the hatching project after 21 days at a cost of 0.45 USD per day. Apart from supplyings eggs, fertilised eggs are recommended for people living with HIV /AIDS and all of the group members are living positively. This loan will ensure that I meet my basic needs.

loan.use: To purchase five fowls.

loan.name: Margret

texts.en: I do business in Kisumu Town. I have 3 children and am a single mother. I want the loan to expand my business and purchase clothes for the season. School is currently openning and many customers want to buy school uniforms for both primary and secondary schools.

loan.use: To purchase and stock my second hand clothing business.

loan.name: Moses

texts.en: I am a retailer of bakery products in Kisumu Town. I am married with 4 children. I will use the loan to assist me in purchasing a microwave. My clients demand hot food and because I only retail the product I need to install a microwave. I will retain more customers and also make more money to feed my children and ensure that they remain in school.

loan.use: To purchase a microwave to heat bakery products for my customers.

loan.name: Grace

texts.en: I sell small food stuffs like beans, rice, and flour outside my house in Manyatta, Kisumu. I am married with 2 children. I wish to get a loan to pay for an annual license and purchase more cereals.

loan.use: I will purchase an annual license and broaden my stock.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: I need the loan to expand my second hand clothing business

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To expand my brick business. I will hire a brick making machine for 3 weeks to make 5,000 bricks.

loan.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty has a unique business in the community she lives in. She owns a laundry mat where she charges her clients per load. She started her business off by financing a washing machine. She now has increased the number of washers and allows clients to rent them. Although her home is made of wood, she has placed the washers inside and has done business from her house. She is requesting the loan because she wants to invest in a dryer. Currently, her clients can only wash the wet clothes and must take them home to hang dry. She hopes that with this new investment she will be able to increase her profits. She is a single mother of four children who completely depends on this business to feed her family.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Invest in a dryer for her laundry mat.

loan.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie visits homes offering her product and services. She is a woman of many trades as she provides not only clothing and cosmetics, but also facials and manicures. She is very popular amongst the women in her neighborhood. She started off doing business with a $200 loan from her sister that she used to invest in womens undergarments. She still sells these items but now offers other types of clothing and cosmetic services. She is requesting the loan in order to continue investing in these items. She also wants to begin selling jewelry and other womens accessories. Marjorie and her husband, who is also a salesman, have two children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Invest in jewelry and other women's accessories

loan.name: Digan

texts.en:
Digan is a street vendor of clothes but also has a small business at home. She started the business with the help of her husband who provided $200 in start up in capital. She started selling only childrens clothes but now also provides clothes for men and women. Although the clothes sales do provide for her family, she needs to make more money in order to provide a better standard of living. She wants to invest the loan she receives in household items that she can also sell and provide more profit. She is 42 years old and moved to Guayaquil from a rural sector known as Los Rios. She has one daughter who she wants to educate past the high school level.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Invest in household products to sell

loan.name: Leyda

texts.en:
Leyda has a small beauty shop where she cuts men and womens hair. She started out in this line of work by offering her services at peoples homes, but now she has set up a part of her own house to work from. She has just started selling jewelry and other accessories to her clients as a part of her business. Leyda wants to continue investing in items to sell as complimentary goods from her business. She has noticed that by having people come in for haircuts she can also market these other goods. She and her husband have three kids. She is very optimistic about receiving the loan for her business and the good of her family.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Invest in complimentary products to sell from her beauty shop

loan.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther has a general store where she provides many of the items the community uses in daily consumption. When she started, she only had $100 of capital and could only sell vegetables from a stand. Now her store has items ranging from food to office supplies to cleaning products for the home. She is requesting the new loan because she wants to continue investing in all of her merchandise but also wants to introduce baby products into her sales. She sees that diapers and formula are highly in demand and she wants to take advantage of the business opportunity. Esther moved to Guayaquil from a rural sector named Los Rios. She has three children that she works very hard to educate and to feed.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Invest in baby products

loan.name: Marcia

texts.en:
Marcia is a wholesale distributor of rice in her area. She started the business with the help of her parents who had the contacts to buy the rice at low prices. At first, she sold to individuals in the community from her home, but she realized there were better opportunities as a whole sale distributor. She is requesting the loan because along with her rice distribution, she wants to open a small store from her home. She will sell rice and other basic groceries to her neighbor and people in the vicinity. Marcia has two kids, but only one of them goes to school. The other is handicapped and therefore taken care and home schooled by Marcia. Marcia wants to continue growing this business because it allows her to be with her family and also provides for them. She hopes that with the increased profits she can provide more for her children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Open a small store from her home

loan.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco has a small ice cream shop. He started the business selling ice cream on the streets and near bus stops. Slowly he began to move closer to home and sell to the local schools until he moved the business into his home. He now runs a much larger operation from his home, where he provides the ice cream for 5 street vendors while he sells the product out of his home. Francisco is very proud of the way his business has grown but does not want to stop here. He needs the loan in order to invest in a new freezer and chairs for his clients. He is 42 years old and has one child with his wife. He will use the extra profits from his investment to fix up his home and save for the education of his children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Buy a freezer and chairs for his ice cream shop

loan.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa and her husband have a furniture making business. She runs the administrative and sales parts while her husband produces the goods to sell. They started off with about $300 of their savings. They only made chairs and desks at first, but now they have moved into producing all types of bedroom furniture. They well use the loan in order to invest in wood which is getting more expensive at this time of year. Rosa is 37 years old, she and her husband have two children. They completely depend on this business to provide for them and their children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Invest in wood for furniture making

loan.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa owns a small food market very well situated on a main street. Elsa started the store with a family member who helped her with $100. At first she only sold candy and snacks, but she has slowly evolved into a small groceries market. Elsa will use her loan in order to continue to invest in new items like dairy products and canned goods. She is sure that with the loan her business activity will increase and she will bring in more profits. Elsa has been divorced for about 10 years. She has a son that still lives at home. She completely depends on the business to meet the needs of the household.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: She wants to invest in goods for her store

loan.name: Maira

texts.en:
Maira has about 4 years of experience catching and selling crab. Her husband has been in the industry since he was 12 years when he used to go out and catch crab with his dad. After marrying, Marias husband taught her the tricks of the trade and they decided to start a business of their own. They now wake up at 5 am to catch the crabs and work until 2 pm cooking and selling them. Maria is requesting the loan in order to invest in other seafood that she may couple with her crab selling. She is confident that the investment will be worthwhile. Maria is 19 years old and only has one 3 year old son. Her and her husband work very diligently and are hopeful that the loan will help them get ahead.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Invest in other seafood products

loan.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix has a laundry mat in the local community. These businesses are somewhat new in the area, but they have proven to be successful. He started off with 2 washing machines that he rented out. He now has 4 and has become very popular in the neighborhood for his service that is convenient and cheap. He wants to invest in a new machine now that business is on the rise and he has used up all his savings. He works everyday from 6 am until 6 pm while his wife sells candies from his store. Together they have two children, one of which unfortunately has a mental disability. They hope with this loan they can continue to grow the laundry mat and provide for their family.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Invest in a new washing machine

loan.name: Jamela

texts.en:
Jamela is 32 years old with her 7 children living in district 5 in Kabul, Afghanistan.

She is married and she took out a loan for her son to increase his business. She hopes to receive more loans through AFSG to continue her son's business.

loan.use: To buy fuel and gas for her son.

payment.comment: Due to an administrative error, Jamela Gul Ahmad\'s individual repayments were not reported to Kiva. She has, however, successfully paid back the loan to the field partner.

loan.name: Fazila

texts.en:
Fazila is 19 years old girl living in district 5 in Kabul, Afghanistan.

She is single and continuing her studies, but she took loan for her brother to help grow his business. She believes that AFSG gives him more loan cycles to increase her brother's business.

loan.use: Buying goods and fresh vegitable.

loan.name: Bibi Jan

texts.en:
Bibi Jan is 20 years old and lives with her 3 children in the Afshar Selow district of Kabul, Afghanistan.
She is married and would like a loan so she can work alongside her husband to enhance their financial situation.
She hopes to receive her first loan through AFSG so she can continue her husband's business and support her family in the future.

loan.use: To buy wood and flour for her husband's shop.

loan.name: Maleha

texts.en:
Maleha is a 21 year old girl living in a household of four in District 2 in Kabul, Afghanistan.
Maleha and her father Abdul Gafor are doing a share business of selling fresh vegetables and other goods, she normally package the goods and her father is selling them in the shop near to their house.
She would like to take a loan so her they can grow small business and get financial income to support the family.
Being an Afghan women it is very difficult to go out side of the house for working, taking photo is more than that so AFSG could not have permission from Maleha's family for taking photo.

loan.use: To buy goods and fresh fruits.

loan.name: Vronique

texts.en:
Born in 1960 in Anho in Togo, Mrs Vronique A. is married and the mother of six (6) children. Her husband, who retired 5 years ago, is unable to meet the familys needs as his pension is very insufficient. Working as a weaver and selling the mats she creates, Mrs A. is able to provide for her family with her small revenue. She has just received a large order for a special line of 400 mats. The order comes from a centre which trains juvenile delinquents. The mats ordered are of a large size and require more work because the logo of the centre needs to be inserted. Mrs A. and her team dont have the necessary resources to do the work. She is asking for a loan of $750 to buy the needed materials and to hire a few people so the work will be done quickly. This order will increase her sales a lot and change her and her familys living conditions.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Ne en 1960 Anho, Madame A. Vronique est marie et mre de six (6) enfants. Son poux en retraite depuis 5 ans narrive plus assumer les charges de la famille car sa pension de retraite est trs insuffisante. Exerant comme activit le tissage et la vente des nattes, Madame A. arrive subvenir aux charges du mnage avec son petit revenu. Elle vient de recevoir une importante commande de 400 nattes dune gamme spciale. Avec son quipe, elle a dcid de satisfaire cette commande provenant dun centre de formation pour jeunes dlinquants. Les nattes commandes sont de grandes dimensions et demandent plus de travail parce quil faut y insrer le logo du centre. Seulement, Madame A. na pas les moyens ncessaires pour faire ce travail. Elle sollicite pour ce faire un crdit de $750 pour acheter les matriaux de fabrication et engager quelques personnes pour que le travail soit rapide. Cette commande va beaucoup augmenter son chiffre daffaire et changer ses conditions de vie et celles de sa famille.

loan.use: buy materials to make mats

loan.name: Laetitia Tchotcho

texts.en:
Born on March 3rd, 1980 in Anho, Miss Laetitia Tchotcho K. is a graduate of a fashion house in Lom. When she returned to Anho five years ago she opened her own sewing shop. She noticed that many of her clients were asking for embroidery work so she went to do some vocational training in embroidery over the last five months. Intelligent and sincere, Miss K. likes to do good work. She charms her clients by the quality of her service. Today, to be able to completely satisfy her numerous and demanding clients, she wants to equip her sewing shop with an embroidery machine and use all her talents. To do this she is asking for a loan of $700 to buy an embroidery machine to meet the new demands of her clients. This will allow her to increase her revenue and assure her financial independence.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Ne le 3 Mars 1980 Anho, Mlle K. Laetitia Tchotcho est diplme dune maison de couture Lom. Revenue Anho, elle a ouvert son atelier de couture il y a 5 ans. Elle a remarqu que beaucoup de ses clientes demandent se faire broder leurs habits et elle est alle faire un stage en broderie au cours de ces cinq derniers mois. Intelligente, sincre et aimant le travail bien fait, elle sduit sa clientle par la qualit de son service. Aujourdhui, pour pouvoir donner une satisfaction totale ses nombreux et exigeants clients, elle veut doter son atelier dune machine broder et faire valoir tous ses talents. Pour cela, elle sollicite un crdit de $700 pour acqurir la machine broder afin dtre la hauteur des nouvelles exigences de ses clients. Cela lui permettra damliorer son revenu et dassurer son autonomie financire.

loan.use: buy an embroidery machine

loan.name: Tl

texts.en:
Born in 1963 in Agbodrafo (Lakes Prefecture), Mrs Tl A. is married and the mother of five (5) children. In addition to her own children, she also takes care of two (2) children of her eldest child. A dynamic woman who is full of hope, she has a stall of kitchen utensils and accessories at her local market. Widowed for the last two years, she has had a difficult time supporting her family. At the moment, her local market is becoming a regional market with much larger crowds. She wants to take advantage of the opportunity to make her business more professional. Only the improvement and increase of her business will allow her to properly meet the needs of her children. That is why she is asking for a loan of $600 to increase and diversify the products she sells to take advantage of this new chance and improve her standard of living. To finance this business is to ease of suffering of an entire family beset by daily difficulties.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Ne en 1963 Agbodrafo (Prfecture des Lacs) Madame A. Tl est marie et mre de cinq (5) enfants. En plus de ses enfants, elle a sa charge deux (2) petits fils de son an. Femme dynamique et pleine despoir, elle dispose dun talage dustensiles et accessoires de cuisine au march de sa localit. Veuve depuis 2 ans, elle a du mal supporter les charges familiales. Actuellement, le march de sa localit est en passe de devenir un march rgional et on y note une trs grande affluence. Aussi veut-elle profiter de cette occasion pour rendre professionnelle son activit. Seul le renforcement de son commerce pourra lui permettre dassumer convenablement les besoins de ses enfants. Pour y parvenir, il lui faut de largent. Cest pourquoi elle sollicite un crdit de $600 pour augmenter et diversifier ses produits afin de tirer profit de cette nouvelle donne et relever son niveau de vie. Financer cette affaire, cest soulager les souffrances de toute une famille en proie aux difficults quotidiennes.

loan.use: buying and reselling utensils and kitchen accessories

loan.name: Rohena

texts.en:
Rohena is 42 years old and feeding a household of 8 living in District 5 in Kabul, Afghanistan.
Roshena and her Husband Abdul Waheed are doing a family business where both can be active, she is purchasing Beans and Peas, cook them at home and then her husband sells them on the street in a small cart. In Afghan society it is very difficult for a women to sell goods in the street or even in the shop, but with all those problems she is trying to be an active business woman. Even though her husband is an educated person but becouse he is an Afghan he does not allow her wife to post her photo.
She already repaid a 1st and 2nd loan succesfully and would now like a 3rd cycle loan through AFSG

loan.use: To buy beans and peas

loan.name: Mana

texts.en:
Born in 1966 in Lom, Mrs Mana O. is married and mother of six (6) children. She sells smoked fish to make her living and provide for her family. She owns an oven to smoke the fish, but because of an increase in the population of her village and the increase in demand for her smoked fish, she hopes to install a new oven which will allow her to smoke more fish. The experience she has in this field and her management sense will allow her to successfully expand her business. However, to make this new project a reality she needs some financial support. That is why she is asking for a loan of $650 to expand her business and increase her sales. This project is worthy of support because it will allow Mrs O. to take proper care of her children.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Ne en 1966 Lom, Madame O. Mana est marie et mre de six (6) enfants tous sa charge. Elle exerce comme activit le commerce de poissons fums pour assumer les charges de sa famille. Elle dispose dun four de poissons, mais face laugmentation de la population de son village et la croissante demande en poissons fums, elle souhaiterait fabriquer un nouveau four qui lui permettrait de fumer plus de poissons. Lexprience quelle a dans le domaine et son sens de gestion lui permettront de mener bien cet largissement de lactivit. Mais pour raliser ce nouveau projet, elle a besoin dun appui financier. Ce qui lamne solliciter ce crdit de $650 pour agrandir la taille de son commerce et accrotre son chiffre daffaire. Ce projet mrite dtre soutenu car sa ralisation va permettre Madame O. de bien prendre soins de ses enfants.

loan.use: Make a second oven to smoke fish

loan.name: Mary Jan

texts.en:
Mary Jan is 45 years old and living with her 9 children in District 5, Kabul, Afghanistan.
Mary Jan and Said Mohammad are doing a family business, they both are trying to do a successful business, Mary Jan is purchasing the supply from the main market and whole sellers and her husband sells them in the shop, due to the Afghan cultuer Mary Jan herself is not able to be in the shop.
She already passed a 1st and 2nd loan cycle, now continuing with a 3rd loan cycle from AFSG.

loan.use: To buy goods and supplies for their shop

loan.name: Akossiwa

texts.en:
Mrs Akossiwa N. was born in 1959 in Tsvi. Married and mother of five (5) children, she has owned a shoe selling business for the last 5 years. On top of this business, she also does some subsistance farming. The farming is becoming more and more difficult, so she has decided to devote her time entirely to the shoe selling business, which is much more profitable. She wants to diversify her range of products by adding handbags and belts. Despite the fact she doesnt have a lot of education, she has mastered the concepts of management. She has already paid back her first loan without any incident. Today, to strenghten her business, she is asking for another loan, of $650. She will use the money as business capital to buy and sell shoes, handbags and belts. This will allow her to satisfy the demands of her clients and increase her income, allowing her to improve the standard of living of her family.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame N. Akossiwa est ne en 1959 Tsvi. Marie et mre de cinq (5) enfants, elle tient depuis 5 ans un commerce de chaussures. Paralllement cette activit, elle fait lagriculture de subsistance. Cette dernire activit devenant de plus en plus puisante, elle a dcid de se consacr entirement au commerce des chaussures qui est beaucoup plus rentable. Mais elle veut diversifier la gamme de ses produits en y ajoutant des sacs et des ceintures. Bien quelle nait pas volu dans ses tudes, elle matrise les notions de gestion. Elle a rembours son premier crdit sans aucun incident. Aujourdhui, pour renforcer cette activit, elle demande un crdit de $650 qui va lui servir de fond de commerce pour lachat et la revente des chaussures, des sacs et des ceintures. Cela permettra de satisfaire la demande de sa clientle et daugmenter son revenu afin damliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille.

loan.use: buying and selling of shoes, handbags and belts

loan.name: Masooda

texts.en:
Masooda, who is 23 years old, lives in a household of 5 in District 5, Kabul, Afghanistan.
She is married and passed 4 years of her life in a difficult situation before she started to take a loan from AFSG.
Masooda and her husband Ghulam Mohammad are doing a share business of grocery shop. Masooda is cleaning the dried fruit and package them and her husband sells them in the shop, in the winter time she makes jam and pickles and vinegar for her husband shop.
She helped her husband and took a loan through AFSG so that her husband can buy lots of goods for his shop. Right now she passed the 1st cycle loan and is continuing with a 2nd loan cycle. She believes that taking a loan and spending it on thier business will create benefits and grow fast.
After 30 years of war in Afghanistatn, an additional challenge was that the war had left its mark on women in Afghanistan. Even after that, many women continued to be restricted to their homes and doubted their ability to cope in the outside world or to run a successful business. Many women who were part of a small home business had no idea of the value of their work or of their products on the market. So AFSG started to focus and lend only to those women who can be at least a part of the business with the male member of thier family. Masooda is one of those women who is not allow to go out side of her house but still she is trying to help her family, due to all those problems she AFSG is not able to post her photo on the site but perfer to have her husband on his working.

loan.use: To buy Goods

loan.name: Ablavi

texts.en:
Born in 1962 in Glidji (Lakes Prefecture), Mrs Ablavi H. is married and the mother of eight (8) children. In her town, the raw materials needed to fabricate mats are readily available. This is an opportunity for Mrs H., who weaves mats as a profession. Abandoned by an irresponsible husband, she is raising her children alone under difficult conditions. Her first four children, who werent able to go to school because of a lack of means, are today working as weavers. It is because of this activity that her children can make their own money and take care of their own needs. This is a help to the whole family. This is why she is asking for a loan of $600, which will allow her to buy larger quantities of raw materials to make mats. This will increase her sales and improve her familys living conditions.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Ne en 1962 Glidji (Prfecture des Lacs), Madame H. Ablavi est marie et mre de huit (8) enfants. Dans sa localit, les matires premires ncessaires la fabrication des nattes sont abondantes. Ce qui constitue une opportunit pour Madame H. qui fait la tresse des nattes comme profession. Abandonne par un mari irresponsable, elle lve seule ses enfants dans des conditions pnibles. Ses quatre premiers enfants nont nayant pu aller lcole faute de moyens sont aujourdhui initis la tresse des nattes. Et cest grce cette activit que la famille parvient survivre. Elle a lambition dlargir lactivit, pour que ses enfants puissent aussi en tirer profit et subvenir eux-mmes leurs besoins. Cela y va du bien-tre de toute la famille. Cest pour cela quelle sollicite un crdit $600 qui va lui permettre de sapprovisionner en quantit des matires premires pour la fabrication des nattes. Ceci va accrotre son chiffre daffaire et amliorer ses conditions de vie.

loan.use: buying raw materials to make mats

loan.name: Miboussomkpo

texts.en:
Born in 1965, Mrs Miboussomkpo A. is married and the mother of five (5) children. For the last 8 years, she has run a business fabricating and selling mats. The business of mat making is booming in her town. It is because of this that she is able to contribute to the running of her household. Three months ago, she began making woven baskets because she realized that this would also be profitable. The demand for these baskets has been very strong and they need to been made in large quantities to meet the demand - particularly from tomato producers. To suitably meet the demand of people wanting to buy her baskets, Mrs A. needs some financial support. She is asking for a loan of $700, which she will use as business capital to buy raw materials needed to make mats and baskets. This will increase her income and improve living conditions for her and her family.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Ne en 1965, Madame A. Miboussomkpo est marie et mre de cinq (5) enfants. Elle a comme profession la fabrication et la vente des nattes, activit quelle exerce depuis 8 ans. Le commerce des nattes est une activit trs florissante dans cette localit. Cest grce cette activit quelle contribue aux charges du mnage. Il y a 3 mois, elle sest initie la fabrication des paniers car elle sest rendue compte que ce commerce aussi est trs rentable. Mais la demande tant trs forte, il faut en fabriquer en grande quantit pour les livrer aux producteurs de tomates surtout. Pour pouvoir satisfaire convenablement les acheteurs de nattes et de paniers, Madame A. a besoin dun appui financier. Elle sollicite alors un crdit de $700 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour lachat des matires premires ncessaires pour la fabrication des nattes et des paniers. Ceci augmentera son revenu et amliorera ses conditions de vie et celles de sa famille.

loan.use: purchase of raw materials to make mats and baskets

loan.name: Sakena

texts.en:
Sakena was born in 1986 in Kabul City, Afghanistan. Right now she is single, living with her 6 family members.
Sakena is working together with her brother, weaving carpets, but her family income is rather limited. She decided to take a loan through AFSG so she can buy thread and weave the carpets. Then her brother can sell them in the bazaar at a high prize.

loan.use: To buy thread

loan.name: Bibi Khadeja

texts.en:
Bibi Khadeja was born in 1946 in Kabul City, Afghanistan, Bib Khadeja is a widow and a mother of 7 children.
She lost her husband during the war and now she is living with her kids, M. Ashmat is her eldest son who is supporting his family.
Bibi Khadija is purchasing the supplies for her son's shop and M. Ashamt sells them, they have a very good and successful business and got the loan to improve her.
Becouse she is an Afghan woman so her in-laws do not allow her to take photo for posting.
She plans to expand her business, therefore she took a loan from AFSG to buy lots of goods for her shop.

loan.use: To buy goods

loan.name: Tko

texts.en:
Born in 1952, Mr Tko F. B. is married and father of eight (8) children, four of whom are no longer under his charge. Polygamous, he today finds himself crushed under the weight of his household. Thanks to a first loan of $400 dollars, he was able to install a corn mill in his town and run it with rigor and efficiency. The scope of this activity has allowed him to lighten the suffering of his family. In light of the significant activity at his mill each day, Mr F. B. is thinking he should install a second corn mill. To do this, he needs more consistant financial support. This is why hes asking for a loan of $850 which will allow him to rent a locale, buy a second mill and have it installed. This will help speed up service and ease the long lines waiting to use his first mill. This will allow Mr. F. B. to increase his income for the well being of his family.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

N en 1952, Monsieur F. B. Tko est mari et pre de huit (8) enfants dont 4 ne sont plus sa charge. Polygame, il se trouve aujourdhui cras par les lourdes charges de son mnage. Grce un premier crdit de $400 obtenu, Il installe un moulin mas dans sa localit quil arrive grer avec rigueur et efficacit. Lampleur de lactivit de ce moulin a permis dallger les souffrances de la famille. Vu limportance de la clientle dans le moulin chaque jour, Monsieur F. B. a pens quil faudrait en installer un second. Pour cela, il lui faut un appui financier plus consistant. Cest dans ce sens quil sollicite un crdit de $850 qui va lui permettre de louer un local, dacheter le second moulin et de faire linstallation. Ceci aiderait rendre plus rapide la prestation de travail et soulager la longue attente des clients. Cela permettra Monsieur F. B. damliorer son revenu pour le bien-tre de sa famille.

loan.use: buying a second corn mill

loan.name: Adoud Mercy

texts.en:
Mrs Adoud Mercy A. A. was born in 1968. Married and the mother of two (2) children, she also has charge of her sick mother. For that last 8 years, she has operated a business producing and selling palm oil - a very popular oil used for cooking in her town. This has allowed her to contribute to running of her household with her modest income. The production and stocking of palm oil requires enough money. It is necessary to first buy the palm nuts before making the oil. This preparation also requires wood for burning and a lot of care and precision. It is meticulous work. To store the oil, one needs to buy drums. Palm oil is a much loved part of Togolese cuisine and her business is flourishing. Mrs A. A. is asking for a loan of $600 to improve her production and satisfy her ever increasing clientele.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. A. Adoud Mercy est ne en 1968. Marie et mre de deux (2) enfants, elle a sa charge sa mre malade. Depuis 8 ans, elle exerce le commerce dhuile de palme (huile trs utilise pour la cuisine dans sa localit). Ce qui lui permet de contribuer aux charges du mnage avec son revenu, aussi modeste soit-il. La production et le stockage dhuile de palme ncessitent assez de fonds. Il faut dabord sapprovisionner en noix de palme avant de faire la prparation. Cette prparation ncessite galement de bois de chauffe et se fait avec beaucoup de soins et de prcision. Cest un travail mticuleux. Pour le stockage, il faut des bidons quil faut aussi acqurir. Lhuile de palme est une denre trs apprcie dans les prparations culinaires togolaises et son commerce est florissant. Madame A. A. sollicite un crdit de $600 pour pouvoir amliorer sa production et satisfaire sa clientle qui crot de jour en jour.

loan.use: purchase of palm nuts for the preparation of palm oil

loan.name: Karema

texts.en:
Karema is 23 years old and a mother of 7 children,living in District 2 in Kabul, Afghanistan.
She already passed a 1st and 2nd loan cycle and continuing with her 3rd loan cycle she has been able to set up a beauty shop in her home area.
The shop requires stock to cater for customers' needs and to buy hair braids, weaves and wigs. Therefore she decided to take a loan from AFSG who believe that her business will increase and she will be able to pay her children's school fee.

loan.use: To buy hair weaves, braids and cosmetics.

loan.name: Hameda

texts.en:
Hameda was born in 1989, living with her family in District 2, Kabul, Afghanistan in a household of 10.
Hameda and her Brother Abdul Hamed has a share business of selling vegetable, she is normally cleaning and package the vegetable at home and her brother is selling them at a small cart in the street near to their house.
She took the 3rd cycle loan from AFSG to improve their business, they are doing this busienss since 3 years. They can generates enough to cover the needs of thier family.

loan.use: To buy vegetables and fresh fruits

loan.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana operates a fast food establishment in a populous area of Accra. She operates in the evenings when workers have have finished their jobs for the day and patronage very high. Her sales turnover is very high. Diana is a trainee of the TEACH lending programme. She wants a loan to improve her catering service.

loan.use: Microwave Oven

loan.name: Fidelia

texts.en: A 44-year-old woman, Mrs Fidelia A. lives in an urban area in Edo State of Nigeria. She is married with two children. She spent 6 months learning her trade, after which she opened her own store in 1985. She says the loan will make it possible for her to expand her business.

loan.use: To buy more baby things for sale

loan.name: Helen

texts.en: Mrs Helen E. is 44 years old. She lives in a semi-urban part of Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria where she sells her goods to people in her community. She is married with seven children. She is a dedicated client of LAPO. She says her business will improve with a loan of $350.

loan.use: To buy more food items

loan.name: Faith

texts.en: Mrs Faith O. is 30 years old, married with two children. She operates her business in Benin City, an urban center in Nigeria. She needs the sum of $400 to expand her business.

loan.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loan.name: Magdalene

texts.en: Mrs. Magdalene Osabokhan is 51-year-old woman, who lives a semi-rural area of Edo State, Nigeria. She cherishes her business so much that she learnt it for 6 months before started her own. She hopes to expand her business with the stated amount.

loan.use: To buy more goods

loan.name: Helen

texts.en: A dedicated LAPO woman who is a leader in her group, Mrs Helen E. is 48 years old with five children. She lives in Benin City, Edo state of Nigeria. She learnt her trade for five months before she started her own business in 1997. She is anxious to get the requested amount to enable her buy more firewood for sale.

loan.use: To buy more firewood for sales

loan.name: Nosa

texts.en: "I am proud to be a LAPO member for four years," explains Mr. Nosa E.. He is 36 years old and married with a child. He lives in Benin City of Edo state. He had training for 3 years before he finally started his own business. He says the loan amount will enable him to expand his business.

loan.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loan.name: Philomina

texts.en: Mrs. Philo O. is 35 years old and married with two children. She lives in Benin City of Edo State, Nigeria. She asks for the above amount for the expansion for her business.

loan.use: To buy more girlswear for sale

loan.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married and has one son. Her husband helps her with the business and her son is in college. Yelena attended University and after graduating she worked for a time as a merchandising expert. However, the need for higher income - to help meet her familys needs and ensure her sons education - prompted her to move into the market business selling groceries. Yelena has gained much rich experience working in the market trade. Her perseverance and diligent work have been keys to her success. The availability of loans from Nadiya Ukraine has also been a big help to her business. Just recently, Yelena was able to purchase a stand in the busiest market in the city. Yelena is requesting a loan of $1,200 for several purposes. Shed like to increase her turnover capital, purchase additional merchandise, and buy a new refrigerator to store perishable food items. Fresh dairy products, canned corn, peas, fruit and quality vegetable oil are just some of the many items Yelana beautifully arranges on her stand to attract customers in the busy market. The ability to purchase more items and get a new refrigerator to keep groceries fresh will help Yelena meet the high demand for these food items. Increased business income will generate more funds to help pay for her sons college tuition and continue to secure her familys well-being.

, . , . . . . . . . . 1200 . , , , . , , , , . . , .

loan.use: To buy a new refrigerator for groceries

loan.name: Doris

texts.en: Mrs. Doris O. lives in a semi-urban area in Edo State, Nigeria. She is married with two children and is 48 years of age. A dedicated LAPO client, she learnt her business for three months before opening hers in 1997. She asks for the above amount for the expansion for her business.

loan.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loan.name: Magdalene

texts.en: Mrs Magdalene O. is a young woman of 42 years old. She is a dynamic client of LAPO who specializes in the sale of provisions for people in her community. She is bent on improving her business with the above amount.

loan.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loan.name: Mercy

texts.en: A 31-year-old experienced trader, Mrs Mercy B. sell food items for people in her community. To meet the demand of her customers, she needs a loan of $350.

loan.use: To buy more food items for sale

loan.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Oleg is in the bicycle sales business selling recreational and performance bikes. He owns a small, comfortable pavilion where he offers a variety of bicycles and supplementary components. Oleg has been a client of Nadiya Ukraine for more than 4 years. He acknowledges that loans have been an essential part of the growth of his business. He was able to purchase a van using credit which has made his business more flexible and mobile. Currently Olegs net sales profit amounts to 50-70% which helps create stable growth for his business. Oleg is requesting a loan to increase his inventory of bicycles and various components. He is planning to buy bikes designed for urban use, mountain bikes and road bikes. He is able to purchase in bulk for good prices at a wholesale market. Prompt loan repayment and self-discipline have characterized Oleg in the past. Financial assistance will continue to promote the growth of his business and give many bike-lovers the extra moments of joy, speed and adventure that come with riding.

. , . 4 . , . . 50 70 , . , . , . . . , .

loan.use: To increase inventory of bicycles and components

loan.name: Josephine

texts.en: "There is a positive difference in my life," explained Mrs Josephine I.. She is married with five children and lives in a semi-rural area of Edo State. She provides the service of hairdressing for the community. She needs the amount to expand her business.

loan.use: To buy more goods for her business

loan.name: Mary

texts.en: Mrs Mary O. is 40 years old. She lives in a semi-urban area of Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria, where she sells plastics and rubber to customers in her community. She is married with eight children. She is a dedicated client of LAPO. She says if she is loaned the sum of $300, her business will improve.

loan.use: To buy more goods for her business

loan.name: Eunice

texts.en: 35-year-old Mrs Eunice O. lives in a semi urban area of Edo State, Nigeria. She is married with six children. She sells food items to the community. She hopes to borrow the above money for her business expansion.

loan.use: To improve on her business

loan.name: Imunwanhen

texts.en: A business-woman with 24 years experience, Mrs Imunwanhen A. lives in Benin City with two children. She needs the loan amount to expand her business.

loan.use: To improve on her business

loan.name: Helen

texts.en: Mrs. Helen O. is a distinguished LAPO client who smiles when it comes to talking about her business. She is 45 years old and married with five children. "I am in need of the sum of $450 for my business expansion," she says.

loan.use: To improve on her business

loan.name: Margaret

texts.en: Mrs. Margaret E. is married with four children. She is a 46-year-old LAPO client. She started the business three years ago and she is delighted to engage in the sale of foodstuffs. She is optimistic that her business will improve if loaned the sum if $350.

loan.use: To improve on her business

loan.name: Vincent

texts.en: 45-year-old Mr Vincent A. lives in an urban area in Edo State, Nigeria. He learnt his trade for six years, after which he opened his own business in 2001. He says if the amount is loaned to him, it will help him expand his business.

loan.use: To improve on her business

loan.name: Miguel Angel

texts.en:
Miguel is married, is father of 2 children and lives in the city of Monterry in the State of Neuvo Leon. He started his business selling kids' clothes following a large financial investment. Unfortunately the business did not yield the results he hoped for, and this is how he started to sell groceries in local markets. This busines shas given him the results he hoped for. Thanks to his dedication and his hard work, he has been able to provide his children with the needed education, that without this business would not have been possible.

Today Miguel requires a loan in the amount of $250, that he will invest in the purchase of more merchandise to increase his sales. Help him, he needs your generosity. Do not wait, he and his family will thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Miguel es casado y padre de 2 hijos, el vive en la localidad de Monterrey, en el estado de Nuevo Len, l inici con un negocio de venta de ropa para nios invistiendo una fuerte cantidad de dinero, sin embargo el negocio no dio los resultados esperados, es por ello que empez a vender mercanca de abarrotes en los mercados rodantes, actividad que le ha dado los resultados esperados. Gracias a su dedicacin y trabajo ha podido brindarles a sus hijos la educacin necesaria, que sin esta actividad hubiera sido imposible.

En estos momentos Miguel requiere de un prstamo por la cantidad de $ 250 DLLS, mismos que invertir en la compra de ms mercanca para poder de esta forma incrementar sus ventas. Aydalo, el necesita de tu generosidad, no lo dudes ms, l y su familia te lo van a agradecer.

loan.use: purchase merchandise

loan.name: Juana

texts.en:
Four years ago Juana started selling used clothing from her home, following the necessity for an income that would purchase school supplies and pay the tuition of her two children, that with her husband's salary would not be possible. First she asked her family for coothes that she could use to sell, something that later evolved into purchasing package lots of clothes. Thanks to the support of her family, Juana still manages her business, always motivated by the enormous wish to provide her children with a better quality of life and future, something that she could only give them through an education, an education she did not have.

Now she needs to purchase two package lots of clothes, as she has run out of merchandise to sell. She also wants to start selling in the local markets to increase her earnings. For all of this she is requesting a loan of $200 that she plans to repay in a term of 3 months. You can become an important part of the efforts of Juana and her family. Do not wait, the decision is in your hands. She will sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace 4 aos Juana comenz a vender ropa usada en su domicilio, tras la necesidad de contar con ingresos que le permitieran pagar los tiles escolares y colegiaturas de sus dos hijos, pues con el sueldo de su esposo esto era imposible. Primero pidi a sus familiares ropa que la no les sirviera para comenzar a vender, luego de un tiempo comenz a comprar pacas de ropa. Gracias al apoyo de su familia, Juana continua con su proyecto, siempre impulsada por el enorme deseo de brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida futura y esto slo puede logarlo proporcionandoles la educacin que ella no tuvo.

Ahora ella necesita comprar dos pacas de ropa, pues ya no tiene mercanca que ofrecer, adems que comenzar a vender en los mercados rodantes para aumentar sus ingresos. Para esto esta solicitando un crdito de $ 200 DLLS, mismos que planea regresar en un plazo de 3 mese. Tu puedes convertirte en parte importante de los logros de Juana y su familia, no lo dudes ms, la decisin esta en sus manos, ella te lo va a agradece sinceramente.

loan.use: purchase merchandise

loan.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a very active and entrepreneurial woman, and of course, an excellent mother and wife. Two years ago they started to experience financial difficulties in their home. Her husband was working in a carpinter shop and his salary was very little, not enough to fill all of their necessities. This is when Patricia came up with the idea to help her husband to set up his very own carpinter shop, with the help of the severance pay received from his previous job. This is how they started their own business, the same that they continue to manage with mutual effort and dedication.

Patricia now needs a loan of $200 to purchase quality wood with which they can make their creations, and this way increase their sales and their earnings. You can help Patricia and her husband and contribute to the well-being of their children. Do not wait, they sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Patricia es una mujer muy activa y emprendedora y por supuesto una excelente madre y esposa. Hace dos aos en su casa comenzaron a tener problemas econmicos, pues su esposo trabajaba en una carpintera y sueldo era muy bajo y por ende insuficiente para satisfacer todas las necesidades. Es por ello que Patricia tuvo la idea de ayudar a su esposo para que pusiera su propio taller de carpintera, ayudndose con el capital que le dieron por el retiro de su antiguo trabajo. Es as como comenzaron con su propio negocio, mismo que an contina con el esfuerzo y dedicacin de ambos.

Ahora Patricia requiere un prstamo de $200 DLLS para comprar madera de calidad con la cual fabrican sus productos, y as poder aumentar sus ventas y por ende sus ganancias. T puedes apoyar a Patricia y a su esposo y contribuir al bienestar de sus hijos, no lo dudes ms, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loan.use: purchase wood

loan.name: Monica Veronica

texts.en:
Monica is mother of a little one of 3 years of age, is married and lives in the city of Monterrey in the State of Neuvo Leon. She has always been an enterprising woman, which is why when her husband faced problems, she started to save some of their income to invest and start selling shoes by catalogue. This is how she was able to help him and how she was able to provide a better quality of life for their son. It has already been one year since she started her business and the extra income has been of great help.

Monica now requires a loan in the amount of $200, which she will use to fill the orders she has received and has not been able to honor due to her lack of liquid capital. You can help her continue supporting her family. The decision is yours, do not wait. She and her family sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Mnica es madre de un pequeito de 3 aos, es casada y vive en la comunidad de Monterrey, en el Estado de Nuevo Len. Ella siempre a sido una persona muy emprendedora, es por ello que al ver que su esposo comenzaba a tener problemas con su salario, ella comenz a designar parte del gasto que l le daba para invertirlo en la ventad e zapatos por catlogo, y de esta manera ayudarlo y poder brindar a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida. Ya es un ao de que inici con este proyecto y los ingresos extras que recibe gracias a este les ha sido de mucha ayuda.

Ahora Mnica requiere de un prstamo por la cantidad de $ 200 DLLS, mismos que utilizar para poder surtir unos pedidos que tiene pendientes, por faltad e capital en este momento T puedes ayudarla a continuar ayudando a su familia, la decisin esta en tus manos, no lo dudes ms, ella y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loan.use: purchase merchandise

loan.name: Nohemi Elizabeth

texts.en:
Nohemi is mother of two children and is married. She lives in the city of Monterrey, Nuevo Leon. Her husband is a driver and his earnings are not enough to cover all of the family expenses, which is why four years ago she started her small busienss selling hot dogs from her home. Soon thereafter, with the help of her husband she was able to buy a hot dog cart and she started selling her product at local markets. Thansk to her efforts and dedication she has been able to help her family.

Today she requires a loan in the amount of $550 to purchase a larger hot dog cart and consequently offer a better service and carry a greater quantity of products, to meet the high demand that she is currently seeing. With your generosity you can help Nohemi and her family. Do not wait, she and her family thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Nohemi es madre de 2 hijos y es casada, vive en la localidad de Monterrey, Nuevo Len. Su esposo es chofer forneo y con lo que gana no es suficiente para cubrir todos los gastos familiares, es por ello que ya hace 4 aos Nohemi tuvo la idea de comenzar con pequeo negocio propio, la elaboracin y venta de hot dogs en su propio domicilio. Luego con la ayuda de su marido pudo comprar un carrito pequeo para vender su producto en los mercados rodantes. Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicacin ella ha logrado ayudar mucho a su familia.

En este momento, ella requiere de un prstamo por la cantidad de $ 550 DLLS para poder comprar un carro ms grande y ofrecer un mejor servicio y una mayor cantidad de productos, dada la fuerte demanda que esta experimentando. T con tu generosidad puedes apoyar a Nohemi y su familia, no lo dudes ms, ella y su familia te lo agradecen.

loan.use: purchase car for hot dogs

loan.name: Iva

texts.en: Mrs Iva T. is a 62 year old lady that joined SPBD in April 2006. Iva is the only lady in the wheelchair in SPBDs program in Samoa. She was in her wheelchair in her late thirties, due to mistreating at the hospital. She was awarded second price in our savings progam in 2006. Iva ia a happy lady like any other normal lady, but with the fact that she cant walk no more, she is not giving up in trying to develop her family. Ive visited Ivas home up the mountain, and from there, It had a clear picture of Iva when she was strong. Shes got a beautiful garden in front of her house, and a vegetable garden at her backyard. Due to the fact that she can no longer work in her gardens, she decided to start a business that she can do, which she chooses Elei Printing. Elei printing is a man made Samoan type of printing that is highly demanded by Samoan staying in Samoa and especially the Samoans staying overseas. After 4 months of starting her business, Iva realized that her business was becoming really successful, due to more demand from her local customers, because of the good quality and neat printings.

loan.use: Loan was used to buy materials, fabric paint and glitters, brushes, carved timber for printing.

payment.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loan.name: Fuatai

texts.en: Fuatai S. is a 63 year old lady, and she joined SPBD in April 2006, with he first loan of $300.00. Fuatai is now on her 4th loan and she never had problems with her repayment. Shes a very creative and talented lady. That enjoys trying out new ideas of creating stuffs. Before joining SPBD, she already had her variety shop, where she spends all her time looking after. Apart from every other product that you can find in any other shop, you can be amazed with other interesting products that Fuatai makes that she also sells in her shop i.e. Samoan Oil that is made from the Mosooi flower, which is quite famous with Samoans. She also makes S. Cocoa, that is used to make tea. With the Europeans, coffe is what they have for morning tea, but with the Samoan, their coffee is Samoan Cocoa, which we believe gives ua strength for the whole day.Well, you may think that its cheap because its a local product, but its not, for a bottle of Nescafe maybe costs you about $10.00, but for one pack of Samoan Cocoa costs $7.00, and believe it or not, this can only last for half a day. Fuatai also sells clothes that she sew, but mainly school uniform for the kids. Other stuffs she sells, are coconuts, bananas, taro, guavas that she collects from her husbands plantation, and fresh flowers that she picks from her garden. She also do bouquet of flowers for church decorations, weddings etc. With her forth loan now, shes planning on extending her business selling live chickens and pigs.

loan.use: Restock her shop and home improvement

loan.name: Rosemary

She is a dedicated client of LAPO. She says that with a loan of $350, her business will be able to expand.

texts.en: Mrs. Dolly E. is a 48-years-old woman with three children, who lives in Benin city of Edo State in Nigeria. She underwent formal training for about six months before she finally opened her own business in 1985. "I will be glad if the loan requested is being granted to me," she says.

texts.en: Mrs. Helen O. is 38 years old with three children and has been a LAPO member for five years. She acquired formal training for 3 years before she finally opened her business in 1995. She will be grateful if the requested amount is approved for her.

texts.en: Mrs. Eunice O. is a 55-year-old married woman with seven children. She lives in Benin city, Edo state of Nigeria. She acquired one year of formal training before she opened her own business in 1987. She promises to expand her business if loaned the above amount.

loan.use: To buy more goods for sale.

texts.en: A 32-year-old woman, married with four children, Dorcas I. lives in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She sells provisions and drinks to the community. She promises to increase her business with the above amount.
