texts.en: Mrs. Itohan Erinmwinorose is a 45-year-old woman with two children who has acquired one year training in her business. She lives in Benin city, Edo state of Nigeria. She plans to expand her business with the money she has requested.

loan.use: To buy more kerosene for sale

loan.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Mrs. Dorcas Ikhimwin is a 46-year-old woman who has been in LAPO for 6 years. She lives in Benin city, Edo state of Nigeria. She plans to expand her business with the money she has requested.

loan.use: To buy more foodstuffs.

loan.name: Esther

texts.en: Mrs. Esther I. sells foodstuffs, a business she started 3 years ago. She is 40 years old. She emphasizes the impact of a LAPO loan for her business and is hoping to expand her business with the above amount.

loan.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loan.name: Grace

texts.en: Mrs. Grace A. is 55 years married with four children. She has been in LAPO for 4 years and is also a member of the LAPO group in Benin City. She trades in drinks. She hopes to expand her business if loaned the money.

loan.use: To buy more drinks and a deep freeze

loan.name: Maria

texts.en: Mrs. Maria I. is 56 years old. She is a specialist in the milling of grains, a business she started thirteen years ago. She is eager to expand her business with a loan of $500.

loan.use: To improve her business

loan.name: Nosa

texts.en: Mrs. Nosa O. is 39 years old, and is married with two children. She sells provisions to the community. She is from Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She needs the stated amount to improve her business.

loan.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loan.name: Tina

texts.en: "I am proud to be a LAPO client," says Mrs. Tina O.. She is 26 years old, and is married with four children. She sells local drinks for the community. She is from Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She says if she is loaned the above amount, her business will improve tremendously.

loan.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loan.name: Mary

texts.en:
"LAPO has brought light to my business and my family," says Mrs. Mary O.. She is 22 years old and married with 3 children. They live in Benin City located in the state of Edo in Nigeria.

She specializes in hairdressing and she is eager to use the loan to expand her hairdressing business.

loan.use: To buy more hair dressing equipment

loan.name: Ogbonmwan

texts.en:
Mrs. I. Ogbonmwan says that life has become sweet and enjoyable since she became a LAPO member 8 years ago. She hopes to improve her business with the loan that she has requested.

38 year old Mrs. Ogbonmwan and her 5 children live in Benin City, located in the Edo State of Nigeria.

loan.use: To buy more hair dressing equipment.

loan.name: Queen

texts.en: Mrs. Queen O. is 40 years old, married and has 4 children. Her business trades provisions to the community. She is eager to expand her business with the requested loan amount.

loan.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loan.name: Emil

texts.en: Emil was born in 1982 year in Sumgait. After military service he could not continue his education. Because the family condition was very heavy. He is 24 years old. Emil has rented very small place near the market, has been busy with program service of mobile phones and sales of phone accessories. He do not have enough funds and he wants first loan from KIVA, to develop his business well enough. He applies for the loan $700 to expand his business area.

loan.use: To expand his business area

loan.name: Osagiduwa

texts.en: "LAPO has brought rain to my financial desert ever since I became a member," says Mrs. Osagiduwa O.. She is 34 years old with 6 children. Her business specializes in selling cooked food to the community. She is from an urban area of Bini in Nigeria.

loan.use: To buy more food items

loan.name: Shafiqa

texts.en: Shafiqa is 45 years old. She lives in District 2, Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married and a mother of 5 children. Two years ago, with the support of one of her friends, she opened a beauty shop to support her family and cover household expenses but mainly to give her children a better standard of living and the security to help them finish their professional studies. She continues with her business thanks to her effort and the support of her family.

loan.use: To buy materials for her shop

loan.name: Rita

texts.en: "I started this business years ago and it has helped me take care of my family. I know how to safe guard my capital to ensure business continuity." says Mrs. Rita O.. She is requesting a loan of $400 to expand her business.

loan.use: To buy more provisions

loan.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Mrs. Elizabeth I., a 58 years old caterer lives on one of the historic streets of Benin City. She specializes in sale of provisions for people in her community. She plans to improve her business with the requested loan of at least $400.

loan.use: To buy more provisions

loan.name: Nasima

texts.en:
Nasima is 35 years old and a mother of 6 children, living in District 2, Kabul, Afghanistan.
It is almost 3 years that she has been working in her shop baking bread and selling to the bazaar
She hopes to receive a loan through AFSG so she can buy wood and flour and find good income through this business.

loan.use: To buy wood and flour

loan.name: Queen

texts.en: "LAPO has brought rain to my financial desert ever since I became a member," says Mrs. Queen O.. She is 34 years old and has 3 children. She specializes in the sale of records to the community. She is from an urban area of bini.

loan.use: To buy more records

loan.name: Williams

texts.en: "I started this business years ago and it has helped me take care of my family. I know how to safe guard my capital to ensure continuity in business." says Mr. Williams A.. He is requesting a loan of $500 to expand his business.

loan.use: Buy more medicine to sell.

loan.name: Stella

texts.en: Mrs. Stella N., a 38 years old woman sells food items to people in her community in Nigeria. She is proud of her business and promises to effectively use the above amount to expand the business.

loan.use: To buy more food items for sale

loan.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Mrs. Queen Egharevba is married with 8 children. She has benefited from a LAPO loan since 2000. She is from Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She plans to increase her furniture business if granted the loan.

loan.use: Buy more wood for furniture for sale

loan.name: Queen

texts.en: Mrs. Queen E. is married with 8 children. She has benefited from a LAPO loan since 2000. She is from Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She plans to increase her furniture business if granted the loan.

loan.use: To buy more wood for sale

loan.name: Florence

texts.en: Mrs. Florence Restaurant, a 51 years old caterer from a historic area of Benin City, specializes in providing special food for people in her community. She plans to improve her business with a minimum loan of $500.

loan.use: To buy more ingredients for cooking

loan.name: Maria

texts.en: Mrs. Maria I. is 32 years old. She is a trader who deals in building material. She has had this business for 7 years. She is a dedicated LAPO client and also she needs $500 to improve her business.

loan.use: To buy more materials for sale

loan.name: Agnes

texts.en: Mrs. Agnes I. sells food provisions, a business she started 2 years ago. She is 39 years old. She emphasized the impact of LAPO loan in her business and hopes to expand her business with the above amount.

loan.use: Sale of food items

loan.name: Abieyuwa

texts.en: Mrs. Abieyuwa U. is a delighted LAPO member, who is happy to be in LAPO family. She designs and makes clothes for people in her community. She is 38 years old, married with 3 children. She is eager to expand her business and requests a loan of the above amount.

loan.use: To improve her fashion home

loan.name: Roseline

texts.en: A LAPO group leader, Mrs. Roseline E. is 43. She started her business in 1991. She is a popular plantain seller in her community in Nigeria. She plans to improve her business with the above amount.

loan.use: To improve her business

loan.name: Happy

texts.en: Happy lives in Vituka area of Dar es Salaam.She is married with two children. She owns a small tailoring mart and employs two assistants. She has had training in entrepreneurship and small business management from Youth Self Emloyment Foundation (YOSEFO). Happy has a plan to expand her business.She needs to add two sewing machines,employ one more assistant and increase the stock of sewing materials.This business expansion will help her increase income thus meet the needs of her family including school fees for her children.

loan.use: Purchasing sewing materials

loan.name: Salum

texts.en: Salum is married with two children.He lives in Vituka area of Dar es Salaam where he owns a small shop in Tandika market in which he sells new imported clothes. He has been in this business for more than six years. He had training in entrepreneurship and small business management offered by Youth Self Employment (YOSEFO). To meet the rising demand for his clothing, he is planning to open another shop adjacent of the current one. The current shop has a small displaying surface, making it difficult to display all samples of clothes in stock. The new shop will help him keep enough stock of clothes so that he will no longer go out of stock on a frequent basis and add the display surface he needs.

loan.use: ADDING STOCK OF CLOTHES

loan.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa lives in Makangarawe area of Dar es Salaam.She is married with three children.Two are in primary school and one is in secondary school.Hawa owns a shop selling different consumable items,especially food .She plans to expand her business by adding a stock of Cereals,Maize Flour,Beans,Rice,Millet,Cassava Flour and Groundnuts.Limited with her narrow capital base,Hawa fails to cope with demand from her clients.She sees this as a lost opportunity,which need to be utilized.She is in need USD 550 to facilitate her plan.

loan.use: ADDING STOCK OF CEREALS,MAIZE FLOUR,BEANS,RICE,MILLET,CASSAVA FLOUR AND GROUNDNUTS

loan.name: Raul

texts.en:
For two years, Ral M. has been the owner of an electronics repair shop in which he fixes televisions, stereos, and household appliances. He is a very hardworking, entrepreneurial person. He is requesting a loan of $1200.00 to buy replacement electronic parts and tools. He plans to pay back the amount over the period of one year.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Ral M. cuenta desde hace 2 aos con un taller de electrnica en el cual arregla televisores, stereos y aparatos electrodomesticos, el es una persona muy emprendedora solicita un prstamo para compra de refacciones y herramientas, el importe que el esta solicitando es por $1200.00 Dllrs los cuales piensa pagar en un ao.

loan.use: Buy electronic parts and tools.

loan.name: Victor

texts.en:
Mr. Vctor Martnez has owned a carpentry shop for more than 2 years, and business has gone very well. This year he plans to grow his business and in order to do this he would like to buy new machinery so he can provide better services to his clients. He is requesting $1200.00, which he plans to pay back within a period of one year.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Vctor Martnez, cuenta con una carpintera desde hace mas de 2 aos y en la cual a funcionado muy bien pero dentro de sus proyectos de este ao esta el de crecer por lo que piensa adquirir nueva maquinaria para asi poder dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes el solicita $1200.00 Dllrs y piensa pagarlos en un plazo de 1 ao.

loan.use: Buy machinery.

loan.name: Suepasi

texts.en: Suepasi is a married lady with 7 children, all attending district schools due to cheaper of school fees. With her first loan in January 2004, she has developed her taro plantation, which is their main source of income that is financing her childrens education. She can now also afford to bring her children to the National Hospital in town where her children are been given good medications that are not available in the village. Suepasis husband is her right hand with the business, hes the one responsible for selling taro twice a week, mainly on Friday and Saturday.

loan.use: Buy chemicals, weed killer and fertilizer. Home Improvement

loan.name: Ita

texts.en:
ITA M.
Mrs M. is married with 5 children.She started with the $100 loan to start a business of Elei and Printing materials.She has the talent of printing, and thinking of having a business but shes lack of finance support to start with.Since she joined SPBD, then she got a big help in starting her business by buying paintings, clitters, materials and upeti (woods which already printed to lie on the materials for printings).She used to sell puletasi, t-shirts, ie-lavalava(printed materials) at flea markets and also for people who travel overseas.Shes also got help for house improvement, like repairing the roof of her house and add some space at the back of it.So, for her next loan which is $650 she need to build a special room for running her business and buy more stuffs like clitters which is the most expensive equipment and printed woods for the particular business.She is still happy to join to the SPBD program in the future, because she believed it helped her the most in financial support of her family.

loan.use: Buy paintings,clitters,materials & printed woods.

loan.name: Sergey

texts.en:
Sergey is married. He makes his living in the small electrical appliance trade. Sergeys entrepreneurial talent and sociable nature have been a real help as hes started his own business. Currently he offers a variety of household electric appliances, fans, heaters, blenders, wiring accessories, electrical switches, etc. After becoming a client of Nadiya Ukraine, his business has seen considerable growth. Financial assistance from Nadiya Ukraine has given Sergey an opportunity to purchase a spacious pavilion where he stores and sells his inventory. Currently Sergeys net sales profit amounts to 40% which helps create stable expansion for his business. A cheerful disposition and active position in life have helped him succeed in business and find his market niche. Sergey is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase electric devices and a variety of associated components. The favorable location of his business in one of the busy local markets and a wide range of high-quality electric equipment help attract many potential customers. Sergey also has a hobby hes a beekeeper. Its a rewarding hobby for him. Not only do the bees produce honey and beeswax, but they serve as pollinators for crops grown in the local area. He is planning to re-invest profits gained from selling electric devices into his bee farming.

- . . . , , , , , . , . , . 40%, . . 1200 , . . . . , . , , , .

loan.use: To increase inventory

loan.name: Alafat

texts.en: Alafat is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin. She settled with his family in Sumgait city. She is 44. She vidow and has 1 child. Alafat has lost the husband in war. Not looking all difficulties in current of 14 years she has grown up the child one. She applies for the loan $500 to increase the good assortments.

loan.use: To increase the good assortments

loan.name: Ruhulla

texts.en: Ruhulla has been engaged in this business for 4 years. He is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin region, settled in Sumgait city. He has his own shop. He is married and has 3 children. This 43-year-old man is hard worker. 3 year ago he built the shop. Than he has bought foodstuffs: sugar, tea, rice and etc. Now he wants loan amount of $500 to increase the good assortments and buy the new refrigerator.

loan.use: To increase the good assortments and buy the new refrigerator

loan.name: Tester

texts.en: test

loan.use: test

loan.name: Ilham

texts.en: Ilham is married and has 2 children. He is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin. His earnings are not enough to cover all of the family expenses. That is why four years ago he started his small busienss selling hamburger from her home. Today Ilham is busy with production and sale of lahmachun. Now he demands, the loan in quantity $400 to rent cafe and carry a greater quantity of products, to meet the high demand. You can help Ilham and his family.

loan.use: To rent cafe and carry a greater quantity of products, to meet the high demand
